Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: These are dark times, there is no denying. Our world has perhaps faced no greater threat than it does today. But I say this to our citizenry: we, ever your servants, continue to defend your liberty and repel the forces that would seek to take it from you. Your Ministry remains strong...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hermione. Your tea is ready, dear.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Coming, Mum. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Don’t you look lovely. All packed?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Are you sure these biscuits are sugar-free?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Quite sure, dear. See the big bold letters that say ‘Sugar Free’? Dead giveaway.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Mm. Yes. (passing Hermione) Hello, kitten. Don’t you look lovely.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ... the bandicoot has small pointed ears and a long snout from which it emits a distinctive trumpet sound when agitated...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Darling, don’t be suspicious the biscuits taste so good, be grateful the company’s so clever...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Obliviate. Mrs. Granger’s face goes briefly slack and she reaches out, as if to break a fall, then, slowly, her hand drops, coming to rest upon her husband’s. He blinks once, blankly, and then... enfolds her fingers in his.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Goodbye.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What are those? Mr. Weasley turns, sees Ron standing in the doorway.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Close the door.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ... comes to us this evening from the north of England, where a wizard family by the name of Westinburgh were found dead in their cellar. While not a member of the Order, Mr. Westinburgh and his wife had, on numerous occasions, provided shelter for its members...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: These are for the Order. So many are on the run now, it helps them to stay connected with the rest of us. Know they’re not alone...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: C’mon. Mum’s got dinner ready.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Severus. I was beginning to worry you’d lost your way. Come. I’ve saved you a seat. VOLDEMORT grins, silhouetted against the fire, and gestures to the seat nearest his own. All eyes follow Snape, all except DRACO MALFOY, who nervously stares at the body above and a haggard LUCIUS MALFOY, who merely stares vaguely at his wand while his wife NARCISSA looks straight ahead.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You know our hosts, of course, Severus. Narcissa in particular has been most hospitable. Lucius, on the other hand, is, I fear, burdened by my presence. Are you, Lucius?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: My lord?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Are you burdened?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: My lord is always welcome here. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You bring news I trust, Severus?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It will happen Saturday next. At nightfall.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And this information comes --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: -- from the source we discussed. Yaxley, the wizard seen at the Ministry, leans into the flickering light from the opposite end of the table.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I have heard differently, my lord. Dawlish, the Auror, let slip that the Potter boy will not be moved until the thirtieth of this month, the night before he turns seventeen.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: This is a false trail. The Auror Office no longer plays any part in the protection of Harry Potter. Those closest to him believe we have infiltrated the Ministry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, they’ve got that right, then, ‘aven’t they? As the Squat Man cackles wheezily, others join in.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Pius, what say you? PIUS THICKNESSE looks up, his gaze placid.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: One hears many things, my lord. Whether the truth is among them is not clear. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Spoken like a true politician. You will, I think, prove most useful, Pius. Where will he be taken? The boy?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: To a safehouse. Likely the home of someone in the Order. I’m told it has been given every manner of protection possible. Once there, it will be impractical to attack him. We may have compromised the Ministry, but there are those who remain loyal to him. As long as the Ministry stands, his allies within will have the means at their disposal to insure his safety.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: My lord, if I might, I’d like to volunteer myself for this task. I’d like to kill the boy. Just then a WAIL rises from the floorboards. Voldemort’s eyes flash briefly with RED.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wormtail! Have I not spoken to you about keeping our guest quiet?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes, m-my lord. Right away, my lord. As WORMTAIL scrambles up, Voldemort returns his gaze to

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: As inspiring as I find your bloodlust, Bellatrix, I must be the one to kill Harry Potter. But I face an unfortunate complication. It has recently come to my attention that my wand and Potter’s share the same core.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Come now. Surely one of you would like the honor? What about... you, Lucius?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I require your wand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Do I detect elm?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes, my lord.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And the core?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Dragon -- dragon heartstring.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: My wand? You can’t possibly think I would give you my wand. Lucius’ eyes meet Voldemort’s. For a moment he is speechless. Finally his chin drops.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No, my lord.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: For those of you who do not know, we are joined tonight by Miss Charity Burbage who until recently taught at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Her specialty was Muggle studies. It is Miss Burbage’s belief that Muggles are not so different from us. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Severus, please. We’re friends... Snape’s face remains impassive. Voldemort’s eyes narrow to scarlet slits... his voice HISSES. Draco watches a teardrop strike the table...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Avada Kedavra! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Nagini... Dinner.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Come now, Dudley. Hurry up!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Time for the teary farewell.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’ve lived in this house twenty years. And now -- in a single night -- I’m expected to leave.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: They’ll torture you. Even Dudley. If they think you know where I’m going, they’ll stop at noth-- (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You think I don’t know that? You think I don’t know what they’re capable of? Her eyes pierce Harry’s.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You didn’t just lose a mother that night in Godric’s Hollow, you know. I lost a sister.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Do you have any? Magic?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What a cruel thing to ask.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, this is goodbye then, boy. Harry, standing by the front door, nods, eyes Petunia, who sits in the front passenger seat, a ghost behind the glass.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I don’t understand. Isn’t he coming with us?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Who?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Absolutely not.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Why?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, because -- he doesn’t want to, do you, boy? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Absolutely not. Besides, I’m just a waste of space. Isn’t that right, Vernon? Uncle Vernon stares hard at Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Come on, Dudley, we’re off.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I don’t think you’re a waste of space.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well... thanks.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (under his breath) See you, Big D.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Good riddance. His eyes shift. The last rays of sunlight lay, like a stain, upon a SMALL CUPBOARD DOOR below the stairs. He lets the rucksack slip from his shoulder. Sets down the cage.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: All righ’, ‘arry? Yeh look fit.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah, he’s ruddy gorgeous. What say we get undercover before someone murders him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I thought you were looking after the Prime Minister, Kingsley.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’re more important.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hello, Harry. Bill Weasley.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wasn’t always this handsome. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Dead ugly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (smiling; to Harry) True enough. Owe it all to a werewolf by name of Greyback. Hope to repay the favor one day.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (a kiss to the cheek) You are still beautiful to me, William.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Just remember, Fleur, once you’re married: Bill takes his steaks on the raw side now.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: My husband, the joker. By the way, wait until you hear the news! Remus and I are --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: All right, all right! You’ll all have time for a cozy catch-up later! We’ve got to get the hell out of here and soon! Moody drops some SACKS at his feet. Turns to Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Potter, you’re underage, which means you’ve still got the Trace on you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The Trace?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You sneeze and the Ministry will know who wipes your nose. Point is, we have to use those means of transport the Trace can’t detect: brooms, thestrals and the like. We’ll go in pairs. That way if anyone’s out there waiting for us -- and I reckon there will be -- they won’t know which Harry Potter is the real one.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The real one...? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I believe you’re familiar with this particular brew.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No! Absolutely not!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (a sigh) I told you he’d take it well.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: If you think I’m going to let people risk their lives for me --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Never done that before, have we?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: This is different. Taking that. Becoming me -- no.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, none of us really fancy it, mate.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah, imagine if something went wrong and we were stuck as scrawny, specky gits forever.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Everyone here’s of age, Potter, and they’ve all agreed to take the risk.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Technically, I’ve been coerced. (turning to Harry and extending his hand)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Nip it, Mundungus! All right, Granger, as discussed.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Blimey, Hermione! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Straight in here, if you please. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: For those of you who haven’t taken Polyjuice Potion before, fair warning. It tastes like goblin piss.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Have a lot of experience with that, do you, Mad-Eye? Moody’s eye rotates menacingly onto Fred.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Just trying to defuse the tension.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Not yet you aren’t. Moody pulls the ties on the SACKS and pulls out SEVEN

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Don’t have something a bit more sporty, do you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes, don’t fancy this color at all.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Fancy this: You’re not you, so shut it and strip. (to Harry) You’ll need to change too, Potter. Harry, a bit self-consciously, begins to strip down. The others, meanwhile, appear unconcerned to be exposing Harry’s body.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Bill, look away -- I’m ‘ideous. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (smirking) I knew Ginny was lying about that tattoo. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (wobbling a bit) Harry, your eyesight really is awful.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Blimey. I almost forgot.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Right then. We’ll be pairing off. Each Potter will have a protector. As for you, Harry...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The real Harry! Where the devil are you, anyway?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Here. Moody’s eye rotates onto the real Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’ll ride with Hagrid.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Brought yeh here sixteen years ago when you were barely bigger than a Bowtruckle. Seems only righ’ I should be the one ter take yeh away.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah, it’s all very touching. Let’s go. As they file out, grabs his rucksack and ponders Hedwig in her cage. He snaps open the wire door and she flutters out, swoops down the hallway and soars out the open door. Harry glances once more down the hall, at the cupboard under the stairs, then exits. He HOLD ON Hedwig’s empty cage.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Good luck, everyone. On the count of three. One... two --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hagrid! We’ve got to help the others!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Can’t do it, ‘arry. My job’s ter get you where we’re goin’ safe ‘n sound -- Mad-Eye’s orders! Before Harry can reply, FOUR DEATH EATERS jet out of the darkness, robes snapping in the wind. As one, their wands rise. Hagrid slams his hand onto a PURPLE BUTTON. With an EAR-SHATTERING BLAST, the motorbike quivers and FLAMES BELCH from the exhaust pipe. The Death Eaters SCREAM, robes afire, and pinwheel away, freefalling towards the earth.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What was that?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Dragon fire! More DEATH EATERS SWOOP from the sky, give chase. Hagrid DIVES, plummeting for the ground, trying desperately to shake them. Harry watches the earth rushing towards them, grimacing as the bike...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: That’s him! The real one! The remaining Death Eaters fall back and disappear.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hol’ tight, ‘arry! We’ve got ter get yeh out of here!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hagrid... HAGRID...!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Avada... Abruptly, Harry’s arm rises as if on a string, drawn up by the wand trembling in his hand. GOLD FIRE spits forth and -- Crack! -- SPARKS skitter up the chassis of the motorbike. Harry wheels and -- for a split second -- is face to face with Voldemort, whose eyes drift, staring -- with something like fear -- at Harry’s wand. Then -- whoosh! -- Voldemort peels backward and away, evaporating like smoke. Just then... ... the motorbike’s engine HICCUPS and Hagrid and Harry begin to drop. PUTT... PUTT... PUTT...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry! Hagrid! What happened?! Have you seen the others?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Is no one back yet?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, thank goodness you two are all right. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Haven’t go’ any brandy, have yeh, Molly? Fer medicinal purposes?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Oh my God! George!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The house! Quickly!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: My boy! My darling boy! What’ve they done to you?!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Remus! What’re you doing!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What creature sat in the corner the first time that Harry Potter visited my office at Hogwarts!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Are you mad...? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: WHAT CREATURE!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: A grindylow!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We’ve been betrayed. Voldemort knew you were being moved tonight. I had to make sure you weren’t an imposter.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Who did this to him?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Snape. (nodding to George) He’ll be fine, Molly. But that’s Dark Magic. The damage is done.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Someone else is back.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The last words Albus Dumbledore spoke to the pair of us?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ‘Harry is the best hope we have. Trust him.’ Shacklebolt lowers his wand, wheels on Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What gave you away?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hedwig -- I think. She was trying to protect me -- (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hey ya -- Well... thanks.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Deserves that. Brilliant, he was. Wouldn’t be standing here without him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Really?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (breaking free of her) Always the tone of surprise.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Are we the last? Where’s George? Suddenly... silence. Mr. Weasley eyes all, turns to Lupin.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Remus. Where’s my son?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: How do you feel, Georgie?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Saint-like.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Come again?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Saint-like... You see, I’m holy. Holey, Fred, geddit? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: With the whole wide world of ear- related humor at your disposal, you go for holey? Pathetic.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Reckon I’m still better-looking than you. Better-looking than Bill, that’s for sure. Bill doesn’t smile. Next to him, Fleur looks equally grim.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Mad-Eye’s dead. The room goes still.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Mundungus took one look at

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Mad-Eye reckoned You-Know-Who would expect the real Harry to be with the most skilled Auror. He knew he’d be in the most danger.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It doesn’t explain how they knew we were moving Harry tonight. The room grows quiet. Eyes shift.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wha’? One of us? Tha’s mad. I’d wager me life it wasn’ none of you lot. An’ if it was me I’d kno’, wouldn’ I? Talk in me sleep on occasion, I’ll admit, but there’s only Fang aroun’ ter hear an’ mostly it’s gibberish an’ besides I’d cut me tongue out ‘fore ‘d betray ‘arry e’en in me dreams --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wha’s so funny!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I trust you with my life, Hagrid. I trust everyone in this room. Understood? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Understood.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ‘Ear, ‘ear.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Better. 32 OMITTED 32

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You lied to me, Ollivander!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No! No! I believed a different wand would work, I swear!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Then explain this!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: But it makes no sense...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Perhaps our friend’s loyalties lie elsewhere, Wormtail. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No! There must be a way! I’ll think of something else!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I hope so, Ollivander, for your sake. I won’t be so forgiving next time...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Going somewhere?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No one else is going to die. Not for me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: For you? You think Madeye died for you? You think George took that curse for you? You may be the Chosen One, mate, but this is a whole lot bigger than that.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Come with me. Now.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And leave Hermione? Are you mad? We wouldn’t last two days without her. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (glancing around) Don’t tell her I said that. (back to Harry) Besides, you’ve still got the Trace on you. And there’s the wedding...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wedding?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Bill and Fleur. Mum’s been planning it for months. Only thing that’s kept her sane, I reckon. She’ll kill me if I miss it. Kill you too. Rather go face to face with You-Know-Who if I’m honest.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I don’t care about a bloody wedding -- no matter whose it is. I have to start searching for the Horcruxes. It’s the only chance we have to beat him. And the longer we wait the stronger he gets.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Tonight’s not the night, mate. You’d only be doing him a favor.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Do you think he knows?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I mean, they’re bits of his soul, the Horcruxes. Bits of him. When

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What I’m saying is, if we do this thing right, if we find the Horcruxes and begin to destroy them one by one...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Won’t he know he’s being hunted? Still Harry says nothing. Silence descends once more, then:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: All together now!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: One. Two. Three! The silk rises, pitching itself into a perfect wedding marquee, trembling wondrously in the morning breeze... then collapses.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Were you going to tell me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And Ron and Hermione. They’ll not be going back to Hogwarts either?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I see.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Zip me up, will you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Seems silly, doesn’t it? A wedding. Given everything that’s going on.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Maybe that’s the best reason to have it. Because of everything that’s going on. Her chin turns, coming into profile, her face very close. Then she folds into him and they are kissing. Long. Deep.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Morning.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: How’s it look on your end, boys? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Brilliant! Just then, the silk snaps and the trees in the surrounding orchard shiver in a rush of wind. Everyone steps clear of the marquee and watches a TALL WIZARD with GRIZZLED HAIR and SCARRED CHEEK materialize. RUFUS

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Bloody hell, what’s the Minister of Magic doing here?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Dunno. But something tells me he didn’t come to give away the bride.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: To what do we owe the pleasure, Minister?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I think we both know the answer to that question, Mr. Potter.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And this would be...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Don’t be coy, Mr. Potter. Mr. Weasley. Would you say you were close to your former Headmaster?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Dumbledore? And me? I dunno. I reckon I was just another Weasley to him. He was always polite --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And you, Miss Granger? How would you characterize your relationship? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We were friendly, not close like Harry, but --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What’s this all about?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: This. Despite the fact that neither of your friends appear to have been particularly close to their recently deceased Headmaster, he saw fit to remember them in his will. Now why do you suppose that would be? Harry, Ron and Hermione exchange glances again.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No idea.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Come now, you don’t expect me to believe...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ‘Herein is set forth the Last Will and Testament of Albus Percival Wulfric Brian Dumbledore. First, to Ronald Bilius Weasley, I leave my Deluminator, a device of my own making, in the hope that -- when things seem most dark -- it will show him the light.’

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wicked. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ‘To Miss Hermione Jean Granger, I leave my copy of The Tales of Beedle the Bard, in the hope that she will find it entertaining and instructive.’

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Mum used to read me those! The Wizard and the Hopping Pot, Babbitty Rabbity and her Cackling Stump...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Oh, c’mon! Beedle’s stories are famous! Babbity Rabbitty? No...? Scrimgeour eyes Ron with mild annoyance, continues.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ‘To Harry James Potter, I leave the Snitch he caught in his first Quidditch match at Hogwarts, as a reminder of the rewards of perseverance and skill.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: That’s it then?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Not quite. Dumbledore left you a second bequest: The Sword of Godric Gryffindor. Unfortunately, the Sword of Gryffindor was not Dumbledore’s to give away. As an important historical artifact, it belongs...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: To Harry! It belongs to Harry! It chose him! It came to him in the Chamber of Secrets when he most needed it! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The sword may present itself to any worthy Gryffindor, Miss Granger. That does not make it that wizard’s property. And in any event the current whereabouts of the sword are unknown.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The sword is missing. (before Harry can pursue) I won’t pretend to be your friend, Mr. Potter. But I assure you I’m not your enemy.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’ll forgive me, Minister. But it’s a little hard to tell the difference these days.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Where is your guard, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I came alone. I don’t really need them anymore...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We want you to be the godfather.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You mean -- But that’s brilliant -- I... don’t know what to say.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Say yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hello, Harry! LUNA LOVEGOOD approaches in the company of a cross-eyed wizard (XENOPHILIUS LOVEGOOD) with shoulder-length white hair the texture of candy floss. Both wear robes the color of egg yolk.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Oh, I’ve interrupted a deep thought, haven’t I? I can see it growing smaller in your eyes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No, ‘course not. How are you, Luna?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Very well. I was bitten by a garden gnome only moments ago.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Gnome saliva is enormously beneficial! Xenophilius Lovegood. We live just over the hill!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Nice to meet you, sir. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I trust you know, Mr. Potter, that we at The Quibbler, unlike those toadies at the Daily Prophet, fully supported Dumbledore during his lifetime and in his death support you just as fully.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Come, Daddy. Harry doesn’t want to talk to us right now. He’s just too nice to say so. Lovegood’s eyes burn with righteousness, a TRIANGULAR EYE dangling from a chain around his neck. As Luna pulls him away, Harry glances once again across the garden.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ELPHIAS DOGE sits alone, smiling absently as he observes the happy goings-on. Then:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Sir? May I sit down?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Mr. Potter! By all means! In a nervous flutter, Doge pours Harry a goblet of champagne.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I found what you wrote in the Daily Prophet very moving, sir. I take it you knew Professor

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I certainly knew him the longest, if you don’t count his brother Aberforth -- and somehow, people never do seem to count Aberforth.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I never even knew he had a brother, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes, well, Dumbledore was always very private. Even as a boy. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Sir, I was wondering if you’d had much contact with him before he died.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The occasional owl. Though it was strange...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Strange, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It was the owls themselves. They often arrived in distress. It was clear they’d traveled great distances in some cases.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Could you tell me from where they’d come, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’m afraid not. Albus’ messages mostly referenced our days together as schoolboys. They were surprisingly intimate. When he did speak of his current activities his words would turn elliptical. Still, I sensed he was under great stress. Why do you ask?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Just curious. I was... close to Professor Dumbledore.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, he treasured you, Mr. Potter, I can attest to that. I can also tell you that when a person passes, it’s only natural to rue the things left unsaid, to regret the question never asked. I knew Albus nigh on 100 years, but in many ways he will always remain a riddle even to me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Don’t despair, Elphias. I’m told he’s been thoroughly unriddled by Rita Skeeter. In 800 pages no less. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: That woman is a vulture, Muriel, and you well know it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Someone has to pick the bones to get at the truth. I read your obituary, Elphias. Lovely. But you did skate over some of the sticky patches in Dumbledore’s life.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’m sorry you think so, Muriel. I assure you I was writing from the heart.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes, well, Rita Skeeter hasn’t made that mistake, I’m sure. Word has it someone talked to her, someone who knew the Dumbledore family well. You and I both know who that is, Elphias.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: A monstrous betrayal. I can only conclude the rumors are true and that she has become untethered.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Who are you talking about?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, I don’t suppose it’ll be a secret once the book comes out. (relishing the moment) Bathilda Bagshot.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Who?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Who? Bathilda Bagshot! My god, boy, she’s only the most celebrated magical historian of the last century. Don’t they read History of Magic at Hogwarts anymore? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Oh, right. Slipped my mind...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Godric’s Hollow? Bathilda Bagshot lives in Godric’s Hollow?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: For years now. That’s where she first met Dumbledore.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Excuse me? You don’t mean to say

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Of course. The family moved there after his father killed those three Muggles. It was quite the scandal. (eyeing him) Honestly, my boy, are you sure you knew him at all?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The Ministry has fallen. The Minister of Magic is dead. They are coming... The lynx vanishes. A SCREAM shreds the silence. Then: chaos.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Nice meeting you, Mr. Potter! Doge extends his hand toward Harry when -- CRACK! -- he

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Ron! Ron!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry! Go! Go! A HAND REACHES OUT AND GRABS HIS. He looks. It’s Hermione, clutching Ron’s hand with her other. She closes her eyes and a great WHOOSHING SOUND fills Harry’s ears. He takes one last desperate look at Ginny as he is thrown up and back in a WHIRLWIND and all goes BLACK. A HORN BLARES as...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Where are we?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Shaftesbury Avenue. I used to come here to the theater with my mum and dad. Just popped into my head. I don’t know why...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: This way!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We need to change.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: How the ruddy --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Undetectable Extension Charm.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’re amazing, you are.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Always the tone of surprise. As she gives the bag a shake, there is LOUD echoing of heavy objects, as if something has fallen.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: That’ll be the books.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Do you reckon everyone’s alright at the wedding? Maybe we should --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Ron’s right. Cappuccino, please. A gum-chewing WAITRESS stands behind Harry. Ron, clueless when it comes to cappuccinos, nods to Hermione.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What she said.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Same. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wicked scar.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (as she exits) So where do we go from here? The Leaky Cauldron?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Too dangerous. If Voldemort’s taken over the Ministry, none of the old places are safe. The front door SQUEALS and TWO WORKMEN enter, glance idly at the trio and step to the counter.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: My rucksack. With all my things. I left it back at the Burrow --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’re joking.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’ve had the essentials packed for days. Just in case.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: By the way -- these jeans? Not my favorite. Bit tight.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: DOWN! The tile EXPLODES on the wall where Ron’s head had been only seconds before. A rope of green light singes Hermione’s hair.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Stupefy! The JET of RED LIGHT hits the biggest Death Eater straight in the face and he crumples instantly. DEATH EATER #2 Expulsio! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Petrificus Totalus!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Go.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Lock the door, get the lights.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: This one’s name is Rowle. He was on the Astronomy Tower the night

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: This is Dolohov. I recognize him from the wanted posters.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: So what do we do with you, huh? Kill us if it was turned round, wouldn’t you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Suppose it’s him that did Mad-Eye. How would you feel then?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s better we wipe their memories. We kill them, they’ll know we were here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’re the boss. (turning to Hermione) Hermione?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’re the best with spells. Shakily, she points her wand at Dolohov. Her arm trembles.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Obliviate. There is a FLASH OF LIGHT and we --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: How is it they knew we were there?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Maybe you still have the Trace on you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Can’t be. The Trace breaks at seventeen. It’s Wizarding law.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We didn’t celebrate your birthday, Harry. Ginny and I -- we’d prepared a cake. We were going to bring it out at the end of the wedding... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hermione. I appreciate the thought -- honestly. But given that we were almost killed by a couple of Death Eaters a few minutes ago...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Right. Perspective.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We’ve got to get off the streets, get somewhere safe.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I have an idea.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The GAS LAMPS spring to life, illuminating a narrow cobwebbed hallway. The trio glance about, then Harry takes a step forward.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Severus Snape?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Mad-Eye...? Just then a great RUSH OF COLD AIR sweeps through the hallway and the trio’s tongues curl back in their mouths. Some THING shifts in the shadows at the end of the hall, rising from the carpet -- tall, dust-colored and terrible- looking -- then rushes toward them. It’s Dumbledore, but a ghostly, worm-eaten Dumbledore, a corpse come to life, with empty eye sockets and sunken face. It raises its wand and then... EXPLODES in a great cloud of dust, swirling like mist in the corridor, drifting back to the carpet.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What was that about? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Mad-eye’s doing, I’d guess. In case Snape decided to come snooping. Just then, a FLOORBOARD CREAKS. The trio stiffen. Slowly, Hermione draws her wand, peers into the shadows.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Homenum revelio. Nothing. Hermione lowers her wand. Explains.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s a spell to reveal human presence.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We’re alone.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Lumos.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Dear Sirius. Thank you for Harry’s birthday present. You’d think he’d been born on a broom. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: James says he’s got the look of a Seeker, but then James would. We had a very quiet birthday tea, just us and old Bathilda, who dotes on Harry. Wormy dropped by late in the day, but seemed down and didn’t stay long. James is frustrated being shut up here, but Dumbledore’s still got his Invisibility Cloak, so he doesn’t have much choice. By the way, Bathilda tells the most amazing stories about our old Headmaster. I don’t know how much to believe. Can it really be true that

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry! Harry!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Ron! I’ve found him!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Good! Tell him from me he’s a git!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry, you can’t just disappear. We thought --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s from your Mum. To Sirius. Bathilda Bagshot...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah. They knew her. She wrote A History of Magic, you know.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (with irony) Did she now? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’m thinking maybe we should go talk to her. She still lives in Godric’s Hollow. I’m thinking maybe she could help us.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry. I can imagine why you’d want to go there, but... I don’t think Bathilda Bagshot is going to know where Voldemort hid his Horcruxes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hey! I think you two better come down here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The two clinging to the tree are Death Eaters for sure. Dunno ‘bout the bloke on the bench. (dropping the curtain) Can’t see us, of course. But we’ll have to be careful coming and going. C’mon. There’s something else you need to see.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Lovely.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Regulus Arcturus Black...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: To the Dark Lord. I know I will be dead long before you read this... I have stolen the real Horcrux and intend to destroy it...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: R.A.B. was Sirius’ brother? We see the trio from the strange LOW POV again, sitting round the kitchen table. SLOPPY STACKS of OLD DAILY PROPHETS surround them.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes. Question is, did he actually destroy the real Horcrux?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Stop! I order you! Seconds later, Harry reappears... dragging KREACHER the house-elf by one ear. Kreacher MUMBLES FOUL OATHS.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Kreacher...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Been spying on us, have you? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Maybe he knows.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Ever seen this before? Kreacher GRUMBLES incoherently.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Kreacher, I own this place.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: That was Master Regulus’ locket.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: That’s right. But there were two, weren’t there? Kreacher’s eyes widen in surprise. He nods again.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Where’s the other one?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: But was it here? Did you ever see it? Kreacher spins, his face ugly and vicious:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Filthy Mudblood -- The Death Eaters will soon be coming for you!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (gargling the words) Blood-traitor Weasley -- (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Ron! RON! Reluctantly, Ron releases the elf.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Answer her.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes. It was here, in this house. A most evil object...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: How do you mean?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Before he died, Master Regulus ordered Kreacher to destroy it. It was the last thing he asked of

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Where is it now? Did someone take it, Kreacher?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (nodding)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Who, Kreacher? Who was it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Mundungus. Mundungus Fletcher. The trio glance at one another, then Harry turns back to

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Find him. Crack! -- Kreacher VANISHES. BEGIN MONTAGE:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: As your new Minister for Magic, I promise to restore this temple of tolerance to its former glory. Therefore, beginning today, each employee will be required to submit themselves for evaluation. But know this: You have nothing to fear... as long as you have nothing to hide... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: My father will hear about this. Finally NEVILLE bars their way, smiles defiantly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: He’s not here, you fools.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Snitches. They’re never touched by bare skin until the Seeker captures it. Even the wizard who fabricates it wears gloves. That way, if there’s a dispute, the Snitch can identify who first touched it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You mean... it remembers me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (nodding) When Scrimgeour first gave it to you, I thought it might open at your touch -- that Dumbledore had hidden something in it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Expelliarmus! Mundungus’ wand soars into the air... into Hermione’s hand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: As requested, Kreacher has returned with the thief Mundungus Fletcher!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What are you playing at -- setting a pair of bleedin’ ‘ouse-elves on me!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’m no thief, you foul little git. I’m a purveyer of rare and wondrous objects --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’re a thief, Dung. Everyone knows it. Everyone turns. Ron stands in the doorway. Dobby smiles.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Master Weasley! So good to see you again!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wicked trainers.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Listen, I panicked that night, all right? I never volunteered to die for you, mate. Can I help it if Mad-Eye fell off his broom --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Stop lying!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Piece of advice. Let’s not rehash old times. Got it... mate?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: When you turned this place over -- don’t deny it! -- you found a locket, am I right?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Why? Was it valuable?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’ve still got it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No. He’s worried he should have got more money for it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wouldn’t be difficult, would it? Bleedin’ gave it away, din’ I? There I was, pitching me wares in Diagon Alley when some ministry hag comes up and asks to see my license. Says she’s of a mind to lock me up and would’ve, too, she hadn’ taken a fancy to that locket.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Who was she? This witch?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, she’s right there, in’t she? Bleedin’ bow an’ all. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Right. So let’s do it. Who gets * who? * HERMIONE * Well, unless one of you fancies * wearing a skirt... *

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: This is completely mental. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Completely, utterly, without question.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The world’s mental. Come on, * drink up. We’ve got a Horcrux to * find. *

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Morning, Reg! Good luck today. REG CATTERMOLE/RON Oh... yeah. Thanks.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Move it, will you -- oh, Runcorn! Forgive me... The Balding Wizard hurries away, clearly frightened, as does ANOTHER WIZARD, merely at the sight of Harry. MAFALDA HOPKIRK/HERMIONE You appear to be quite popular.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Cattlemole!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s still raining in my office. Two days now. REG CATTERMOLE/RON Really? Have you tried an umbrella?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You do realize I'm on my way downstairs, don’t you, Cattermole? REG CATTERMOLE/RON Downstairs...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: To interrogate your wife! If my wife’s blood status were in doubt and the Head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement needed a job doing, I think I’d make it a priority. You’ve got one hour. Just then, the LIFT behind them clangs open. Hermione tugs Ron inside. Yaxley turns and storms off just as...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Level Two. Department of Magical Law Enforcement, including Wizengamot Administration Services, Auror Headquarters and Improper Use of Magic Department. MAFALDA HOPKIRK/HERMIONE This is you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Level One. Minister of Magic and Support Staff... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Ah, Mafalda! Travers sent you, did he? Good. We’ll go straight down. (eying Harry) Albert, aren’t you getting out?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Weasley!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: They’re waiting for your report downstairs.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Oh, yes... of course.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Reckon the old hag will be interrogating Mudbloods all day?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Sh...careful. Pius Thicknesse appears, trailing a retinue of lackeys.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Runcorn.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: HEAD OF THE MUGGLE-BORN REGISTRATION COMMISSION Harry’s jaw tightens in anger and he glances over his shoulder, sees the Red-Haired Witch watching him. She glances away quickly. Harry reaches into an inner pocket and removes a DECOY DETONATOR, an odd object with little weaving legs and a rubber-bulbed horn for a body. He releases it. It scuttles down his body, across the floor and directly into the sea of desks. Harry waits. Then... Bang! Black smoke billows into the air, pink pages fly everywhere and the Detonator gives birth to dozens of tiny replicants of itself, which race about the floor, up the legs and across the desks of the pamphleteers. The Red-Haired Witch SHRIEKS. Others follow and Harry...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: All right, all right. Let’s calm down, shall we?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ... turns. The Red-Haired Witch is watching him. He puts his finger to his lips. Her eyes go wide as saucers.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It probably just snuck up here from Experimental Charms. I think none of us will soon forget last month’s Poisonous Duck... Seeing the Red-Haired Witch’s expression, the Balding Wizard turns and, as before, withers at the sight of Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: R-Runcorn.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I understand, Wakinda, but I can’t be a party to that.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hello, Reg. Isn’t Mary in for questioning today? Try to have faith. If there’s anything Molly and I can do for you --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Let me guess. It’s raining in Yaxley’s office again?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Tell him to try an umbrella. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Is that a threat, Runcorn? ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY No, Arthur. It’s a fact. They’re watching you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’m half-blood, I tell you! My father was a wizard! Look him up! William Alderton! He worked here for thirty years... As Ron watches the terrified man pass, Harry grabs his arm, pulls him toward the courtroom.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Reg...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Mary Elizabeth Cattermole?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Mother to Maisie, Ellie and Alfred? Wife to Reginald? Mary looks up to Ron, her eyes glistening with fear. He smiles reassuringly. She looks away, replies:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: A wand was taken from you upon your arrival at the Ministry today, Mrs. Cattermole. Is this that wand?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Would you please tell the court from which witch or wizard you took this wand. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: But I didn’t take it. I got it in Diagon Alley, at Ollivander’s, when I was eleven. It chose me. Umbridge leans forward, teeth glittering as the cat slinks by and briefly illuminates her face -- and the chain at her neck trembles like a snake, something heavy swinging forward and dangling over the void. The LOCKET.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No, no, I don’t think so, Mrs. Cattermole. Wands only choose witches. And you are not a witch.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: But I am! Tell them, Reg! Tell them what I am!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What the devil are you doing, Albert? As Harry speaks, his own face ripples through Runcorn’s, the Polyjuice Potion wearing off. ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY You’re lying. And one mustn’t tell lies, Dolores... Stupefy! A flash of red light hits Umbridge and she slumps, forehead striking the balustrade. Instantly the silver cat vanishes. Yaxley draws his wand, but Ron is too quick and takes him out with a single blast. Hermione strips the locket from Umbridge’s neck and leaps down. Instantly, her breath comes in plumes as the Dementors drift forward. ALBERT RUNCORN/HARRY EXPETO PATRONUM! A SILVER STAG soars from the tip of Harry’s wand, circling the room as it drives the Dementors back. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Relashio! The chains encircling Mary Cattermole’s wrists drop like dead snakes. As she stands, she eyes Harry in amazement as he transforms back into himself. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You? It’s you! Reg, it’s Harry Potter! REG CATTERMOLE/RON ‘Tis, isn’t it? This’ll be one to tell the kids.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry... they’ve seen you. We’ve got to get out of here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: MARY! All eyes turn. The real Reg Cattermole stands -- robeless -- outside one of the fireplaces. She looks up at Ron, now transformed, and jumps back.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Long story. Nice meeting you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Piss off. Yaxley staggers into the atrium.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Seal the exits! Now! Harry, Ron and Hermione glance at each other, break for the fireplaces. As Yaxley fires on them, one fireplace after another seals itself. As they reach the last open grate, they pitch themselves -- as one -- onto the polished marble floor -- spells sailing over their heads -- and go sliding inside. As they fall into darkness,

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry, quickly, in my bag, there’s a small bottle labeled ‘Essence of Dittany.’ (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Quickly!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Accio Dittany. A small BROWN BOTTLE lands in his palm.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Unstopper it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hermione. His arm --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Just do it!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What happened? I thought we were going back to Grimmauld Place.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We were. We were there. But Yaxley had hold of me. I knew we couldn’t stay once he’d seen, so when he let go I brought us here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Don’t be stupid. The smoke sifts, clears. Ron’s wound no longer bleeds.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s all I feel safe doing.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Salvio Hexia... Protego Totalum... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What’re you doing?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Protective enchantments. I don’t fancy another visit like we had on Shaftesbury Avenue, do you? Especially with Ron like this. You can get going on the tent...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Tent? Where am I supposed to find --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Repello Muggletum... Muffliato...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: How’re the mushrooms? Seem to be the only edible things growing round here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: They’re great.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Make sure to leave some for Ron.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (under his breath) No problem.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: How bad is he? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: He’ll be alright in a few days. Hopefully. If we could take him to Hogwarts, to Madam Pomfrey -- Harry’s glance stops her, confirming what she knows.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: So where do we go next?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It scares me a bit, that, thinking it’s a piece of Vol--

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No, don’t! Don’t say it!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s taboo -- You-Know-Who’s name. That’s how they track people now. It’s how they found us in the cafe that night.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: How d’you know?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I overheard a bloke from the Enforcement office talking about it at the Ministry. Blimey, what’s that smell?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (no longer confident) Dinner? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Not bloody likely. Smells like something Ginny would cook.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Tea?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Is that it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I know. I felt it too. (off Hermione’s look) It’s... it’s like it’s ticking or something, like it has a tiny metal heart, like it’s --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ... alive.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I hate it. It’s like he’s here with us.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: That’s why we’re going to kill it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Dissendium! The locket spins swiftly in place, but remains whole.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Incendio! Flames engulf the locket and its metal flesh turns scarlet, but then the flames die. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Expulso! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Confringo! The ground beneath the stump craters, but the locket remains untouched. Hermione lowers her wand, but Harry continues on, firing a succession of spells, looking almost possessed. Hermione studies him oddly until, finally, he stops. All goes silent except for the leaves shifting in wind above. Then, slowly, another sound comes clear... a TICKING. Coming from the locket.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s angry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What’re you doing?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We have to keep it safe until we can figure out how to destroy it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I can put it in my bag --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Seems strange, mate. Dumbledore sends you off to find a load of Horcruxes, but doesn’t bother to tell you how to destroy them. Doesn’t that bother you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Tell me, Gregorovitch. Tell me where it is...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I told you! I no longer have it! It was stolen from me! Many years ago!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You wouldn’t be lying to me, would you, Gregorovitch? Because, I must tell you... that will only make it worse for you... As a bony hand -- Voldemort’s -- extends a wand, Gregorovitch reacts with fear and we RUSH IN, DRIFTING THROUGH his dilating pupil INTO... 94 FLASHBACK - INT. DARK CORRIDOR - YEARS PAST 94 ... a hall of shadows. A younger Gregorovitch hurries toward a distant room, a lantern bobbing in his hand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I speak the truth! I remember like it was yesterday...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Who was he? The thief?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Just a boy! Not of the village. It was he who took it. I never saw it again. I swear on my life.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I believe you... A BURST OF GREEN LIGHT engulfs the room and...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I thought it had stopped.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You can’t let him in, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s not a candle I can blow out, Hermione. It always burns, even if it’s just a flicker. Can you understand that?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Tell me. What you saw. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: He’s found him. Vol--

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You-Know-Who. He’s found Gregorovitch --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The wandmaker?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes. How’d you know?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Viktor got his wand from Gregorovitch. Most Durmstrang students did at one time. What’s he got to do with You-Know-Who? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You-Know-Who wants something Gregorovitch once had -- dunno what. But he’s desperate to have it. It’s as if his life depends on it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Don’t -- It... comforts him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well it sets my teeth on edge. What’s he expecting to hear? Good news?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I think he just hopes he doesn’t hear bad news. It gets him through the day.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And what gets you through the day?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We’ve all made sacrifices, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: How long before he can travel?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I don’t know. It takes time. I’m doing all I can.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’re not doing enough.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Take it off.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Take it off. Now.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Better?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Loads.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s cold. Even though it’s been lying against your skin for days.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We’ll take turns. Okay?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ... Severus Snape, newly appointed Headmaster of Hogwarts... As the signal fades, Harry rolls onto his side and twists the dial. Behind him, we see Hermione’s shadow RISE, move away from the tent...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ... bears little resemblance to the school under Dumbledore’s leadership. Snape’s curriculum is severe, reflecting the wishes of the Dark Lord and infractions are dealt with harshly by the two Death Eaters on the staff...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What’s that? That... smell? The others glance about dumbly. Scabior retraces his steps until he stands directly in front of Hermione, his eyes looking right through her. He leans forward ever-so- slightly, only inches from her neck, NOSTRILS FLARING. The locket TICKS, trembling upon Hermione’s breastbone. Then, slowly, Scabior pulls back, eyes probing the darkness, before withdrawing, leading the others away. The last pair drag what appear to be BODIES. As they vanish within the trees, Hermione finally swallows.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Snatchers.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Good to know your enchantments work. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We have to leave. We’re not safe here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I told you. Ron’s not strong enough to Apparate.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Then we’ll go by foot.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’m hungry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’m hungry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We’re all hungry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Leave it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Mum can make food appear out of thin air.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (tenderly) No one can conjure food out of thin air. Food is the first of the five Principal Exceptions to Gamp’s Law. The other four are --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (sharply) Oh, speak English, can’t you? As Ron jerks his injured arm away, Hermione looks up, meets Ron’s hard gaze. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I said leave it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’ll be dark soon. We need to find a place to sleep.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Good plan.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah. Brilliant. Only, correct me if I’m wrong... wasn’t that yesterday’s plan? And the day before that? And the day before that? Walk. Sleep. Walk. Sleep.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: My turn. As he reaches out, Ron blocks his hand. For a moment, they simply stand silently. Then Ron strips the chain from his neck, hands it to Harry and brushes past him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: None of us do.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wizards were here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I don’t like this place.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I want to go.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Oh my god...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (alarmed) What?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’ll tell you in a minute.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Maybe you could tell me now.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Alright. The Sword of Gryffindor? It’s Goblin made.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Brilliant.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You don’t understand. Dirt and rust have no effect on the blade. It only takes in that which makes it stronger.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: O-kay.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry. You already destroyed one Horcrux, right? Tom Riddle’s diary -- in the Chamber of Secrets.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: With a basilisk fang. If you tell me you’ve got one of those in that bloody beaded bag of yours --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Don’t you see! In the Chamber of Secrets, you stabbed the basilisk with the Sword of Gryffindor. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Its blade is impregnated with basilisk venom.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It only takes in that which makes it stronger...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Exactly! Which means...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ... it can destroy Horcruxes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Which is why Dumbledore left it to you in his will.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’re brilliant, Hermione. Truly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Actually, I’m highly logical, which allows me to look past the extraneous detail and perceive clearly that which others overlook.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: There’s only one problem... Suddenly the LIGHTS CLICK OFF...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The sword was stolen. The lights click back ON. Hermione and Harry turn, see

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah, I’m still here. But you two carry on. Don’t let me spoil your fun.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What’s the problem?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Problem? There’s no problem. Not according to you, anyway. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Look, don’t be shy. If you’ve got something to say, spit it out.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: All right, I’ll spit it out. Don’t expect me to skip up and down because now there’s some other damn thing we’ve got to find.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (quietly) Ron...
