Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I thought you knew what you signed up for.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah, I thought I did too.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I don’t understand. What part of this isn’t living up to your expectations? Did you think we’d be staying in five-star hotels? Finding a Horcrux every other day? Did you think you’d be back to Mummy by Christmas?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No, I just reckoned after all this time, we’d have actually achieved something. I reckoned you knew what you were doing. I reckoned

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’ve told you everything

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah, and we’re about as near getting rid of it as we are to finding the rest of them, aren’t we! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Take it off, Ron. Please take it off. You wouldn’t be talking like this if you hadn’t been wearing it all day --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah, he would. D’you think I haven’t noticed the two of you whispering behind my back? D’you think I haven’t guessed what you were thinking?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry, we weren’t --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Don’t lie! You said it, too, you said you were disappointed --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I didn’t! Not like that! Harry -- I didn’t!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Do you know why I listen to that radio, every night? Do you! To make sure I don’t hear Ginny’s name or Fred or George or Mum or --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You think I don’t listen! You think I don’t know what it’s like --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: NO! YOU DON’T KNOW WHAT IT’S LIKE! YOUR PARENTS ARE DEAD! YOU HAVE NO FAMILY! Dead silence. Harry glares at Ron. Hermione looks shocked. Suddenly, they both rush forward and lock on each other’s throats, Hermione rushes in.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Stop! Stop!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Go then. But leave that. Hermione, eyes flashing with panic, glances from Harry to Ron. Ron strips the chain from his neck, casts it away, then turns to Hermione. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Are you staying? Or coming?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Fine. I get it. I saw you two the other night. Yeah, that’s right. Didn’t know I knew, did you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What? Ron, no -- please --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: He’s gone.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Salvio Hexia... Protego Totalum...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s a Muggle station.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hermione.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You were right. It’s like you said. Snitches have flesh memories. But I didn’t catch my first Snitch with my hand. I almost swallowed it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ‘I open at the close?’

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What do you reckon it means?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I don’t know. But look, I’ve found something as well...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I thought it was a picture of an eye, but now I don’t think it is. It isn’t a rune and it’s not in Spellman’s Syllabary either. And it’s been inked in -- somebody drew it -- it isn’t part of the book.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Luna’s dad was wearing that, at Ron- (catching himself) At Bill and Fleur’s wedding. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What d’you mean -- wearing it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Around his neck. Like an amulet. I didn’t think much of it at the time. You know Luna -- she’s always got some mad thing or the other she’s carrying around. I just figured it ran in the family.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Why would someone have drawn it in a children’s book? As Hermione shakes her head, musing, Harry eyes her.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hermione, I’ve been thinking. I -- I want to go to Godric’s Hollow. It’s where I was born, it’s where my parents died --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And it’s exactly where You-Know- Who will expect you to go. Because it means something to you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: But it means something to him too, Hermione. You-Know-Who nearly died there. Wouldn’t that be just the kind of place he’d hide a Horcrux?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s dangerous, Harry. But I have to admit, recently even I’ve been thinking we might have to go. I think it’s possible something else is hidden there. (off Harry’s look) The sword. If Dumbledore didn’t want it falling into the Ministry’s hands, but wanted you to find it, what better place to hide it than the birthplace of the founder of Gryffindor himself? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Godric’s Hollow is the birthplace of Godric Gryffindor -- I mean, ‘course it is. Obvious, isn’t it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (eyeing him knowingly) Harry, did you ever even open A History of Magic?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Tossed it at Neville once when he was snoring -- might’ve popped open.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hermione... Words fail him. Hermione reaches out, lightly strokes his hair as she heads toward the tent.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Don’t ever let me give you a haircut again.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I still think we should’ve used Polyjuice Potion.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No. This is where I was born. I’m not returning as someone else.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry, I think it’s Christmas Eve! Listen... Her voice is wistful. As they listen, VOICES carry from the church up ahead. Harry eyes the GRAVEYARD beyond.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Do you think they’d be in there? My mum and dad?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah. I think they would.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Is it -- ?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No. But look.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Did you know he had a sister?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Lumos.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Ignotus... Hey, Har --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: As he stares at the tombstones of his parents:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Born 27 March 1960 Born 30 January 1960 Died 31 October 1981 Died 31 October 1981 “The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.”

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Happy Christmas, Hermione.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Happy Christmas, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Someone’s watching us. By the gate.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: C’mon.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I don’t think this is a good idea.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We look like ordinary Muggles.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Muggles who’ve just been laying flowers on your parents’ grave. Just then, up ahead, the stooped woman holds up her hand and Hermione and Harry stop. Seconds later, a group of SNATCHERS passes by the alley. As they vanish, the woman continues on.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Relax. This is right. I know it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Omigod. Harry...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: This is where they died, Hermione. This is where he murdered them.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’re Bathilda, aren’t you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry, I’m not sure about this.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hermione, she knew Dumbledore.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: There’s something odd about her. And what’s that smell?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: She’s gaga, remember? Bathilda returns, holding a box of matches. She strikes one, tries to light a candle, but her movements are clumsy.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Here. Let me do that. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You have a lovely house, Miss Bagshot.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Miss Bagshot? Who is this man?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: His name. Can you tell me his name? Bathilda stares at the photograph solemnly, then peers up at Harry. Her eyes are THICK with CATARACTS. Harry stares, unnerved, then Hermione walks over, looks at the picture.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: This is him, Hermione. The one I saw in Gregorovitch’s wandshop. The thief. Miss Bagshot, who is he?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: All right... As Hermione moves, Bathilda shakes her head, points at Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Why? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s all right. You stay here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The Life and Lies of Albus Dumbledore. A hand reaches in, takes it. Hermione’s hand. A NOTE is attached: “Dear Batty. Thanks for your help. You said everything... even if you don’t remember. Rita.”

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Lumos.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (in Parseltongue) You are Potter?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (in Parseltongue) Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (in Parseltongue) I have something for you... Hermione’s gaze rises, to the ceiling, to the HEATING VENT, from which the hissing voice has just come.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry! As Harry rolls onto his back, gasping for breath, Nagini’s massive body rolls over him, the Horcrux ticking feverishly against his chest. As Harry ROARS in pain, the lenses of his GLASSES fracture. The bedroom door swings open, reveals Hermione silhouetted against the stairwell, wand poised. A FLASH OF RED LIGHT ricochets around the room and Nagini’s tail whips angrily about, shattering the bedroom window.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Confringo! As Hermione’s spell caroms off the trembling walls, we see both her and Harry reflected in a MIRROR. He leaps, sweeping her toward the smoldering window. As they pitch themselves into the night, the mirror EXPLODES and shards of glass, reflecting bits of Hermione and Harry and the giant snake, tumble in the night, slowly vanishing into... nothingness.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry... Harry, can you hear me...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Good. That’s good... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We got away. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Are you alright?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’m fine. But you’ve been sick. Rest... Rest a bit more... All stays DARK...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’ve outdone yourself this time.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The Forest of Dean. I came here once with my mum and dad, years ago. It’s just how I remember it. The trees. The river. It’s like nothing’s changed. Not true, of course. Everything’s changed. If I brought my parents here, they wouldn’t recognize any of it. Not the trees. Not the river. Not... me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Where are they?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wendell and Monica Wilkens now reside happily in Sydney, Australia. They have two dogs, run a small sweet shop, but floss daily. No children.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Maybe we should just stay here, Harry. Grow old.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You wanted to know who the boy in the photograph was. Well, I know. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It was in Bathilda’s sitting room. Rita Skeeter had sent it to her. Harry, it doesn’t make for very nice reading --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Who is he, Hermione? The thief? Did Dumbledore know him?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: For a time.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Tell me, Hermione. Who is he?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Gellert Grindelwald. He’s not very well known in Britain, but there was a time, before You-Know- Who...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hermione, I don’t need to have read A History of Magic to know who Gellert Grindelwald is.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: When Grindelwald was seventeen, he was expelled from Durmstrang. He’d started doing some twisted things at school -- experiments. A few teachers had always protected him, but they couldn’t anymore. After he left, he traveled for awhile, then ended up in Godric’s Hollow where his great aunt lived, Bathilda Bagshot. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Get to the hard part, Hermione.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wizard rule over Muggles.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And Dumbledore believed in it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ‘For the Greater Good.’ What does that mean?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It was something Dumbledore came up with. He believed wizards were superior and should rule over Muggles, but gently, for their own good. Grindelwald took a more violent position.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It was a different time, Harry. It was one summer. Dumbledore was young --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We’re young, Hermione. And here we are, risking our lives to fight against the very thing Dumbledore supported. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Where’s my wand? I’ll take the watch.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hermione. Where’s my wand?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s my fault. As we were leaving Godric’s Hollow, I cast a curse and it rebounded... I’m sorry, Harry, I tried to mend it but wands are different --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s done.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Maybe we can --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s done. His tone puts an end to it. She nods.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Leave me yours. You get back in the warm. And give me that.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Lumos! Hermione’s wand-tip ignites. Harry paints the clearing with light and something GLEAMS: a small FROZEN POOL.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Accio Sword. Nothing. Harry walks about the pool again and again and then stops. He crouches... ... and looks slowly down at his chest. The Horcrux around his neck has begun to TWITCH. Harry places his fingers upon it briefly, then rises. Quickly, with fumbling fingers, he SHEDS his clothes and points Hermione’s wand at the pool. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Diffindo. The pool’s icey crust CRACKS, echoing in the silence. CHUNKS of DARK ICE rock the surface. Harry steps to the pool’s edge, peers within... and PLUNGES...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ... SCREAMING in the dark silence of the chill water. He kicks down to the glimmering sword, grabs the hilt and kicks for the surface when... ... the locket’s chain begins to COIL, tightening like a SNAKE about his neck. As the links bite into his throat, he releases the sword and begins to thrash about, struggling to get his fingers under the chain. Realizing it’s no use... ... he reaches for the pool’s edge, his fingers scrabbling desperately over the ice, but unable to gain purchase. Slowly, his hands go limp and slip from the ice back into... ... the water, where he drifts slowly down, a slow trail of bubbles escaping his mouth, eyes half-closed as he peers upward, watching as the surface of the water grows slowly calm... peaceful... when... a SHADOW appears and... ... a PAIR of HANDS shatter the glassy surface of the water and Harry is pulled upward and out, landing...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hermione... A HAND reaches in, strips the locket from his neck.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Are -- you -- mental? Harry’s eyes pop open. Standing a few yards away, fully dressed and half-drenched, clutching the sword of -- Gryffindor in one hand and the locket in the other, is

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It was you!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, yeah. Bit obvious, I'd think.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And the doe. That was you as well.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No. I reckoned it was you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: My Patronus is a stag.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Right. Antlers.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You didn’t see anyone else?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No, I... I did think maybe I saw something -- when I was running -- over there --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Anything?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (shaking his head) But I reckon whoever cast the doe, put the sword in that pool hoping we’d find it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And we did, didn’t we? The “we” hangs in the chill air. Harry eyes Ron, then steps forward and dangles the locket close to the sword. It immediately begins to TWITCH.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: See that? It knows. It’s afraid. (looking up) Do it. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What? No. Harry. That thing’s bad for me. I can’t handle it. I’m not making excuses for how I acted, but that thing affects me more than it affects you and Hermione. It made me think stuff -- stuff I was thinking anyway, but it made everything worse.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: All the more reason.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No. I can’t --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Then why are you here? Why did you come back?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’ll have to speak to it in order for it to open. When it does, don’t hesitate. I don’t know what’s in here, but it’ll put up a fight. The bit of Riddle that was in his diary tried to kill me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: On three. One. Two. Three. (in Parseltongue) Take me inside... Click! The twin doors of the locket SNAP open. Behind each glass window a LIVING EYE blinks -- Tom Riddle’s eyes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Stab it, Ron. Now.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I have seen your heart and it is mine... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Don’t listen to it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I have seen your dreams, Ronald Weasley, and I have seen your fears...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Ron. Don’t listen to it!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Least loved, by the mother who craved a daughter. Least loved, by the girl who prefers your friend...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Ron. Stab it! The locket QUIVERS in Harry’s fingers, turning WHITE-HOT, and he releases it. As the eyes gleam SCARLET, Harry grimaces and a FLASH OF BLINDING LIGHT BURSTS forth, leaving in its wake two FIGURES floating in the darkness -- GHOST IMAGES of Harry and Hermione.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: We were better without you, happier without you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Who could look at you beside Harry Potter? What are you, compared with the Chosen One...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Ron. It lies! Stab it! STAB IT!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Your mother confessed that she would have preferred me as a son...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Who wouldn’t prefer him, what woman would take you, you are nothing, nothing, nothing to him... The ghostly Hermione, frightening yet beautiful, entwines herself around the ghostly Harry, her hair running like silk over their faces as she leans forward and covers his mouth with hers. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Do it, Ron! Kill it! Ron’s head turns then, to Harry, and Harry freezes. A trace of SCARLET glints in Ron’s eyes. He raises the sword high and -- for a moment -- Harry looks fearful. Then, Ron pivots and brings the blade down hard, cleaving the locket. A SCREAM echoes throughout the forest and the ghostly Harry and Hermione turn to dust, becoming one with the vapor drifting from Ron’s mouth and all is... Quiet.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: After you left, she cried for a week. She’s like my sister.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’m sorry. I’m sorry I left.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You’ve sort of made up for it tonight. Getting the sword. Finishing off the Horcrux.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Saving your life.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: That too.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And just think of it. Only three to go.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hermione! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Everything all right?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Fine. Actually... more than fine.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hey. And then... Hermione begins to PUNCH HIM.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wo -- hey -- ouch!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (with each punch) You -- complete -- arse -- Ronald -- Weasley! You crawl back here after all these weeks and say, ‘Hey?’ (turning to Harry) Where’s my wand? Harry, where’s my wand!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Um... I don’t know?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: How come he’s got your wand?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Never mind why he’s got my wand -- (stopping) What is that? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You destroyed it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And exactly how is it you have the Sword of Gryffindor?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s a long story.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Don’t think this changes anything.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No, of course not. I only destroyed a bloody freaking Horcrux! Why would that change anything! Do you know what it was like for me to hear those words coming from you! To see you doing those things --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: See me doing what things?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What happened out there?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (at a loss, then) It’s a long story.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Look, I wanted to come back the minute I’d left. I just... didn’t know how to find you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Exactly how did you find us?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: With this. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It doesn’t just turn off lights. I don’t know exactly how it works, but Christmas morning I -- I was sleeping -- in this little pub-- I’d given some Snatchers the slip the night before, me being a blood- traitor and all -- anyway, I was sleeping when I heard it...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: A voice.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Your voice, Hermione. Coming out of this.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And what may I ask did I say?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: My name. Just my name. Like a whisper.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: So I took this and I clicked it and this tiny ball of light appeared. And I knew.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Knew what?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Just knew. On account of Hermione’s voice. And sure enough, it floated toward me, the ball of light, right to my chest and then -- went straight through -- right here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I could feel it inside me. It was warm, like the first sip of a good cup of tea. And I knew it would take me where I needed to go. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: So I Disapparated and came out on this hillside. It was dark. I didn’t have any idea where I was. I just had to hope one of you would show yourselves in the end. And you did.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’ve always liked it. These flames Hermione makes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: How long you reckon she’ll stay mad at me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Keep talking ‘bout that little ball of light touching your heart -- she’ll come round.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It was true. Every word. (a beat) You’re going to think I’m mental, but I think that’s why Dumbledore left it to me -- the Deluminator. I think he knew that at some point I’d... need to find my way back. And she’d lead me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Bloody hell. I just realized. You need a wand, right?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, I’ve got one. Here. It’s Blackthorn, ten inches, nothing special, but I reckon it’ll do. I took it off a Snatcher a few weeks back. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (whispering) Don’t tell Hermione, but they’re a bit dim, Snatchers. This one was definitely part Troll. The smell off him...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Engorgio. The flames FLARE MASSIVELY and Ron leaps back.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Wo.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Reducio! As the flames subside, Ron pats down a small flare-up on the canvas.

Dialogue: (to Harry) Maybe a bit more practice, eh?

Dialogue: We need to talk.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: All right.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (ignoring him) I want to go and see Xenophilius Lovegood.

Dialogue: Sorry?

Dialogue: See this? It’s a letter

Dialogue: Jesus. It was there too.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Where?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: But what does it mean?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Harry, you don’t have a clue where the next Horcrux is. And neither do I. But this, this means something. I’m sure of it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I think Hermione’s right. I think we ought to go and see Lovegood. What say we vote on it? Those in favor...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Sorry, Harry. Looks like it’s

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Not still mad at him, are you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I’m always mad at him. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Luna?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Keep off the dirigible plums.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (to Hermione) What is it? (to Ron) Who are you? (to Harry) What do you want -- Seeing Harry, Lovegood’s jaw goes slack in shock.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Hello, Mr. Lovegood. I’m Harry Potter. We met a few months back? Lovegood’s eyes drift to Harry’s scar.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Would it be okay if we came in? It won’t take long, sir. I promise.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Excuse me. As Lovegood steps to the wheezing press, the trio glance at past QUIBBLERS laying about: MUGGLE MURDERS RISE, DOZENS DIE AS DEATH EATERS ATTACK, HARRY IN HIDING, WHERE IS THE CHOSEN ONE? YOU-KNOW-WHO CLAIMS ANOTHER VICTIM: QUIDDITCH WORLD CUP CANCELLED AMID DEATH THREATS. Abruptly, the press goes silent and Lovegood turns.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: So. What brings you here, Mr. Potter?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, sir, we need some help.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Ah. Help. I see. Yes, well, the thing is, helping Harry Potter, rather dangerous these days... The trio exchange glances.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Aren’t you the one who keeps telling everyone it’s their first duty to help Harry?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: I have expressed that view, yes. In the past. Would you excuse me one moment. I shall return shortly and, um, try to help you... Lovegood dashes from the room.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What’s going on here?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: He’s mental. Let’s face it. Luna’s always good value, but she’s nutty as squirrel poo. Just then, Hermione GASPS, points to an ENORMOUS SPIRAL HORN mounted on the wall. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Do you see that? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, yeah, of course. It’s massive, isn’t it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: No! Don’t go near it!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s an Erumpent horn. It’s a Class B Tradeable Material.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah, all right... Just then, Lovegood returns with a TRAY rattling with

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: May I offer you all an infusion of Gurdyroots? We make it ourselves.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Where is Luna, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Luna? Oh, um, she’ll be along. Now how can I help you, Mr. Potter?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, sir, it’s about something you were wearing around your neck at the wedding. A symbol...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You mean this? Lovegood reaches into his nightshirt and pulls out the chain with the TRIANGULAR EYE.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yes! Exactly. What we wondered, sir, is, well, what is it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: What is it? Well, it’s the sign of the Deathly Hallows, of course. HARRY/RON/HERMIONE The what? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The Deathly Hallows. I assume you’re all familiar with ‘The Tale of the Three Brothers?’ HERMIONE/RON HARRY Yes. No.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It’s in here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, there’s no real reason to go on unless one is familiar with the tale. Why don’t you read it aloud, Miss...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Granger. Well... all right. (opening the book) There were once three brothers who were traveling along a lonely, winding road at twilight --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Midnight. Mum always said midnight. (as Hermione glowers) But twilight’s fine. Better actually.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: In time, the brothers reached a river too treacherous to pass... As Hermione continues, Lovegood looks out the window. A CROW cycles INTO VIEW and we FOLLOW it, the sky

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: 152 STORY - EXT. RIVER/BRIDGE - TWILIGHT 152 ... as the crow swoops over a river to reveal THREE

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: But being learned in the magical arts, the three brothers simply waved their wands and made a bridge. They were halfway across it when they found their path blocked by a hooded figure. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: It was Death and he felt cheated, for travelers usually drowned in the river. But Death was cunning.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The second brother, who was an arrogant man, asked for the power to recall others from Death. So Death plucked a stone from the river. Finally Death turned to the third brother. A humble man, he asked for something that would make him disappear. And so it was that Death handed over his own Cloak of Invisibility. Death then stepped aside and the brothers went their separate ways... We see the brothers cross the bridge, and part.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The first brother traveled to a distant village where, with Elder Wand in hand, he killed a wizard with whom he had once quarreled. Proceeding to an Inn, he bragged of his invincibility. But that very night... We see a wizard, in shadow, slip into a room, KNIFE in hand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: ... another wizard crept upon him as he lay sleeping. He took the Elder Wand... and slit the brother’s throat for good measure. And so Death took the first brother for his own... We see the second brother approach a cottage. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Meanwhile, the second brother journeyed to his home, where he took out the stone and turned it thrice in hand. To his delight, the girl he had once hoped to marry before her untimely death appeared before him. Yet soon she turned sad and cold, for she did not belong in the mortal world. Driven mad with hopeless longing, the second brother killed himself so as to join her. And so Death took the second brother... We see Death etched upon a bleak hillside.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: As for the third brother, Death searched for many years but was never able to find him. Only when he had attained a great age did the youngest brother shed the Cloak of Invisibility and give it to his son. He then greeted Death as an old friend and went with him gladly, departing this life as equals... As Death and the third brother retreat, the crow returns, beating into the sky, which LIGHTENS, and we PULL BACK...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Well, there you are. Those are the Deathly Hallows.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Sorry... I still don’t really understand... Lovegood turns and, taking quill and parchment, draws a

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The Resurrection Stone... ... then encloses both in a TRIANGLE.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: The Cloak of Invisibility. Together... they make the Deathly Hallows. Together... they make one master of Death. The trio stare at the symbol.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Mr. Lovegood, does the Peverell family have anything to do with the Deathly Hallows? (to Harry and Ron) That was the name on the grave with the mark on it in Godric’s Hollow. Ignotus Peverell.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Ignotus and his brothers Cadmus and Antioch are thought to be the original owners of the Hallows and therefore the inspiration for the story. Lovegood’s focus abruptly wavers, sadness in his eyes, then he blinks, eyes the tea kettle.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Ah, but your tea’s grown cold. Excuse me, I'll be right back.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (as Lovegood exits) Let’s get out of here once he’s back. I’m not touching this stuff, hot or cold.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: (lost in thought) Which one would you choose if you could? Of the Deathly Hallows?

Dialogue: The Stone.

Dialogue: You’re supposed to say the Cloak, but who wants to spend all day being invisible. Dead boring if you ask me. But an unbeatable wand!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Its owner grew drunk with power and was murdered.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Yeah, but imagine what a short wicked life you’d lead.

Dialogue: But I have one. The Invisibility Cloak my father left me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: There have always been Cloaks --

Dialogue: Not like Harry’s. I’ve seen a fair few. Dad used to bring home the ones the Ministry confiscated from petty thieves and the like.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: And I think I’ve actually held the Resurrection Stone in my hands, that night in Dumbledore’s office when he showed me the ring he’d destroyed, the Horcrux. It had a symbol on it. Now I think it was the mark of the Hallows. The trio stand silently when Lovegood returns.

Dialogue: Mr. Lovegood. Thank you, sir --

Dialogue: The water?

Dialogue: Sir?

Dialogue: Ron! Harry! Take my hand!

Dialogue: A wand BLOOMS above, illuminates the face of Scabior. Hermione’s red scarf, now faded and filthy, dangles from his neck. He presses it to his grimy nose, inhales and

Dialogue: What’re you saying?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: Stop it!

Dialogue: Your boyfriend’ll get worse than that if he doesn’t behave, lovely.

Dialogue: What’s your name?

Dialogue: Stan Shunpike.

Dialogue: Like ‘ell you are. We know skinny Stan. Try again. Greyback, his boot to Ron’s neck, presses harder.

Dialogue: Weasley... (making it up) Barney Weasley.

Dialogue: Piss off! Arthur Weasley’s ten times the wizard you are!

Dialogue: Worth ten times you if I can find him. Wasn’t you that tipped him off, was it?

Dialogue: How ‘bout you, lovely? What do they call you...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
Dialogue: You smell like vanilla, Penelope. I think you’re going to be my favorite.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1

Dialogue: Change of plans, boys. We won’t be taking this lot to the Ministry.

Dialogue: What did you put on me?

Dialogue: Why Draco? Narcissa passes her husband without a word.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Just sit back and watch, Lucius. Hm? Pour yourself another glass of wine. As she passes, she flicks her finger off the rim of his glass -- pling! 165 OMITTED 165

Dialogue: Where’d you find them?

Dialogue: In the North Forest. WORMTAIL quietly enters the room. As Harry eyes him,

Dialogue: It’s not mine.

Dialogue: You don’t say. Her eyes slide, catch him looking at Hermione.

Dialogue: Fancy her, do you, Scabior? Can’t say I blame you. Maybe we’ll work out a little reward for you, hm? That is, assuming all is as it appears. Ah, Draco. Come here, darling. From the shadows at the far end of the room Draco separates from Narcissa, steps cautiously forward.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: My friends here say they’ve got

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (to Draco) Don’t be shy, sweetheart. Get up nice and close.

Dialogue: What’s wrong with his face?

Dialogue: Where did you get that! (CONTINUED)

Dialogue: Luna...?

Dialogue: Liar. What else did you take?

Dialogue: Sss.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: As Harry joins Ron and looks: Slowly, Bellatrix comes INTO VIEW, towering over Griphook, who holds the sword, studying it. Hermione lies at Bellatrix’s feet. Seeing her, Ron starts to lurch forward. Harry restrains him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Well?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I left Gringotts employ many weeks ago, but when I was last in your vault, the sword was there.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Perhaps it just walked out on its own then. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: There is no place safer than Gringotts, Madam LeStrange. ... and catches on Hermione’s shirt.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Liar! You can’t deceive me! As Hermione looks up, away from the hair, Bellatrix slashes the dagger across Griphook’s cheek and a deep gash opens. He barely flinches, the hint of a SMILE on his lips. Bellatrix looks mildly unnerved by his reaction.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Consider yourself lucky, Goblin. The same won’t be said for this one.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Like hell!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Expelliarmus! Bellatrix’s dangling wand shoots free, tumbles end over end... right into Harry’s hand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Stupefy!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Stop or she dies!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Drop your wands.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I said drop them! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (angrily) All right!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Pick them up, Draco. Now! Well, well, look what we have here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Call him, Draco.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Stupefy!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You dirty little monkey! You could have killed me!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: For God’s sake, Cissy, you’ve got a wand! Use it! Narcissa hesitates. Crack! -- Dobby waves his little fist and Narcissa’s wand flies from her hand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: How dare you take a witch’s wand. How dare you defy your masters.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Give the Dark Lord our regards.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s all right, Hermione. You’re safe. We’re all safe.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Dobby... no... As Harry rushes to him, the elf crumples in his arms, his eyes rolling up to the stars. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s okay... Here... Just hold on, Dobby... I’ll fix you -- Hermione -- your bag -- you must have something -- Essence of Dittany -- something... Hermione! Help me!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Such a beautiful night... to be with friends. Dobby is happy... to be with his friend... Harry Potter...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Fleur’s seeing to Ollivander. Anyone else need tending --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: We should close his eyes. Don’t you think?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: There. Now he could be sleeping.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Harry. It’s all right. That it hurts. That’s what reminds us how lucky we are to be alive.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I want to bury him properly. Without magic.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s beautiful here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It was our Aunt’s. We used to come here as kids. The Order uses it now as a safe house -- what’s left of us, at least.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Muggles think these keep evil away. But they’re wrong... Bill studies her curiously. Then Harry appears in the doorway with Ron and Hermione.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I need to talk to the goblin.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: How are you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Alive. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You probably don’t remember --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: -- that I showed you to your vault the first time you visited Gringotts? Even amongst goblins, you are famous, Harry Potter. (nodding to the window) You buried the elf. I saw you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And brought me here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You are a very unusual wizard.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Why did you leave Gringotts?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Soon the Death Eaters will control it. That was unacceptable to me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Then you’re on our side.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: This is a wizard’s war. I take no side.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I need to get inside Gringotts, into one of the vaults.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It is impossible.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Alone, yes. With you, no. Griphook stares impassively at him, silent. He glances at the Sword of Gryffindor, which stands in the corner.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: How did you come by this sword? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s complicated. Why did

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s complicated.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The sword presented itself to us in a moment of need. We didn’t steal it. Griphook nods, pondering this.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: There is a sword in Madam Lestrange’s vault identical to this one, but it is a fake. It was placed there this past summer.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And she never suspected?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The replica is very convincing. Only a goblin would recognize that this is the true Sword of Gryffindor.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Who put it there? The fake.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It was not my place to ask, nor did I desire to. There are more than a few curious things in the vaults at Gringotts.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And in Madam Lestrange’s vault as well?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Perhaps.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I have gold. Lots of it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I have no interest in gold. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Then what? The goblin twists the curl at his chin... then his eyes drift once again to the sword. Harry starts to respond, but the goblin cuts him off with finality.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: That is my price.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (a beat) All right.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I have your word, Harry Potter, that you will give me the Sword of Gryffindor if I help you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Harry, are you thinking there’s a Horcrux in Bellatrix’s vault?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And if we find one? How’re we supposed to destroy it if we’ve given Griphook the sword?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’m still working on that part. FLEUR exits the room ahead, a half-empty bowl in hand. Seeing Harry, she stops, effectively barring the door.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: He’s too weak. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Forgive me if I don’t get up.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Mr. Ollivander, I need to ask you a few questions.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Anything, m’boy, anything.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Can you identify these, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Walnut and dragon heartstring. Twelve and three quarter inches. Unyielding. This belongs to

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And this?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Hawthorn. Unicorn hair. Ten inches. Reasonably pliant. This was the wand of Draco Malfoy.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Was? Isn’t it still?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Perhaps not -- if you won it from him. I sense its allegiance has changed.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You talk about wands like they’ve got feelings. Can think.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The wand chooses the wizard, Mr. Potter. That much has always been clear to those of us who have studied wandlore. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What do you know about the Deathly Hallows, sir? Ollivander eyes Harry with surprise. And a hint of fear.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: There are rumored to be three: The Elder Wand, the Resurrection Stone and the Invisibility Cloak. It is said that to possess them all is to make oneself the Master of Death. But few truly believe such objects exist --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: But you, sir? Do you believe they exist?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I see no reason to put stock in an old wives tale --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You’re lying. You know one exists and you told him about it. You told him about the Elder Wand and where to go looking for it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: That’s all, sir. We’ll leave you to get some rest now. The trio begins to exit.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: He’s after you, Mr. Potter. If it’s true, what you say, that he has the Elder Wand, I’m afraid you really don’t stand a chance. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Then I guess I’ll just have to kill him before he finds me, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You’re sure it’s hers?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Positive.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I reckon you should take this then.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Can’t I use the other?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You heard Ollivander. It’s Harry’s now.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: But I hate that thing -- that’s the wand that killed Sirius! How can I hold it and not feel...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: If I can hold it, you can.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: How will we know what it is when we get in there? After all, a Horcrux can be anything.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’ll know. I can’t explain. It’s like... (touching his chest) ... they sing to me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: That’s a bit scary.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It is, Harry. Did Dumbledore ever say anything to you, something that might explain why --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No. I just know. When one’s near.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: This is the closest I could find to what you described, Hermione.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s perfect. Thank you, Fleur. Fleur lays the cloak in Hermione’s hands, then steps back next to Bill. He studies the trio.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You’re leaving, aren’t you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: In the morning.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And Griphook?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: He’ll be leaving too. Bill nods, staring off briefly. Then:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Listen, I don’t know what you’re up to, but I know goblins. If you’ve struck any kind of bargain with Griphook, you must be exceptionally careful to live up to it. If you don’t... he won’t be forgiving. The trio sits in silence. Watches Bill withdraw. Harry glances down at his palm again, at the Snitch.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The sky has lost a star.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: My father used to say that when a child died.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Funny how Mr. Dobby knew exactly where to find us.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yeah. Funny. Listen, Luna, about your father, I don’t want you to think I --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I know you understand why my father did what he did, Harry. That’s why we don’t need to talk about it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Hogwarts?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s not the place you left, you know. It’s not the same.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Neither am I.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Always good value. I’ll miss her. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What d’you think?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Wouldn’t know you if I didn’t know you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You want to tell me what that is?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You mean he could see you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Something like that. I don’t know. He died before I ever got to use it. The thing is...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Go on.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You’ll think I’m mental, but more than once, when I’ve looked into it -- I think I’ve seen Dumbledore. As Ron reacts, Harry’s eyes shift. Bellatrix Lestrange and Griphook, clutching the sword, approach from the cottage.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Bloody hell... that’s a sight.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Well, how do I look?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Hideous.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Oh dear, I missed a spot, didn’t I? Hold still... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Couldn’t do anything about that bit in the back that’s always flipping up, could you? Dead annoying --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Never mind. I’m good. (peering warily at her) That is you in there, isn’t it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You can give that to Hermione to hold, all right, Griphook?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Madam Lestrange.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (cheerily) Good morning. The Warlock eyes her oddly, then continues on. As

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Good morning? Good morning? You’re Bellatrix Lestrange, not some dewy-eyed schoolgirl!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Hey. Easy.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: He’s right. I was being stupid.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: C’mon. Let’s do it. A GUST of WIND BLOWS and we SHIFT TO a FADING POSTER of HARRY flapping on the brick wall, bearing the caption “UNDESIRABLE NUMBER ONE.” On the wall, in SHADOW, we see Griphook clamber onto Harry’s back. As Ron pitches the cloak over them... they vanish.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Identification.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I hardly think that will be necessary. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (looking up) Madam Lestrange! Dear me! How may I help you today?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I wish to enter my vault.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I see. Very well. Excuse me, won’t you? The goblin slips off his stool, goes to consult with another, even more ancient goblin (BOGROD).

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I don’t like to be kept waiting. Hermione’s tone is harsh, authoritative. She turns to Ron, raises an eyebrow. He nods, mouths “Well done,” then looks away, eyeing the guards stationed about the room. One looks up, meets his gaze.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Next.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: He’s with me. (with utter disdain) As difficult as that may be to imagine.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What do you mean? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Madam Lestrange. Would you mind presenting your wand?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And why should I do that? Just then, the guard across the room begins to walk toward Ron. Ron’s eyes dance. He averts his face, WHISPERS:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Harry, what do we do? Harry...? No response. Ron extends his hand as casually as he can, finds only empty space. We --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s the bank’s policy. I’m sure you understand, given the current climate --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No, I most certainly do not understand -- Sensing Harry’s presence, she falters, her own voice emerging through Bellatrix’s. Bogrod eyes her intensely.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’m afraid I must insist. As the guard closes on Ron, Ron looks about frantically, reaching for his wand when a GUST of WIND fills the Hall, sending the ledgers trembling again. The guard approaching Ron shifts his gaze briefly to the entrance, as do the Aged Goblin and Bogrod. None see Harry’s hand slip from the cloak, his wand pointed at Bogrod. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Imperio. The door glides shut. The wind dies. Bogrod blinks.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Very well, Madam Lestrange. If you will follow me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: But... Bogrod, there have been special instructions regarding the Lestrange vault.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’m fully aware of that. I’m also aware the Lestranges are one of our oldest and most respected families.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes, sir, but our instructions are very specific --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Let me be specific with you, Ricbert. I’ve run this bank for forty-five years, long before anyone had even heard of a Death Eater. The day may come that they feel they can run this place better than me, but that day has not yet arrived. Am I understood! The Aged Goblin hesitates, then nods. Bogrod turns to Hermione.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Madam, if you will, I will escort you myself. (to the guard) Teffington, see to that door, will you. The guard glances at Ron, then reluctantly heads for the entrance. Ron quickly falls in line behind Hermione as

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: How long before they come after us?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Time will tell. Harry’s eyes meet Griphook’s in the flickering darkness, then Ron’s face appears over Harry’s shoulder.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What’s that? Up ahead.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I should have known -- Furiously, Griphook starts to throw levers, trying to slow the cart.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What is that, Griphook? The wheels SCREECH, throwing off SPARKS.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Griphook! What is that!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Well done. Hey. (studying her) You look like... you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The Thief’s Downfall. Washes away all enchantments. Can be deadly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You don’t say. (as the cart’s alarms grow faint) Just out of interest... is there any other way out of here?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No. Before the trio can savor this tidbit:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What the devil are you all doing down here!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: We need him!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Is this your doing, Griphook? You have no rights here anymore. When you gave up your keys, you --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Imperio! Bogrod blinks, resumes his mild demeanor. Harry and

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Well done. The trio watch the goblins go, exchange a glance. Unnerved. Just then a MOAN is heard, DEEP and unsettling, coming from down the tunnel. Ron cocks his ear in disbelief.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No. It’s not possible...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Bloody hell. That’s a Welsh Green.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It looks like it’s been down here forever. HINGES SQUEAL SHARPLY and they jump, watch Griphook -- in the SHADOWS -- take something from a wooden box on the wall. An ODD-LOOKING METAL INSTRUMENT. As he steps into the light, he tosses it to Hermione. She glances from it to Griphook, sees him eyeing her with a strange intensity.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Go on.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s been trained to expect pain when it hears the noise. Hermione’s eyes flash to Ron, then to the SCARS on the dragon’s face and neck.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: That’s barbaric. I... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: We’ll only have a few seconds. In other words... they’ll be no do- overs. Understood? The trio eye the dragon, nod.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Ready, Bogrod?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Hm? Oh. Yes. Of course.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Blimey...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Look.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No wonder Bellatrix thought it was real.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Is it here, Harry? Can you feel anything?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s hot! All eyes turn to the bowl, WOBBLING MADLY on the floor, when... it SPLITS APART and begins to MULTIPLY.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: They’ve added Gemino and Flagrante Curses! Everything you touch will burn and multiply! The multiplying bowls skitter across the floor and flip into the air. As one caroms off Ron’s shoe, it bursts into twenty more.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Ron, your foot! It’s SMOKING. As Ron stamps the ground, Harry pivots, tipping a towering STACK of GALLEONS to the floor where they multiply like cockroaches. Instantly, the room is a RIOT of multiplying white-hot metal.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: We’ll be crushed! Hurry! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: That’s it. Up there.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: How’re we going to reach it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Give me the sword! The real one.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Keep going!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Harry! Behind you!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The cup! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: In here!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: We have a deal, Griphook. Griphook looks up. A kind of madness burns in his eyes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I said I’d get you in. I never said anything about getting you out. Pivoting swiftly, he SLAMS Bogrod’s hand to the door and as it melts, Harry, Ron and Hermione ride an avalanche of silver and gold into the outer chamber.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Griphook! Griphook! But Griphook merely looks back, grins madly and, sword in hand, rushes to join the approaching throng.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Thieves! Help! Thieves!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Foul little git. Least we’ve got Bogrod. The dragon SPITS again, reducing Bogrod to dust.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: That’s unfortunate. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: We can’t just stand here! Who’s got an idea?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You’re asking us? You’re the brilliant one.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’ve got something. But it’s mad.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Relashio! The IRON CUFFS on the dragon snap free.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: That’s your idea?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Come on!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It doesn’t realize it’s free! (trying out spells) Leviosa! Aviatus! Ex Cappa! Nothing. Ron and Harry glance at each other and then -- as if reading each other’s mind -- raise their wands high and, as one, JAB the dragon with the tip of their wands. It ROARS, rears, and soars into the air. As it caroms off the sides of the tunnel and scrapes the ceiling, the trio duck, watching the goblins scatter like skittles and dust and debris rain down. Harry looks back, sees the dragon’s SPIKED TAIL THRASHING, the tunnel caving.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: That was brilliant! BRILLIANT!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Bloody hell.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I say we jump!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: When?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: NOW!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The boy has discovered our secret, Nagini. We must find out just how much he knows. We must return to our hiding places and see if the others are safe. A RAPID SUCCESSION OF IMAGES FLASH: Dumbledore’s DESK DRAWER sliding open, revealing TOM RIDDLE’S DIARY and a RING with a BLACK STONE; the underground LAKE; an OLD WOMAN (HEPZIBAH SMITH) in a PARLOR, her teeth black with age, opening a box to reveal Helga Hufflepuff’s CUP; HOGWARTS CASTLE; the FACE of a BEAUTIFUL, SAD-EYED WOMAN (HELENA RAVENCLAW) standing with her EQUALLY-BEAUTIFUL MOTHER (ROWENA RAVENCLAW); the LESTRANGE’S VAULT at GRINGOTTS; a TARNISHED TIARA, a filagreed RAVENCLAW EAGLE among the crown’s detail; HARRY HIMSELF, staring STRAIGHT INTO CAMERA, EYES DARK, THE SURFACE OF HIS SKIN TREMBLING LIKE WATER; NAGINI, FANGS FLASHING...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (to Nagini) And you, my friend, must stay close... As the great snake wends its way around Voldemort’s feet, we see a BLOODY HAND gripping the Sword of Gryffindor. It is Griphook, eyes blank, body still. As we watch, the sword slowly... VANISHES.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (out of breath) You-Know-Who. He knows we broke into Gringotts. He knows what we took. He knows we’re hunting Horcruxes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: How is it you --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I saw him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You let him in! Harry, you can’t --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I can’t always help it, Hermione! (frowning) Maybe I can. I don’t know.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Never mind! What did you see?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

Dialogue: You saw it?

Dialogue: Tonight? But we have to plan. We have to figure out what --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: We’ll go to Hogsmeade. To Honeydukes. Take the secret passage in the cellar.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: There’s something wrong with him. In the past, I could always follow his thoughts. Now everything feels disconnected.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Maybe it’s because of the Horcruxes. Maybe he’s growing weaker. Maybe he’s dying.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

Dialogue: What’s he mean by that?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No, you’ll give us away. The night grows darker, the streetlights dim. The trio’s breath drifts visibly in the gathering chill. As the Dementors descend, the trio grimace, beset by bleak thoughts. A tear escapes Hermione’s eye, trails down her cheek. Finally, Harry can take it no more.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Expecto Patronum! A SILVER STAG bursts from his wand and charges down the street, scattering the Dementors before vanishing around the other side of the HOG’S HEAD INN. DEATH EATER #2 It’s him! He’s down there! FOOTSTEPS clatter on the cobblestones. Harry, Ron and

Dialogue: He’s dead.

Dialogue: Dung had no right selling you that. It belonged to --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Right then. Reckon you’re hungry. Let’s get you fed, then think of the best way to get you out of here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Do you hear much from the others? From the Order?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The Order is finished. You-Know- Who’s won. Anyone who says otherwise is kidding themselves. The trio exchange glances. HARRY doesn’t touch the food, * just stares quietly at ABERFORTH. *

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: We need to get into Hogwarts.

Dialogue: If we can find it and kill it, * then we kill him, and then we can * end this war once and for all. We * need to get into Hogwarts tonight. * Aberforth stares at him for a moment, until the silence * grows. * ABERFORTH * It’s not a job my brother’s given * you, it’s a suicide mission. Do * yourself a favor boy. Go home. * Live a little longer. * HARRY *

Dialogue: You know what to do... * The girl smiles, turns, and walks away, growing slowly * smaller in the painting with each step she takes. * HARRY * Where’ve you sent her? * ABERFORTH * You’ll see soon enough. * HERMIONE * That’s Ariana, isn’t it? Your * sister. She’s beautiful. * ABERFORTH * She’ll always be beautiful. *

Dialogue: She’s coming back! And she’s got someone with her! * Just then, the painting BLOOMS FAINTLY and ARIANA emerges * from deep within the dark canvas. * RON * Who’s that with her? Bloody * hell... * As ARIANA draws closer, the LIMPING FIGURE beside her * comes clear: NEVILLE. *

Dialogue: I knew you’d come! I told them all! Harry Potter would never abandon Hogwarts! * HERMIONE * (softly) *

Dialogue: Well? Ready?

Dialogue: That’s because it never existed till now. The seven secret passages were sealed off before the start of the year. This is the only way in or out now. The grounds are crawling with Death Eaters and Dementors.

Dialogue: How bad is it, Neville? With

Dialogue: The Carrows? (CONTINUED)

Dialogue: Brother and sister. They’re in charge of discipline. Like punishment, the Carrows.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Today’s Dark Arts lesson had us practicing the Cruciatus Curse. On First Years. I refused. Hogwarts has changed. The others look shocked. Neville grins.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Aw, c’mon. Don’t be grim. We’re all used to it by now. And the thing is, it helps when people stand up, gives everyone hope. I used to notice that when you did it, Harry. C’mon, we’re almost there. The trio exchange glances, follow Neville.

Dialogue: Let’s have a bit of fun, shall we? (pushing open the door) Hey! Listen up, you lot! I’ve brought you a surprise!

Dialogue: Blimey. ... VOICES EXPLODE. Madness ensues as the trio is swallowed up in a scrum of backslaps and handshakes. Many familiar faces are present. Luna. Dean Thomas. CHO CHANG. LAVENDER BROWN. Neville leans down, WHISPERS to NIGEL.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Get the word out to Remus and the others that Harry’s back. Nigel nods, scrambles over to a battered WIZARD WIRELESS. As it CRACKLES to life he leans close, SPEAKS.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: River, DA calling. Do you read? We have a new weather report: Lightning has struck. I repeat, lightning has struck...

Dialogue: We don’t know.

Dialogue: Where is it?

Dialogue: I realize it’s not much to go on.

Dialogue: That’s nothing to go on.

Dialogue: I think it might have something to do with Ravenclaw. It would be small, easy to conceal, valuable. Any ideas?
