Dialogue: Well, there’s Rowena Ravenclaw’s lost diadem.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (under his breath) Oh, bloody hell. Here we go.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The lost diadem of Ravenclaw? Hasn’t anyone ever heard of it? It’s quite famous.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes, but Luna, it’s lost. For centuries now. There’s not a person alive today who’s seen it. Her fellow Ravenclaws nod. Ron frowns.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Excuse me. But would someone tell me: what’s a bloody diadem?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s a kind of crown. You know, like a tiara. As she says this, Harry frowns, trying to think if he’s seen such a thing in the castle.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Hey there.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Got loads of those, though, doesn’t she? There’s only one Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Shut up, Seamus.

Dialogue: What is it, Ginny?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Many of you are surely wondering why I have summoned you here at this hour. It has come to my attention that earlier this evening... Harry Potter was sighted in Hogsmeade. A MURMURED THRILL fills the Hall. McGonagall’s eyes glisten with curiosity. Snape raises his voice, briefly, to quell the noise in the Hall.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I mention this in the hopes that truth will not be supplanted by rumor. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: For myself and a few select members of the staff this comes as little surprise. We have, for some time, considered Mr. Potter’s return to Hogwarts to be not only possible but inevitable. Consequently, in the past several months and under my specific direction, exhaustive defensive strategies have been employed to defeat any attempt Mr. Potter might make to breach these walls. But know this. Should anyone -- student or staff -- attempt to aid Mr. Potter, that person will be punished in a manner consistent with the severity of their transgression. Rest assured: So long as I am Headmaster at Hogwarts, Harry Potter will never again step foot in this castle. As APPLAUSE erupts from the Slytherins, Maisy Reynolds, glowers over at them. Snape raises a hand. The room returns to silence.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Now then. If anyone here has knowledge of Mr. Potter’s movements this evening... I invite them to step forward now.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: A FIGURE appears in the shadows at the back of the Hall. McGonagall’s chin rises in disbelief. Maisy’s face blooms with hope. And then...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I think I can help you out with that... ... Harry appears.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It would seem that, despite your exhaustive defensive strategies, you have a bit of a security problem, Headmaster.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And I’m afraid it’s rather extensive. The Carrows, who had been moving towards Harry, falter, turn to Snape with uncertainty. Harry’s eyes narrow with malice as he stares at Snape.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: How dare you stand where he stood.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Tell them how it was that night. Tell then how you looked him in the eye, a man who trusted you... and killed him. Tell them! Snape’s eyes find Harry’s, but his face remains a mask. McGonagall stands poised, no longer an ashen ghost. Flitwick’s hand twitches over his wand. The air prickles with anticipation.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’m a Gryffindor. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL I thought it might have something to do with that. (turning to the room) All right! Settle down! Settle down! The room quiets. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL It appears that your Headmaster, to use the common phrase, has done a bunk. CHEERS RISE from all Houses save Slytherin, where PANSY PARKINSON glowers along with Blaise and Goyle. Even McGonagall can’t help but smile. Just then, Harry WINCES slightly, pressing his fingers to his temple. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Potter... A slow RUMBLING fills the Hall. Harry, fingers trembling with pain, glances up, sees DARK CLOUDS coagulating in the Enchanted Ceiling. McGonagall follows his gaze, as do others, watching as the clouds shift eerily, like blots of blood. Suddenly the FLAMES in the torches along the walls TREMBLE as a CHILL BREEZE consumes the room. The Hall slowly DIMS. All grows progressively silent when... ... a GIRL SCREAMS, her voice rising and rising. Harry rushes through the throng, the students parting as he pelts forwards, pushing past them until he finds... ... Maisy, cowering on the floor in the corner, hands over her ears, eyes clenched tight. She seems possessed. Everyone watches, chilled. Finally Harry starts to move forward, when he himself WINCES, pressing his fingers to his temples. Another person SCREAMS somewhere in the Hall, then another. Harry glances about him, at the circle of faces in his vicinity. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I know that many of you will want to fight. Some of you may even think this wise. But this is folly. We WEAVE THROUGH the room, taking in the faces, listening in mute misery as Voldemort speaks. Ginny, Hermione, Ron, Fred, George, Seamus... on and on.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I wish you no harm. I have great respect for the students of Hogwarts. I was once one myself after all. I ask for but one thing and if granted no magical blood shall be spilt... For a moment they stand, hung in silence...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Give me Harry Potter. Do this and none shall be harmed. Give me

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: But he’s there! Potter’s there! Someone grab him! Instinctively, Ginny steps in front of Harry, wand drawn. Then, as one, the Gryffindors assemble in a line and face towards the Slytherins, shielding Harry. Moments later, the Ravenclaws and Hufflepuffs do the same. Harry’s eyes glitter at the sight, moved. Ginny lowers her wand. Just then... FILCH bursts in the Hall. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Students out of bed! Students in the corridors!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Oh. Sorry, mum.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

Dialogue: I can bring ‘er down. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL That’s the spirit. Now off you go. Neville, Ginny, Seamus and the DA peel off.

Dialogue: You realize, of course, that nothing we do will be able to keep out You-Know-Who indefinitely.

He’s going to try to kill you either way. With that, McGonagall wheels, raises her wand and points it in the direction of the Great Hall. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Piertotum Locomotor!

Dialogue: Not good.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Tell Professor McGonagall Remus and I will handle this side of the castle.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes, sir. As Dean starts off, the grounds beyond and below come INTO VIEW: a sea of Death Eaters. Kingsley and Remus stop dead, narrow their eyes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Dean! (as Dean stops) On second thought, tell Professor McGonagall we might need one or two more wands this side. Dean nods, continues on, merely trading a glance with Arthur, Fred and George as they appear, staring in stunned disbelief at the deadly throng across the landscape.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s the quality of one’s conviction that determines success, not the number of one’s followers.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Who said that?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Me. For the first time, they look at each other, share a fatalistic smile. Just then TONKS appears. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Speaking of quality. Tonks rushes past the Weasleys, lightly touching Arthur’s arm as she leaps into Lupin’s embrace. He hugs her deeply.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You shouldn’t have. It’s Teddy who needs you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: He’ll sleep ‘til dawn and snore like his father. It’s you who needs me tonight.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s you...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Ha! Ha! Scabior stops short, eyeing the area ahead warily.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yeah! You and whose army!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Woah! Easy up there!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Sorry. (rubbing his elbow) Ow.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (in Parseltongue) Take me inside. Hermione’s eyes widen in shock. Ron shrugs.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No. Of course not. The hatch swings open.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’ve never got this far before.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’m scared.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Me too.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I didn’t expect it to be like this.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What did you expect it to be like?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Not this.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You’re the Grey Lady, the ghost of Ravenclaw Tower.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I do not answer to that name.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’m sorry. It’s Helena, isn’t it? Helena Ravenclaw. Rowena’s daughter. Luna told me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Are you a friend of Luna’s? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes. She thought you might be able to help me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You seek my mother’s diadem.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes! That’s right --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Wait! Please!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Many have sought my mother’s diadem. Its powers are legendary...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: But I don’t care about its powers! Honestly -- But she is drifting away. Harry watches in desperation.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I don’t seek it for myself! You have to believe me! But she only drifts on. Helplessly, Harry watches her go, then... decides:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I want to destroy it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: That’s what you want, isn’t it, Helena? You want it destroyed.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (vague, drifting)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: But I only wanted to be more like her, clever and wise. She wore it so beautifully, but on me... I grew to hate it... the pain I felt... the pain I feel even now...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’ll end your pain, Helena. Tell me where it is and I’ll destroy it, I swear, on my mother’s memory --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Another swore to destroy it, many years ago, a strange boy with a strange name...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Tom Riddle --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: But he lied.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: He’s lied to many people -- Suddenly, her eyes blaze with anger, her face contorting horribly and Harry can’t help but take a step back.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I know what he’s done! I know who he is! He defiled it! With Dark Magic!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes. That’s right. But I can undo that, Helena. I can destroy it once and for all. But only if you tell me where he hid it. You know where he hid it, don’t you, Helena? You just have to tell me. Please. (stepping toward her) Trust me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Strange... you remind me of him a bit... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s here. In the castle. In the place where everything is hidden...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: If you have to ask, you’ll never know. If you know, you need only ask... Slowly, Harry’s expression changes. Then, he is backing away.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Thank you... ... then turning...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Thank you... ... then running.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You do it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes, you can. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Not good.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Ready!?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Are you bloody joking?!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (to himself) Oh God -- KA-BLAAAAAM! Neville sets off the charges. Instantly, one bridge section after another EXPLODES, rolling up like a carpet. Snatchers fall from sight, plummeting into the darkness. Neville looks over his shoulder, sees Scabior closing on him, then looks back towards Ginny, who stands frozen, wand raised, never fired, looking at... ... Seamus, his face blooming with fanatical ecstasy as he watches the charges detonate. As Seamus HOWLS with pleasure, Neville, WHEEZING PAINFULLY at this point, glances back and sees that Scabior has closed the distance, is coming fast when -- KA-BLAM! -- Scabior is catapulted into the air. Neville looks momentarily relieved, then realizes, to his evident dismay, that the bridge is falling away with increasing speed. Alarmed,

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: He’s good... The remainders begin to discharge, tripping off like firecrackers, one section after another vanishing...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: He’s good... ... including the section under Neville’s feet... And he is gone.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (sarcastically) Well done, Seamus!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (grinning) Told yeh I’d bring ‘er down. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: That was kind of exciting. Seamus grins and winks knowingly. Ginny shakes her head.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Mad. The both of you. Just then, a thundering RUMBLE almost sends Neville tumbling off the bridge again. As Ginny steadies him, they all peer into the distance: GIANTS.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Not good.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Night-tee night.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You let us out of here, you filthy squib! Filch grins, shaking the ring of keys in his hand, then turns away. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Ginny! Neville! You alright?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Never better! Feel like I could spit fire! Haven’t seen Luna, have you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’m mad for her! Think it’s about time I told her, seeing as there’s a pretty good chance we’ll both be dead by dawn! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I know. Then she is off, running, gone.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Bloody hell. We’ll never find him on this.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: There he is.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What? As Hermione points to Harry’s name amidst the ant colony on the parchment, Ron -- unbeknownst to her -- regards her with naked appreciation.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Brilliant.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (amazed he remembered) That’s right. I did.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Let’s go. As Ron dashes off, Hermione -- unbeknownst to him -- regards him with naked appreciation, then follows.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Brilliant. 279 OMITTED 279

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Take my hand. (as they hesitate) Now.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Well, well, what brings you here, Potter?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I could ask you the same.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I virtually lived here last year. Remember?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I remember.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You have something of mine. I’d like it back.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What’s wrong with the one you have?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (studying it) It’s my mother’s. It’s very powerful, but it’s not the same. It doesn’t... understand me. (looking up) Know what I mean? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Easy.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Why didn’t you tell her?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Bellatrix. You knew it was me. But you didn’t say anything. Blaise and Goyle, confused by this, regard Draco dimly from either side. Draco fidgets, his hand twitching on the wand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Give me my wand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No. I don’t think so... With blithe disregard, Harry removes the wand in his own pocket, ponders it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Besides, its allegiance is to me now. If you want it, you’ll have to win it back. Perhaps even kill me...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: C’mon, Draco. Don’t be a prat. Just do ’im. Draco’s hand twitches, his brow conflicted, then his eyes shift -- catch sight of Hermione, in SILHOUETTE, far beyond Harry’s shoulder, her wand pointed... at him. He blinks, as if she were a mirage... then... a BALL of SCARLET LIGHT bursts from her wand, briefly illuminating her face, and strikes his hand. As his wand flies free,

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Avada Kedavra! The spell caroms off the stone bust instead, sending the diadem spinning into the air.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Expelliarmus! Blaise’s wand flies free and he scarpers. An instant later, Hermione steps INTO VIEW. A MASSIVE GROAN echoes and the walls of towering junk SHUDDER. Harry looks up.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: One after another, the towering walls spill like dominos.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Did you see where it went? The diadem!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s gone! We’ll never -- Ting! Ting! Ting! The diadem drops from the sky and hops, skips and jumps down the aisle in front of them.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Well done. Let’s find Ron and get out of here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: RUN! Goyle’s set the bloody place on fire! As one, the trio dashes through the remaining aisles as the towers of junk turn to ash all around them. The flames draw closer, mutating into a pack of fiery beasts: SERPENTS, CHIMAERAS, DRAGONS -- all nipping at their heels. No matter which way they turn, the flames follow them.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Split up! Each goes a separate way, but it’s no use. The fire simply divides, the serpent slithering after Harry, the chimaera after Hermione, the dragon after Ron. Harry glances up, sees Malfoy and Blaise scaling a mountain of burning junk, doomed. He takes one turn after another until he comes to a clearing and nearly runs into... Ron and Hermione as they arrive from separate paths. They glance around frantically. No free path exists. The flames ROAR, racing toward them.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Do we climb!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No, it’ll just follow us!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Here! Take one!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Serves him right.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: C’mon! This way! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Wait! What about Malfoy and Blaise!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (to Hermioine) He’s joking, right? Then Harry sees them, perched atop a fragile, crumbling tower. Harry whips his broom around and jets forth. Ron shakes his head, then jets after, BELLOWING:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: IF WE DIE FOR THEM, I’LL KILL YOU, HARRY!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Brilliant.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Nagini. Come.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You’re bloody well welcome! (looking away) Prat.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Ron, you once asked me if I thought he felt it -- Voldemort -- when we destroy a Horcrux, when we destroy a piece of his soul.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s the snake. She’s the last one. The last Horcrux.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Where will he take her?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Someplace safe.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No. He’ll keep her close. As Harry wipes his brow, grazing his scar, trying to dispel the pain he feels -- Ron studies him intently.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Look inside him, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Find out where he is. If we find him, we find the snake. Then we’re one step closer to ending this.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Stop looking at her. She smells your fear. It agitates her. Be grateful she’s just eaten.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Forgive me, my Lord, but wouldn’t it be more prudent to call off this battle and seek the boy yourself?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I do not need to seek the boy! Before the night is out, he will come to me! Do you understand!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Of c-course, my Lord. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: How do you live with yourself, Lucius? (eyeing him with disgust) Go. Find Severus. Tell him I need to see him immediately.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I know where he is.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: There’s more to me than incense and tea leaves, Mr. Finnegan. Dean trades spells with a Death Eater, while Luna STUNS a QUARTET of Death Eaters -- one-two-three -- and watches the fourth fall before she can fire. She turns, sees

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Thanks.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Don’t mention it. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: NO!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Why doesn’t it work for me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You have performed extraordinary magic with this wand, my Lord. In the last few hours alone --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No! I am extraordinary! But the wand resists me! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: There is no wand more powerful. Ollivander himself said it. Tonight, when the boy comes to you, it will not fail you, I am sure. It answers to you and you only.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Does it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: My Lord?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The wand. Does it truly answer to me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You’re a clever man, Severus. Surely you must know.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Where, Severus? Where does its loyalty lie?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: With you, of course, my Lord.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The Elder Wand cannot serve me properly, Severus, because I am not its true master. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The Elder Wand belongs to the wizard who killed its last owner. Ollivander was quite explicit about that. You killed Dumbledore, Severus. While you live, the Elder Wand cannot be truly mine.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: My Lord --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You have been a good and faithful servant, Severus.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: But only I can live forever...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Kill. Snape’s eyes shift... meet the snake’s. The snake strikes. Harry’s SCREAM is swallowed by Snape’s own.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Nagini! Come!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Take them...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Take them!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Please.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Give me something! Quickly! A flask! Anything. Instantly, Hermione CONJURES a flask from thin air. Hands trembling, Harry presses it to Snape’s ashen cheek, letting the fluid flow within.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You have your mother’s eyes...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: He’s gone. The snake too. Just then the sound of THUNDER, like a GATHERING STORM, engulfs them. The joists of the shack GROAN, as if in agony. The entire room begins to tremble. Ron yanks a board from the window and the trio peers out. As in the Enchanted Ceiling before, a face appears in the dark clouds above. And then VOLDEMORT’S VOICE ECHOES:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You have fought valiantly... but in vain. I do not wish this. Every drop of magical blood spilled is a terrible waste. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I therefore command my forces to retreat. In their absence, dispose of your dead with dignity. Treat your injured. (a beat)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Never! Do you hear me! NEVER!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Where is everyone?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: ... poised on the threshold, looking in.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Triage. The House tables have been pushed to the walls. The injured stand in groups, arms slung over one another, waiting to be treated by MADAM POMFREY. Filch’s arm gushes blood. Flitwick’s face is laced with GASHES.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Lily... Then...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Lily! Come out of there! Now!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: We’re going home. Petunia takes Lily’s arm, turns -- and stops. A SKINNY BOY (YOUNG SNAPE) sits beneath a tree, watching them. Without a word, he opens his hand and a LEAF FLUTTERS from his palm like a butterfly, circling Lily once, then drifting up and away. Lily smiles, charmed. Petunia eyes the boy fearfully, then pulls Lily away. The boy watches them go. As Lily glances back... We GO TO BLACK...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: She’s jealous. Because she’s ordinary and you’re special.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: That’s mean.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s true. You know so yourself.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No! Don’t kill me! A SNAPPING of ROBES precedes Dumbledore as he APPARATES

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: That wasn’t my intention.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Stand up, Severus. I haven’t much time. What message do you bring from Lord Voldemort this time?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (rising) None. I come on my own account. I come with a... request. Dumbledore’s eyes flicker briefly with interest. He studies Snape’s fearful face.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Is this about the Prophecy?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: How much did you relay?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Only what I heard. But now... he thinks it refers to her.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The Prophecy did not refer to a woman. It spoke of a boy born at the end of July --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes! But he thinks it’s her son!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: If she means so much to you, surely Lord Voldemort would spare her in exchange for the boy. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I have asked.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You disgust me. You would sacrifice the life of an innocent child over a schoolboy crush?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: She’s more than that! She’s different! Beautiful. Kind. (looking away) Hide them all. I beg you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And should I do so, what will you give me in return, Severus?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Anything. The wind rises again, the TREES TREMBLING and...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You said you would keep her safe!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Lily and James put their faith in the wrong person. Rather like you, Severus.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The boy survives. Snape’s eyes shift. Regard Dumbledore.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: DON’T!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: If you loved Lily Evans, Severus. If you truly loved her. Then your way is clear. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The Dark Lord will return. And the boy will be in terrible danger when he does.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No one can know. Your word.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: My word that I shall never reveal the best of you, Severus? If you insist.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Sometimes we see what we expect to see, Severus. Other teachers indicate the boy is modest, likeable and while no prodigy, possesses above-average gifts. Personally, I find him rather engaging.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You see what you want to see. Severus walks on. Dumbledore smiles with amusement.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Perhaps. Oh. Severus. (as he stops) Keep an eye on Professor Quirrell, won’t you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Why did you put it on? Surely you realized it carried a curse.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I was... foolish... greedy...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Drink the rest. It will contain the curse to the hand for the time being. Dumbledore’s eyes open, examine his damaged fingers.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: For the time being?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It will spread.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: How long?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Maybe a year.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Well, this makes matters much more straightforward.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Do not ignore me, Severus. Was it not you who told me of Lord Voldemort’s plan to have the Malfoy boy murder me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It is not expected that he will succeed.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: But should he fail, one would presume the Dark Lord will turn to... you. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You must agree.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes. You must be the one to kill me, Severus. It is the only way. Only then will the Dark Lord trust you completely.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You ask too much.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (thundering) Too much! Nothing I could ask is too much. You know what is at stake! You more than anyone!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: There will come a time when Harry Potter must be told something. But you must wait until Voldemort is at his most vulnerable.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Tell him what?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: On the night Lord Voldemort went to Godric’s Hollow to kill Harry, and Lily Potter cast herself between them, the curse rebounded. When that happened, a part of Lord Voldemort’s soul latched itself onto the only living thing it could find: Harry himself.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: There’s a reason Harry can speak with snakes. There’s a reason he can look into Lord Voldemort’s mind. A part of Lord Voldemort lives inside him. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: So when the time comes, the boy must die.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes. And Voldemort himself must do it. That is essential.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You’ve kept him alive so that he can die at the proper moment. You’ve been raising him like a pig for slaughter.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: But this is touching, Severus. Don’t tell me you’ve grown to care for the boy?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Expecto Patronum! A blast of LIGHT bursts from his wand, soars out the window: a SILVER DOE.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Lily. After all this time?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Always... We GO TO BLACK...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The irony of course, Severus, is that -- in the end -- you and the boy desire the same thing...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Where’ve you been?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: We thought you’d gone to the forest, we thought you might be --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’m going there now.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Are you mad! No!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s... meant to be.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Rubbish! You can’t just give yourself up to him --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What is it, Harry? What is it you know?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: There’s a reason I can... hear them -- the Horcruxes. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I think I’ve known for awhile. (studying her) I think you’ve known too.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’ll go with you. I’ll --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Kill the snake. Kill the snake and then it’s just him. Then it will be over.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’ll take him from here. Oliver throws Nigel over his shoulder, enters the Great Hall. Neville watches them go, looking, for a moment, very old. Then, wearily, he turns, heading back outside.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s all right. We’re going to get you inside.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I kept calling. No one came.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Don’t worry. I won’t leave you. I promise.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (murmuring) Once. Twice. Thrice...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You’ve been so brave, sweetheart.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Why are you here? All of you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: We never left, dear.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Does it hurt? Dying?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Quicker than falling asleep. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And he will want it to be quick.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You’re nearly there, son.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’m sorry. I didn’t want any of you to die for me. And Remus, your son...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Others will tell him what his mother and father died for. Someday he’ll understand... A CHILL BREEZE shakes the trees. Harry looks ahead.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You’ll stay with me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Until the end.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No. We’re here, you see.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Stay close to me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Always...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No sign of him, my Lord.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I thought he would come. I was, it seems... mistaken.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You weren’t. All eyes shift to Harry, standing at the clearing’s edge.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: HARRY! NO! WHAT’RE YEH DOIN’ ‘ERE! HAGRID is trussed to a tree. The branches shake violently as he tries to break free.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Quiet!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You cannot help.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Harry. You wonderful boy. You brave, brave man. Let us walk. NEW ANGLE - HARRY AND DUMBLEDORE Walking.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Sir, this, is this... I mean, forgive me, but you are dead, aren’t you, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Oh, yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Then... I’m dead too?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Ah. That is the question, isn’t it? On the whole I think not.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Not?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Not. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: But I didn’t defend myself. I let him kill me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And that will, I think, have made all the difference. I suspect you now realize that you and Voldemort have been connected by something other than fate since that night in Godric’s Hollow all those years ago, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It’s true, isn’t it, sir? A bit of him lives in me, doesn’t it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Did. It was just destroyed only moments ago by none other than

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You were the seventh Horcrux, Harry; the Horcrux he never meant to make.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And you knew this? That’s why you were certain I wouldn’t die?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Certain? No. Little is certain in this world, Harry. Call it an educated guess.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Professor, is that -- ?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Something beyond either of our help.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Exactly where are we, sir? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I was going to ask you that. Where would you say that we are?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It looks like King’s Cross station -- only a lot cleaner. And without the trains.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: King’s Cross! Is that right? Well, this is, as they say, your party.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Sir, why didn’t you just tell me about the Deathly Hallows?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You will have to forgive me, Harry. You see... I didn’t trust you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I feared that you would make the same mistake I made, that you would be intoxicated by the power the Hallows promise their possessor. But I crave your pardon, Harry. It’s clear to me now, as it should have been all along, that you are the better man.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Sir --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You are the worthy possessor of the Hallows, Harry, not me. I was fit to own the Elder Wand, because I took it not for gain, but to save others from it. But I took the Stone because I longed to recall someone who has long been at peace and for that I paid with my life. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You wanted to see Ariana again, didn’t you, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I used the Stone as well, sir, only a little while ago when I entered the Forest. I saw my mum and dad, and Sirius and Lupin...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: True. But ask yourself this: were you calling them? Or were they calling you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (looking him in the eye) You are the true master of death, Harry, because the true master does not seek to run away from death. He accepts that he must die, and understands that there are far, far worse things in the living world. For a moment, they stand in silence.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’ve got to go back, haven’t I?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: That is up to you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’ve got a choice?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Oh yes. We are in King’s Cross, you say? I think, should you so decide, you would be able to, let’s say, board a train.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And where would it take me? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: On.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Voldemort’s got the Elder Wand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: True.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And the snake lives.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: And I’ve nothing to kill it with.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: ‘Help will always be given at Hogwarts to those who ask for it.’

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I have always prized my ability to turn a phrase -- words are, in my not so humble opinion, our most inexhaustible source of magic, capable both of inflicting injury and remedying it. But I would -- in this case -- amend my original statement to this: (leaning close) Help will always be given at Hogwarts to those who most deserve it... (leaning back) Assuming circumstances in the main are favorable to such an outcome, of course.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: With all due respect, sir, I think what we need here is a miracle.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’ve never put much stock in miracles, Harry. On the other hand, I can attest wholly to the extensive advantages of a related phenomenon. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Which would be, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Luck.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living and, above all, those who live without love.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Sir, my mother’s Patronus. It was a doe, wasn’t it? Just like Professor Snape’s. Curious, don’t you think?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Actually, if I think about it... it doesn’t seem curious at all. (a smile) I’ll be going now, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Professor. As Dumbledore stops, Harry gestures vaguely.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Is this real? Or has this been happening inside my head?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry. But why should that mean that it is not real?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (in a whisper) Is he alive...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: My lord, let me help you --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I do not require assistance. Across the clearing, Voldemort rises shakily, Bellatrix at his elbow. The Death Eaters watch, stirring uncertainly. Voldemort glances toward Narcissa, toward Harry. Bellatrix detects the wary glint in his eyes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The boy. Is he dead? Harry’s eyes shift, meet Narcissa’s once again. Something in her expression... He closes his eyes. She places her fingers over his heart, WHISPERS:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Is he alive? Draco?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Don’t despair, Longbottom. I put you in Gryffindor for good reason... The Hat COUGHS then, raining dust over Neville’s brow and he whips it off, studies it warily.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Who’s that?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: ... Hagrid’s carrying?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Neville, who is that? Before he can answer, others begin to spill out of the castle. Luna and Seamus. Cho. Arthur Weasley. Ron and

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What’s going on here, Neville? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Behold, Nagini. Our work is done.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: No... NO!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: SILENCE!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Stupid girl. You cry for that?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (addressing all) Tell me. These last few hours -- as you collected the dead and tended your wounded -- was he by your side?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: While your hands ran dark with the blood of mothers and sons, fathers and daughters, brothers and sisters, his were clasped in prayer -- but it was a prayer for one and one only. While you battled courageously, until you could no longer will yourself to stand, he had long since fallen to his knees. While you cursed me until your voices grew ragged, he begged me for mercy in a voice as meek as a child’s.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: So do not cry for that. He’s not worthy of your tears. And do not despair of his betrayal. You were never in his heart. Not for one single solitary beat.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Liar!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Did you not hear me! Harry Potter is dead! From this day forward, you put your faith in me or suffer the consequences. HARRY POTTER IS DEAD! Nagini HISSES MADLY as Voldemort, looking a touch mad himself, rakes his eyes over the students and staff.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Now is the time to declare yourself. There is a nervous MURMUR among the crowd.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Draco...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Draco, don’t be stupid -- (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Come, Draco. Her tone is quiet, but absolute. Draco looks into her eyes, then ducks his head and steps forward, avoiding the baleful glances directed his way as he crosses the gulf between factions. Ron mutters poisonously as he passes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Well done, Draco. Who will be next? Hm? Come now, don’t be shy. We TRAVEL OVER FACES, weary but resolved, eyes burning with defiance, then LAND ON Neville, chin on chest, gaze to the ground. As the Sorting Hat rocks gently in his hand, something GLINTS within again, and a QUIVERING PARABOLA OF REFLECTED LIGHT dances above his brow.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Well, I must say, I’d hoped for better. Is this truly the best Hogwarts has to offer? The Death Eaters laugh. Bellatrix grins in cruel amusement.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Who might you be, young man?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Well, welcome, Neville. I’m sure we can find a place for you in our ranks.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Someone has to do the washing. The Death Eaters ROAR. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Now, now, Bellatrix. Let’s not underestimate our young friend. By stepping forward, he lives to see another day...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’d like to say something. Voldemort’s brow furrows vaguely. As he studies Neville, we --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: ... as his eyelids separate ever-so-slightly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Very well, Neville. I’m sure we’d all be fascinated to hear what you have to say.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It doesn’t matter that Harry is gone. A troubled MURMUR ripples through the crowd.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (angrily) Stand down, Neville!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: People die every day. Friends. Family. Yes, we lost Harry tonight. But he’s still with us, here -- (tapping his heart) And so is Fred and Remus and Tonks and... all of them. They didn’t die in vain. (turning to Bellatrix) But you will. (to a trio of Death Eaters) And you and you and you will. (to Voldemort) And so will you. Because you’re wrong. Harry’s heart did beat for us. All of us...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: This isn’t over. SCARLET glints in Voldemort’s eyes and he smiles, raising the Elder Wand when Neville -- in keen anticipation -- reaches into the Sorting Hat and pulls forth... The Sword of Gryffindor. As Voldemort’s wand FIRES, Neville parries and the curse REBOUNDS, taking out the QUARTET of DEATH EATERS flanking

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Potter!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Well done, Malfoy! (to himself) Can’t believe I just said that. Wand in hand, Harry turns and -- in one continuous motion -- FIRES on Voldemort. Voldemort blocks the spell, eyeing Harry with mild disbelief, then anger. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Confringo! FLAMES run the length of Nagini -- with no effect -- then climb the back of a nearby Death Eater and consume him. Enraged that Harry has attacked Nagini, Voldemort FIRES a VOLLEY of CURSES. Harry parries the first, then falls back into a cloister. The stonework EXPLODES all around him, creating THREE RAGGED HOLES. He pelts away.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: The snake! We’ve got to kill the snake! Neville, only a few yards off, sword in hand, OVERHEARS. As his eyes shift to Voldemort and Nagini.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Harry! Look out!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Nagini! With me!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Leave her!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I said LEAVE HER!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (in Parseltongue) Now, my sweet. Now.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Nagini!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Die! Die!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Why do you live! As Voldemort’s face looms close, eyeing Harry like a curious specimen, Harry looks up.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Because I have something worth living for. Angrily, Voldemort poises the Elder Wand over HARRY’S SCAR. The flesh there begins to color with blood, the lightning bolt turning white as ice. And then... Voldemort’s HAND BEGINS TO TREMBLE. He stares at the wand and watches -- in horror -- as a CRACK APPEARS and begins to expand along its length. For a moment, he only stares, as if betrayed...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Confringo! The tendrils of fabric BURST INTO FLAMES. Voldemort falls back and -- with his fractured wand -- slices the burning ribbons. As they turn to ash, Harry stumbles back and Voldemort picks him up and hurls him INTO A WALL. As he rises, Voldemort fires again.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: SHADOWS streak across our PLANE OF VIEW, like warriors in an ancient shadow play. SOUND SURFACES SLOWLY, ODDLY, as if our EAR DRUMS were numb and swollen and gradually returning to normal. We return to the EYES, unblinking, slowly drifting in their sockets, taking in the sound and fury that dances across the irises. We PULL BACK and REVEAL... Neville. Bruised but unbowed. In an instant, it all comes clear -- to him and us -- that the Hall is full of WIZARDS, fighting. Something glimmers in Neville’s periphery: The Sword of Gryffindor.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: NOT MY DAUGHTER, YOU BITCH!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Come on, granny, give us your best. Mrs. Weasley fires a volley of spells and Bellatrix’s smile fades. As she counters, JETS of LIGHT fly back and forth, skittering off the tables and overturned benches. Just then...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Back off, boys! She’s mine! (glaring at Bellatrix) You will never touch my children again! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Be thankful we only took one. Besides... (indicating George) It’s not like you don’t have a spare. As Bellatrix GRINS, a MASSIVE GREEN BOLT of LIGHT spits from Mrs. Weasley’s wand, striking Bellatrix directly in the sternum. Bellatrix’s smile curdles, then she topples to the floor, still. A BLOOD-CHILLING SCREAM fills the air...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Hermione!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Yes!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I need to tell you something!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I don’t want you to say anything you wouldn’t say if we weren’t about to be killed by a giant snake! It’ll just ruin it!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: You were right. Voldemort’s eyes glitter curiously. Harry’s eyes drift to the wand in Voldemort’s hand. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: When you told Professor Snape it was failing you. It will always fail you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It belongs to me! I killed Snape!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: (taunting him) But what if the wand never belonged to him? What if the wand’s allegiance was to someone else?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Come on, Tom. Let’s end this the way we started it...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Together. And then he falls back, pulling them both... 347-349 OMITTED 347-349

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What’s the matter with her?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: NEW ANGLE - HARRY AND VOLDEMORT ... entwined, morphing monstrously in and out of one another, a single screaming beast one minute, adversaries the next, hurtling downward, toward the courtyard below...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: There’s more to me than incense and tea leaves, Mr. Finnegan.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I told you: it’s useless to you. Just then, Ron and Hermione burst INTO VIEW, followed by Nagini. Nagini rises, ready to strike. Harry turns, wand in hand, but he’s too late.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Not exactly leaving the place better than we found it, are we?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Can’t make an omelette without breaking a few eggs.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Something my mum used to say.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Why didn’t it work for him? The Elder wand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Because it answers to another.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: When he killed Snape, he thought the wand would become his. But the thing is... it never belonged to Snape.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It was Draco who disarmed

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: But that means...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: It answers to me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: What do you reckon we should do with it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: We?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: I’m just saying. That’s the Elder Wand! It’s the most powerful bloody wand in the world! With that, we could, we could --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Well, it wasn’t boring, was it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Together? Albus nods and, side by side, they run the trolley at the barrier and...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Don’t forget to give Professor Longbottom our best. ALBUS looks at the train, then back to HARRY. Then he disappears... HARRY and GINNY share a knowing look, and then as GINNY takes charge of the trolley, HARRY returns to ALBUS, who is now kneeling down, struggling with his shoelace. HARRY leans down and joins him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Dialogue: Will there really be thestrals pulling the carriages?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

Dialogue: Would you like me to fix it? Personally I think you look a bit more devil-may-care this way. But it’s up to you.
