Dialogue: Have you ever fixed one? A nose. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No. But I’ve done several toes and how different are they really? This does not fill Harry with confidence. Nevertheless...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What the hell. Give it a go. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Episkey.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well? How do I look?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Exceptionally ordinary.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Brilliant.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Don’ you worry. He’ll be ‘long soon ‘nuff --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (whacking him) Will. You. Stop. Eating! Your best friend is missing!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oi! Turn around, you lunatic.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: He’s covered in blood again. Why is it he’s always covered in blood?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Looks like his own this time.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (as he arrives) Where’ve you been, Harry? And what happened to your face?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Later. What’ve I missed? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (shrugging; still eating) Sorting Hat urged us all to be brave and strong in these troubled times -- easy for it to say -- it’s a hat, isn’t it? First Years seemed to enjoy it, though. Wankers. Filch give you the wand outside?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Thanks... Just then, the light in the Hall begins to gently dim and all eyes turn to Dumbledore, standing at the top of the Hall, ashen hand raised to the enchanted ceiling, where clouds respond to his gestures and shroud a gleaming full moon.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What’s happened to his hand?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: The very best of evenings to you! First off, please join me in welcoming the newest member of our staff, Horace Slughorn. MILD APPLAUSE ensues. Harry claps perfunctorily, his eyes drifting to the entrance of the Hall as a pair of Aurors station themselves just outside.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Professor Slughorn, I’m happy to say, has agreed to resume his old post of Potions master. Meanwhile the post of Defense Against the Dark Arts will be assumed by Professor Snape. This is greeted by stunned silence. Dumbledore frowns, then attempts to generate something by CLAPPING his hands once. A few Slytherins join in and some dim-witted First Years.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Now, as you know, each and every one of you was searched upon your arrival tonight. You have a right to know why. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (a beat) Once there was a young man who, like you, sat in this very Hall. Walked this castle’s corridors. Slept beneath its roof. He seemed, to all the world, a student like any other. His name? Tom Riddle. The Hall goes utterly silent.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Today, of course, the world knows him by another name. Which is why, as I stand looking out upon you all tonight, I am reminded of a sobering fact. Each day, every hour, this very minute perhaps, dark forces attempt to penetrate this castle. But in the end, their greatest weapon remains... you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Just something to keep in mind. Now, off to bed. Pip pip!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (as they rise) That was cheerful.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: This can’t be good.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well, you see, I’ve got an open period this morning, Professor -- PROFESSOR McGONAGALL So I noticed. I would think you’d want to fill it with Potions. Or is it no longer your ambition to become an Auror?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It is. Or was. But I was told I had to get an Outstanding in my

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: PROFESSOR McGONAGALL And so you did when Professor

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Really? Well... brilliant. I’ll head there straight away. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Good. And take Weasley with you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: But I don’t want to take Potions!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Nonsense, we’ll sort you out. Any friend of Harry’s is a friend of mine. Right then, books out --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Um, sorry, sir, but I haven’t got my book yet -- nor’s Ron. You see -- (until this morning...) *

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Not to worry. You can get what you need from the cupboard. As Harry and Ron step to the cupboard, Slughorn resumes, gesturing to the cauldrons bubbling before him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Now, as I was saying, I’ve prepared a few concoctions this morning. Any ideas what these might be? Yes, Miss...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Granger, sir. That one there is Veritaserum. And that would be Polyjuice Potion. And that... In the cupboard, Harry and Ron find two TEXTBOOKS -- one new, one shabby and soiled. Both snatch for the new when a box -- marked “BEZOARS” -- tips. As Harry makes a grab for it, Ron wrests free the new textbook and goes off grinning.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: ... is Amortentia! The most powerful love potion in the world. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s rumored to smell differently to each person, according to what attracts them. For example, I smell freshly mown grass and new parchment and spearmint toothpaste --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: One of my best friends is Muggle- born. She’s the best in our year... Harry, settling into his seat with the soiled textbook, looks up just as Slughorn’s eyes shift to him for confirmation. As Harry nods, Hermione glances curiously at him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Now Amortentia doesn’t create actual love, of course. That’s impossible. But it does cause a powerful infatuation or obsession. For that reason, it is probably the most dangerous potion in this room.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sir, you haven’t told us what’s in that one.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ah yes...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What you see before you, ladies and gentlemen, is a curious little potion known as Felix Felicis. But it is more commonly referred to as --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Liquid luck. A buzz runs through the class. Even Malfoy perks up. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes, Miss Granger. Desperately tricky to make. Disastrous should you get it wrong. But brewed correctly, as this has been, it has remarkable powers. One sip and you will find that all your endeavors succeed... at least until the effects wear off.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: But then why don’t people drink it all the time?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Because taken in excess it causes giddiness, recklessness and dangerous overconfidence.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Have you ever taken it, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Twice. Once when I was twenty- four. Once when I was fifty- seven. Two tablespoons taken at breakfast. Two perfect days...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: So. This is what I offer each of you today. One tiny vial of liquid luck... to the student who, in the hour that remains, manages to brew an acceptable Draught of Living Death, the recipe for which can be found on page ten of your textbook. Excitement seizes the class. Slughorn smiles knowingly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You should know that in all the years of my previous tenure at Hogwarts, not once did a student brew a potion of sufficient quality to claim this prize. In any event -- good luck.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: How did you do that?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Crush it. Don’t cut it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No. The instructions specifically say to cut.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No. Really --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sh!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Students struggle. A cauldron overflows. Lavender eyes Ron.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Slughorn wends his way amongst the cauldrons, nodding with sympathy at the fiascos before him. Then... he stops, staring in disbelief at the pearly sheen of one bubbling potion.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Merlin’s Beard! But it’s perfect. So perfect I daresay one sip would kill us all! Your mother was a dab hand at potions, but this... My, my, what can’t you do, m’boy? Perhaps you will save us all in the end... All eyes turn to Harry. His smile falters.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Here you are then, as promised. One bottle of Felix Felicis. Use it well. Slowly, Harry reaches out... takes the glittering vial.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Good evening, Harry. You got my message, I see. Come, come. Sit.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: So. How are you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Fine, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Enjoying your classes? Professor Slughorn, for one, is most impressed with you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I think he overestimates my abilities, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Do you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Definitely.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: And what of your activities outside the classroom? Do they bring you satisfaction?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I notice you spend a great deal of time with Miss Granger. One can’t help but wonder if --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No! I mean... she’s brilliant. And we’re friends. But... no.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Forgive me, Harry, I... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: ... I was merely curious. (rising) In any event, I’m sure you’re wondering why I’ve summoned you here tonight. The answer lies here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What you see before you are memories. In this case pertaining to one individual: Voldemort. Or as he was known then... Tom Riddle.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: This vial contains a most particular memory -- of the day I first met him. I’d like you to see it. If you would...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I must confess to a bit of confusion upon receiving your letter, Mr. Dumbledore. In all the years Tom’s been here, he’s never once had a family visitor. Frankly, I was stunned to find that someone knew of his existence.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I am not family. But his name has been known to me since birth.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I see... But she doesn’t really. She stops, frowns.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I think I should tell you. He’s a funny boy -- Tom. Odd. There have been incidents with the other children. Nasty things.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Perhaps you could give me an example. Mrs. Cole starts to speak, then shakes her head, moves off. As Dumbledore makes to follow, his eyes happen upon a FRAMED PHOTOGRAPH on the wall, old and yellowing, depicting a SEASIDE SCENE of a SHARP ROCK OUTCROPPING and a CAVE. As he exits, we HOLD ON it. NEW ANGLE - CORRIDOR OUTSIDE TOM RIDDLE’S ROOM Mrs. Cole’s hand appears. KNOCKS. She turns the KNOB.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You’ve got a visitor, Tom. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: How do you do, Tom. Riddle eyes Dumbledore briefly, looks away.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well, I’ll leave you two to yourselves.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Moving on, Dumbledore passes a TALL CABINET, tracing his FINGERS over its surface, as if the wood’s grain were Braille, as if somehow “seeing” what lies within. Then Dumbledore pauses. Strewn on a small table are a grouping of SEVEN DARK DRAWINGS. A BOY and GIRL, their faces anguished. A sea-swept CAVE. The same cave from the photograph. Dumbledore begins to reach out...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Don’t.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: As you wish. Riddle looks away and Dumbledore, for the first time, notices his hands. They are splayed, utterly still, and INTERLACED with a SILKY WEB, where a SPIDER knits back and forth.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You’re the doctor, aren’t you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No. I am a Professor.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I don’t believe you. I hear Mrs. Cole talking, her and the rest of the staff. They want me looked at. They think I’m different.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Perhaps they’re right. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’m not mad.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hogwarts is not a place for mad people. Riddle looks up, cocks his head ever-so-slightly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s a school. A school of... magic. Riddle stays looking, but says nothing.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You can do things, can’t you, Tom? Things the other children can’t. Riddle eyes Dumbledore intensely, unblinking.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Tell me some of the things you can do, Tom.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (watching the spider) I can make things move -- without touching them. I can make animals do what I want without training them. I can make bad things happen to people who are mean to me. I can make them hurt... if I want.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Who are you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’m like you, Tom. Different. Riddle closes his hands and the web collapses.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Prove it. It is not a request. Without breaking his gaze, Dumbledore’s eyes narrow ever-so-slightly and... the WARDROBE BURSTS INTO FLAMES. Riddle wheels. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I think there is something trying to get out of your wardrobe, Tom. Open it. Open. It. Terrified, Riddle steps to the burning wardrobe and throws open the door. On the topmost shelf, above a rail of threadbare clothes, a SMALL BOX SHAKES VIOLENTLY.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Take it out. As Riddle’s fingers touch the box, the flames engulfing the wardrobe vanish, but the box continues to SHAKE -- the only sound in the now-silent room.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Is there anything in that box you ought not to have? Riddle eyes Dumbledore, a trifle fearfully this time. He spills the box onto the bed: a YO-YO, a silver THIMBLE, and a tarnished MOUTH ORGAN.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Why did you want these things, Tom?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (looking off) I like having things that belonged to other people. It makes me feel ... close to them.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Thievery is not tolerated at Hogwarts. At Hogwarts, you will be taught not only how to use magic, but to control it. Understood? (as Riddle nods) I’ll be going now, Tom. Leave your window open tonight. An owl will bring you a message. Read it carefully.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I can speak to snakes too.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It is unusual. But not unheard of.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Did you know, sir? Then?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Did I know that I had just met the most dangerous Dark Wizard of all time? No. Had I...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Over time, while here at Hogwarts, Tom Riddle grew close to one particular teacher. Can you guess which teacher that might be?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You didn’t bring Professor Slughorn back simply to teach Potions, did you, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No. I did not. You see, Professor Slughorn possesses something I desire very dearly. And he will not part with it easily... (eyeing Harry knowingly) I’d rather not divulge any more just yet, Harry. But I promise. In time you will know everything. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You said Professor Slughorn would try to collect me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I did.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Do you want me to let him?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: All right! Queue up! Excuse me...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: SHUT IT! Instant silence. Harry frowns, nods to Ginny nevertheless.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Thanks. All right. This morning I’ll be putting you all through a few drills to assess your strengths. But know this: Just because you made the team last year does not guarantee you a spot this year. Is that clear?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No hard feelings, Weasley, alright?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hard feelings? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’ll be going out for Keeper as well. Nothing personal.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Really? Strapping guy like you, you’ve got a Beater’s build, don’t you think? Keeper needs to be agile, quick -- Cormac nabs the FLY between two fingers, kills the BUZZ.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I like my chances. Say... think you could introduce me to your friend Granger? Wouldn’t mind getting on a first name basis, know what I mean?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: The survivors press ICE PACKS to their heads, run TAPE round twisted fingers. Only Ron, hovering at the west goal, and Cormac, hovering at the east, remain on the pitch. Luna, Spectrespecs in place, eyes Cormac -- cool, confident, clear. Then eyes Ron -- sweaty, nervous, SWARMING in WRACKSPURTS.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: All right. Cormac. Ron. It’s down to you two for Keeper. We’ll decide it with a shootout. Demelza, you’ll bring the Quaffle up against Cormac. Ginny, you’ll take on Ron.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hang on. She’s his sister. How do I know she won’t toss him a floater?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Piss off, Cormac. How ‘bout I toss you a floater?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Quiet! I’m Captain. We do it my way. Now line up. On three. One. Two... Three! Demelza and Ginny rocket forth. Ron weaves nervously while Cormac hovers in place, a confident sneer on his face. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (under his breath) C’mon, Ron... Demelza hunkers over her broom once again, flying like an arrow, then goes into a wide, sweeping slide. Ginny blasts over the pitch, ginger hair streaming like flames, then rolls recklessly to the side. As one, they both let fly... Hermione, face buried in her fingers, MUTTERS SOMETHING. Cormac, at the last moment, inexplicably rolls his broom to the right and the Quaffle sails over his shoulder. Ron, zig-zagging crazily, nearly falls off, rights himself in a panic, and deflects Ginny’s Quaffle... with his forehead. As a few partisan CHEERS erupt from the stands, Harry grins, then has to restrain himself.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Isn’t he brilliant?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Have to admit, thought I was going to miss that last one. Hope Cormac’s not taking it too hard. Behind her paper, Hermione rolls her eyes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Has a bit of a thing for you, Hermione. Cormac.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: He’s vile.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ever heard of this spell? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No I have not. And if you had a shred of self-respect you would turn that book in.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Not bloody likely. He’s top of the class. Even better than you, Hermione. Slughorn thinks he’s a genius.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’d like to know just whose book that was. Let’s take a look, shall we?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (holding it out of reach) No.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (suspicious) Why not?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s... old. The binding is fragile.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: The binding is fragile?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Who’s the Half-Blood Prince? HERMIONE/RON The who?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: That’s what it says. Right here. ‘This Book is the Property of the Half-Blood Prince.’ (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: For weeks you carry around this book, practically sleep with it... and you have no desire to find out who The Half-Blood Prince is?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I didn’t say I wasn’t curious. And, by the way, I don’t sleep with it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (a sarcastic chortle) Yeah. Right. (as Harry glares) Well, it’s true. I like a nice chat before I go to bed. Now you’re always reading that bloody book. It’s like being with Hermione. This time it’s Hermione’s turn to glare.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well, I was curious. So I went to -- HARRY/RON The library.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: And?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: And... nothing. There’s no reference to the Half-Blood Prince anywhere.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Good. That settles it then.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hey, you three! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What’ve you got there, Hagrid?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Stinksap. Burn the whiskers right off yer chin. Trees ‘ere are drippin’ with it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Stinksap? You’re not sick, are you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s not fer me. It’s fer Aragog. Yeh remember Aragog, don’ yeh?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Spider? About six feet tall? Ten feet wide?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Tha’s the one. He’s taken ill. I’m hopin’ ter nurse ‘im back. Keep yer fingers crossed.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Barking. Does he not remember that raving arachnid tried to eat us? What?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: The Aurors. I know they’re here to protect us, but... somehow I don’t feel any safer. Just then Harry spies Slughorn, heading down towards the Village, passing a weary Flitwick coming the other way. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Filius! I was hoping to find you at the Three Broomsticks.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Emergency choir practice, I’m afraid, Horace.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Who’s up for a Butterbeer?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No. Over here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No, no. Sit next to me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: O-kay. A SKINNY KID in an apron appears, tosses a FILTHY RAG upon the table -- which begins to wipe the surface on its own. Harry cranes his neck around the kid to keep Slughorn in view.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What’ll we have?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Three Butterbeers. Splash of ginger in mine, please. The kid WHISTLES and the rag leaps back into his pocket.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Aw, bloody hell...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oh, honestly, Ronald. They’re just holding hands... (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (as Dean kisses Ginny) And snogging.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’d like to leave.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Leave? You can’t be serious.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: That happens to be my sister.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: So? What if she looked over here and saw you snogging me? Would you expect her to get up and leave?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Harry, m’boy!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hello, sir. Wonderful to see you. Hermione, brow wrinkling, turns to Ron, silently mouths: wonderful to see you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: So what brings you here, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oh, the Three Broomsticks and I go way back. Longer than I’d care to admit. In fact, I remember when it was simply One Broomstick! As Slughorn GUFFAWS, Harry joins in, LAUGHING HEARTILY as well. Slughorn’s belly trembles next to Hermione’s cheek and his waving mug sloshes over, spattering the table.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oops! All hands on deck, Granger!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Listen, m’boy. In the old days, I used to throw together the occasional supper and invite a select student or two. Would you be game?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’d consider it an honor, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You’d be welcome too, Granger. Hermione, in the midst of emptying her Butterbeer in one long draw, SLAMS down her mug -- leaving behind a “mustache.”

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Be delighted, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Brilliant. Look for my owl. (exiting, to Ron) Good to see you, Wallenby.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What’re you playing at?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Get to know him?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Dunno. But it must be important. Otherwise Dumbledore wouldn’t ask. Slam! Ron turns, sees that Hermione has emptied his mug as well. Ron gestures to her upper lip.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Um... You’ve got a little... Without a thought, she flicks her tongue up, wipes it clean.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Bit worried about her. Did you hear that rubbish she was talking back in the pub? Her and me snogging. Ha. As if...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Katie. You don’t know what it could be! Up ahead, Katie Bell and Leanne stand in the drifting snow, ARGUING. Katie holds a SLENDER PACKAGE. Hermione comes bumping up, drapes her arms over the boys.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What’s up? At that very instant, Katie Bell RISES SIX FEET INTO THE AIR. Hair dancing violently in the wind, her face remains eerily placid. Then she... SCREAMS. Harry and

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I warned her! I warned her not to touch it!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Harry, she’s swallowing her tongue --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’ll get someone --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: There’s no time! Suddenly, a MASSIVE FIGURE LURCHES out of the WHITE: Hagrid.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Get back! All o’ yeh! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Now, now. Now, now... Over and over he repeats this, soothingly, the words like a mantra, until Katie’s lids flutter and her body goes limp.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Don’ go touchin’ tha’ but by the wrappin’s. Unnerstan’?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s like I said. She went to the loo and when she came back she had the package. She said it was important she deliver it. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Did she say to whom?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Believe me, Professor, I’ve been asking myself the same question for six years. Just then, Snape appears at the door, eyes the trio. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Severus.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Is this it? McGonagall nods. Snape takes his wand, lifts the necklace like a dead snake. Eyes it with fascination. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL What do you think?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I think Miss Bell is lucky to be alive.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It was Malfoy. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL That’s a very serious accusation, Potter.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Indeed. Your evidence?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I... just... know.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You... just... know. Once again you astonish with your gifts, Potter, gifts mere mortals could only dream of possessing. How grand it must be to be the Chosen One. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What do you suppose Dean sees in her? Ginny.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What does she see in him?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Dean? He’s brilliant.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You called him a slick git not five hours ago.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yeah, well, he was running his hands all over my sister, wasn’t he? Something snaps. You’ve got to hate him. You know, on principle.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (troubled by this) I suppose.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: So what is it? He sees in her?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I don’t know. She’s smart. Funny. Attractive...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Attractive?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You know. She’s... got nice skin.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Skin? You’re saying Dean’s dating my sister because of her skin? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well, no. I mean... I’m just saying it could be a contributing factor. Silence. Then:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hermione’s got nice skin. Wouldn’t you say? As skin goes, I mean.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’ve never really thought about it. But I suppose, yeah. Very nice. Another silence. Suddenly it feels weird.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I think I’ll be going to sleep now.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Right.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: A toast!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: To Hogwarts’ best and brightest!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Here, here!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Which one do I use for the soup? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: So tell me, Cormac. See much of your Uncle Tiberius these days?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes, sir. In fact, I’m meant to go hunting with him and the Minister for Magic over holiday.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well, be sure to give them both my best. What about your uncle, Belby? Working on anything new? (to the others) For those of you who don’t know, Marcus’ uncle invented the Wolfsbane Potion. As he speaks, Belby never once looks up from his plate.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Dunno. He and me dad don’t get on. Probably because Dad thinks potions are rubbish. Says the only potion worth having is a stiff one at the end of the -- (day.) *

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: And you, Miss Granger? What is it your family does in the Muggle world?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: My parents are dentists. They tend to people’s teeth.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Fascinating. And is that considered a dangerous profession?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No. Though, a boy named Robbie Fenwick did bite my father once. Needed ten stitches. As Slughorn nods, the door GROANS. Everyone turns. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Miss Weasley! Come in, come in.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sorry, I’m not ordinarily late --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No matter. You’ll be just in time for dessert. That is -- if Belby leaves you any. As Ginny moves to her seat, Hermione WHISPERS to Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Look at her eyes. They’ve been fighting again. Her and Dean.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Nothing. As Hermione smiles, she lightly strokes the crystal hourglass with a finger and we --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Thank you, one and all, for a most stimulating evening. We’ll have to do it again.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oh. Potter.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sorry, sir, I was just admiring your hourglass.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ah, yes. A most intriguing object. The sands run in accordance to the quality of the conversation. When it is stimulating, the sands run slow. When it is not... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I think I’ll be going.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Nonsense. You have nothing to fear, m’boy. As for some of your classmates, well, let’s just say, they’re unlikely to make the shelf.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: The shelf, sir? Slughorn gestures to the PHOTOGRAPHS seen earlier, now ranged like a menagerie atop a low bookcase. Once again, Lily Potter and Regulus Black up front.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Anyone who aspires to be anyone hopes to end up here. Then * again... you are already someone aren’t you, Harry?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I don’t really know how to answer that, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Your mother was modest too. Your father not so much. As you can see, he did not make the shelf.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Did Voldemort ever make the shelf, sir? Slughorn stiffens, his back to Harry. His hand trembles and the ice slips from the tongs. Harry notices.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You knew him, didn’t you, sir? Tom Riddle. You were his teacher.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Mr. Riddle had many teachers while here at Hogwarts.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What was he like? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’m sorry, sir. Forgive me. He killed my parents, you see...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Of course. It’s only natural that you should want to know more. I’m afraid I must disappoint you, Harry. When I first met young Mr. Riddle, he was simply a quiet, albeit brilliant, boy committed to becoming a first-rate wizard. Not unlike the others I’ve known. In fact, not unlike... you. If the monster existed, it was buried deep within.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Nary a grain trickles through.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Good luck, eh, Ron?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Counting on you, Ron. I’ve two Galleons on Gryffindor. As Seamus peels off, Ron cuts his eyes toward the Slytherin table, where the Quidditch team sits together. One Slytherin juts his chin toward Ron, MUTTERS something. A few turn, snigger. Ron averts his eyes and... almost runs into Cormac, who eyes him with disdain as he passes. Frowning, Ron drops down opposite Harry and Hermione. Harry eyes him briefly, knowingly, pushes a plate across. Ron takes a fork, pokes at it glumly. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: So. How was it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: How was what?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (with mock refinement) Your dinner party.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Dead boring. Though I think Harry enjoyed dessert. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ol’ Sluggy’s having a Christmas do, you know. And we’re meant to bring someone...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I expect you’ll be going with McLaggen. Isn’t he a member of the Slug Club?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Actually, I was going to ask you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Really?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Really. But seeing as you have such a distaste for the idea --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (passing by) Good luck today, Ron! I know you’ll be brilliant!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’m resigning. After today’s match. McLaggen can have my spot. Hearing this, Hermione turns back. Harry catches her eye, extends a SHAKING HAND to indicate Ron’s mental state.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Have it your way. Juice?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sure... As Harry pours, Luna arrives at the table wearing a HAT that bears an uncanny resemblance to a real lion.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hello, everyone. You look dreadful, Ron. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Is that why you just put something in his cup. Is it a tonic? The tiny vial of Felix Felicis glints in Harry’s palm.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Don’t drink that, Ron! But Ron’s frozen in mid-sip, looking at Harry’s palm too. Quickly, he gulps down the rest.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You could be expelled for that.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Dunno what you’re talking about.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: C’mon, Harry. We’ve got a game to win.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: As it ROCKETS into the AIR...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What’s gotten into him?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ginny! Let’s go! Instantly, she rolls backward, jets off and races down her fellow Chasers. Flying in spread formation, Dean -- on the far wing -- starts the Quaffle “up the line” until it lands in Ginny’s hand. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Weasley! Weasley! Weasley!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yep. Apparently it’s his lucky day.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You shouldn’t have done it, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yeah. I suppose I could’ve just used, I dunno... a Confundus charm?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (caught) That was different. It was tryouts. This was an actual match --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You didn’t put it in? (as he shakes his head)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Charms spell. Just practicing.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ah. Well... they’re really good.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (studying her wand) How does it feel, Harry? When you see Dean with Ginny? (off his look) I know, Harry. You’re my best friend. I see how you look at her. Just then the DOOR BURSTS WIDE and Ron rushes in, pulling a GIGGLING Lavender by the hand. They stop. Take inventory.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oops. I think this room’s taken. As Lavender pulls Ron out, he cuts his VOICE LOW to Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What’s with the birds? Before Harry can reply, Hermione rises, points her wand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oppugno! Instantly the birds race like angry red bullets toward Ron, who flees, SLAMMING SHUT the door. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It feels like this.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Look, I can’t help it if she’s got her knickers in a twist. What Lav and I have -- well, let’s just say there was no stopping it. It’s chemical. Will it last? Who knows? Point is, I’m a free agent.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: He’s at perfect liberty to kiss whomever he likes. I really couldn’t care less. Was I under the impression that he and I would be attending Slughorn’s Christmas party together? Yes. Of course, now, given the circumstances, I’ve had to make other arrangements. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Have you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes. Why?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I just thought, you know, since neither one of us can take who we’d really like... maybe we’d go together. As friends.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (stopping) Why didn’t I think of that?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: So who are you taking?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (evasively) Um... it’s a surprise. Besides, it’s you we need to worry about. And you can’t pick just anyone. See that girl over there. That’s Romilda Vane. Rumor has it she’s trying to slip you a love potion.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Really...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (snapping fingers) Hey! She’s only interested in you because she thinks you’re the Chosen One. You know that, right?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: But I am the Chosen One.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Okay. Kidding. I’ll just ask someone I like. Someone cool.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’ve never been to this part of the castle. At least not while awake. I sleepwalk, you see. It’s why I wear shoes to bed. As Harry and Luna pass out of sight, we PICK UP Malfoy, standing in the shadows of an alcove. He watches them go, then moves off.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: In the f.g., the BIRDCAGE glimmers dully in the gray moonlight streaming through a window. Within, the TWO BIRDS huddle quietly. We RACK FOCUS and see, THROUGH the grid of wire, a FIGURE APPROACHING.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Thank you, Adrian! (quietly to Harry) One of mine. Class of ‘78. I had hoped for more out of him, but at least the pictures are in focus. (suddenly) Oh my! Excuse me, Harry. I must greet the new Minister of Magical Transportation. Class of ‘67. (as he goes) Mingle, m’boy! Mingle! We’re all friends here. And we run the world.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Drink?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Neville...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I didn’t make the cut for the Slug Club. It’s okay. He’s got Belby handing out towels in the loo. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Lovegood, did you say? I once encountered a seriously unbalanced man by that name at a book signing. Claimed to run a magazine... NEW ANGLE - HERMIONE - BEHIND THE HANGING - SECONDS LATER

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What’re you doing?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: And what’s happened to you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hm? Oh, I’ve just escaped -- I mean, left Cormac. Under the mistletoe.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Cormac! That’s who you invited!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I thought it would annoy Ron most. But he’s a menace. He’s got more tentacles than a Snarfalump plant.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Dragon tartar?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No thank you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Just as well. They give one horribly bad breath.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (grabbing the tray) On second thought -- maybe it’ll keep Cormac at bay. Oh no, here he comes! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I think she went to powder her nose.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Slippery little minx, your friend. Likes to work her mouth too, doesn’t she? Yak yak yak. What is this I’m eating, by the way?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Dragon balls. As Cormac’s face freezes, Harry starts to head toward Slughorn when the HANGING IS SWEAP ASIDE: Snape.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What’s going on back here? Cormac SPEWS raw dragon all over Snape’s shoes. Snape surveys the damage, then his eyes rise darkly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You’ve just bought yourself a month’s detention, McLaggen. McLaggen dashes off. Harry makes to follow.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Not so quick, Potter.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I think I should rejoin the party, sir. My date...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: ... can surely survive your absence for another minute or two. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Besides, I only wish to convey a message.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: A message...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: From Professor Dumbledore. He asked that I give you his best and that he hopes you enjoy your holiday. You see, he’s traveling and won’t return until term resumes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Traveling? Where?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Take your hands off me, you filthy squib! A frown overtakes Slughorn’s face and he turns toward the source of the commotion, exits Harry’s view. Harry emerges from the hanging, finds Malfoy in Filch’s rough grip.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Professor Slughorn, sir! I’ve just discovered this boy lurking in an upstairs corridor. He claims to have been invited to your party.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Okay, okay, I was gate-crashing. Happy?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’ll escort him out. Draco’s eyes shift, regard Snape. He shrugs free of Filch.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Certainly... Professor.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Maybe I did hex that Bell girl. Maybe I didn’t. What’s it to you? Two SILHOUETTES come INTO VIEW -- Malfoy, slumped against the wall in lazy insolence, and Snape.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I swore to protect you. I made the Unbreakable Vow --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I don’t need protection. I was chosen for this! Out of all others. Me! And I won’t fail him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You’re afraid, Draco. You attempt to conceal it, but it’s obvious. Let me assist you --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No! I was chosen. This is my moment!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Unbreakable Vow. You’re sure that’s what Snape said.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Positive. Why?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s just, well, you can’t break an Unbreakable Vow. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’d worked that much out for myself, funnily enough.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No, you don’t understand -- Oh, bloody hell... Lavender stands outside the compartment door. Fogging the glass with her breath, she ETCHES “Ron + Lav,” encircles it with a HEART, mimes “I miss you,” and exits with a pout.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Lovely.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: All she wants to do is snog me. My lips are getting chapped. Look.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’ll take your word for it. Just then, Hermione passes by, breaks stride as she spots Lavender’s handiwork, then continues on. Ron shakes his head.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: So what happens? If you break an Unbreakable Vow?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You die.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Eat up, eat up, everyone! There’s more to come!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Draco’s plotting something, I know it, something to do with Voldemort. He’s been given a task or a mission -- and Snape was offering to help.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I know it sounds mad --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Has it occurred to you, Harry, that Snape was simply pretending to offer Draco help so that he could find out what he’s up to?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: That’s not what it sounded like.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Perhaps Harry’s right, Remus. To make an Unbreakable Vow, after all --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It comes down to whether or not you trust Dumbledore’s judgement.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: But Dumbledore can make mistakes. He’s said it himself --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You’re blinded by hatred.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’m not --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (sharply) You are! People are disappearing, Harry. Daily. We can only put our trust in a handful of people. If we start fighting amongst ourselves, we’re doomed. Tonks gives Harry a furtive glance, as if to say, “Leave it.” (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Open up, you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Don’t trust me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s good. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: ‘Course ‘tis. Made them myself.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You’ll have to forgive Remus. It takes its toll -- his condition.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (studying him) Are you alright, Mr. Weasley?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: We’re being followed, all of us.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (a nod, then) Did you get my owl?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes, but I thought it best if I replied in person. If Dumbledore’s traveling, it’s news to the Ministry. But perhaps that’s the way Dumbledore wants it. As for Draco Malfoy -- I know a bit more.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Go on. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I sent an agent to Borgin & Burkes. From what you describe, I think what you and Ron saw at the end of the summer -- the object that Draco seemed so interested in -- was a Vanishing Cabinet.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: A Vanishing Cabinet?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What happened to it? The one at Borgin & Burkes?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Nothing. It’s still there.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Harry. You know, I went through all this before -- the last time around. Times like these -- dark times -- do funny things to people. It can bring them together and it can tear them apart. Things... speed up. It’s what happens when you don’t know if today will be your last.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It was delicious, Molly. Really.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You’re sure you won’t stay?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No, we should go. (under her breath) The first night of the cycle is always the worst --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: ... as the HAIRS on the knuckles RISE.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Remus...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Everyone gone to bed?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Soon.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I don’t sleep these days. So I wash my hair. Silly, right?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Happy Christmas, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sweetheart...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: There’s someone out there. I can smell him. There’s more than one -- Suddenly -- throughout the reeds -- TORCHES BLAZE.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oh my god...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Harry, no! Flames race up the porch steps, climb the walls of the house. Lupin draws his wand and races after Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Remus! Ron, Fred and George appear, join Arthur as he dashes toward the smoking marsh. Arthur glances back as Ginny emerges.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ginny, stay with your mother! Without hesitation, she races for the reeds.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Fred, George, Ron and Arthur fan out, running full-out, their feet kicking up SPARKS as SHADOWS splinter throughout the reeds. It’s like chasing ghosts.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ginny, copper hair gleaming, races through the reeds.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No, Harry! It’s a trap!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Don’t you smell clean. Just then, a BOLT OF BLUE bursts off Greyback’s back and he turns, sees Harry standing several yards off. As

Dialogue: You’re lucky you weren’t killed.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You have to realize who you are, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (sharply) I know who I am, Hermione, alright? (frowning) Sorry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: So tell me what Arthur said.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: If Dumbledore’s traveling places, it’s news to the Ministry. But get this: that night at Borgin & Burkes? It seems Draco was looking at a Vanishing Cabinet.

Dialogue: What would Draco want with a Vanishing Cabinet?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You tell me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Who could tell the difference? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Lav, c’mon. Of course I’ll wear it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: That’s my Won-Won.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Excuse me, I have to go vomit. As Hermione exits, Harry spies Ginny, in an alcove, sitting by as Dean laughs with SEAMUS. Looking up, she sees Harry, gives a feeble wave. He waves back and we --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sir, is it true that Professor Merrythought is retiring? Slughorn chuckles, wags a sugar-encrusted finger at Riddle.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Now, Tom, I couldn’t tell you if I knew, could I? I must say, m’boy, I’d like to know where you get your information. More knowledgeable than half the staff, you are. (as the other boys laugh) By the way, thank you for the pineapple -- you’re quite right, it is my favorite -- how is it you knew? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Intuition. Riddle smiles but his expression suggests intuition had nothing to do with it. Slughorn chuckles uneasily.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Good gracious, look at the time. Off you go, boys, or Professor Dippett will have us all in detention. Lestrange, Avery, don’t forget your essays... As the others file out, Slughorn busies himself with some papers when -- Ping! -- he turns, finds Riddle still there, standing by the crystal hourglass.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Look sharp, Tom. You don’t want to be caught out of bed after hours...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I know a secret shortcut or two.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes, I imagine you do. Something on your mind, Tom?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes, sir. I couldn’t think of anyone else to go to. The other professors, well, they’re not like you. They might... misunderstand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Go on. Riddle slips off the RING on his left hand, begins to roll it between his fingers. It is set with a BLACK

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I was in the library the other night, in the Restricted section, and I read something rather odd, about a bit of rare magic, and I thought perhaps you could illuminate me... Suddenly, a DENSE FOG engulfs the room and SLUGHORN’S VOICE twists into an ANGRY SHRIEK: (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I don’t know anything about such things and I wouldn’t tell you if I did! Now get out of here at once and don’t ever let me catch you mentioning it again! The FOG grows thicker and...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Confused? I would be surprised if you weren’t.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I don’t understand -- what happened?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: This is perhaps the most important memory I’ve collected. It’s also a lie. (off Harry’s look) This memory has been tampered with. In this case by the person whose memory it is, our friend Professor Slughorn.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: But why would he tamper with his own memory?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I suspect he is ashamed of it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Why?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Why indeed.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I asked you to get to know Professor Slughorn and you’ve done so. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Now I want you to persuade him to divulge his true memory. Any way you can.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I don’t know him that well, sir --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You’re the Chosen One, Harry. And Horace is, at heart, a decent man. Provide the proper circumstances and he will confess his sins.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: This memory is everything, Harry. Without it, we are blind. Without it, we leave the fate of our world to chance. You have no choice. You must not fail. As Harry watches, the damp sheen enveloping Dumbledore’s hand evaporates and once again his fingers decay.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Now don’t forget to look over the chapter on antidotes. I’ll be poisoning one of you next time we meet. I’m joking! Off you go! Don’t forget your rattails, Miss Alys. As the tiny ones scurry out, Harry is revealed, waiting just outside the door. He enters. For a moment,

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ah! If it isn’t the Prince of Potions himself! To what do I owe the pleasure?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well, sir, I wondered if I might ask you something.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ask away, my dear boy, ask away! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well, you see, the other day I was in the Restricted Section -- in the library -- and I stumbled upon something rather odd while reading. Something about a bit of rare magic...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes? And exactly what was this rare magic.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’m not sure... That is, I don’t recall the name... exactly. But it got me wondering... Are there some kinds of magic you’re not allowed to teach? Slughorn looks up, eyes Harry carefully.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’m a Potions Professor, Harry. Perhaps your question would best be posed to Professor Snape.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes, well, we don’t exactly see eye-to-eye, sir. What I mean to say is, he’s not like you. He might... misunderstand. Recognition flickers in Slughorn’s eyes. A glint of fear.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: There can be no light without the dark. And so it is with magic. Myself, I have always strived to live within the light. I suggest you do the same.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Did you say the same to Tom Riddle, sir? When he came asking questions. Slughorn freezes in the doorway, then slowly turns.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sir -- Slughorn silences him with an upraised hand. Then, without another word, he is gone.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Did you actually expect you could just walk up to Ol’ Sluggy and ask him to reveal his deepest, darkest secret? Honestly, Harry, sometimes I think the Daily Prophet should call you the Dim One.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Nice.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (rising to go) You’re going to have to persuade him somehow. And now, I’m afraid, you’ve made it a lot harder.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hermione. I think Malfoy’s leaving the castle.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’ve seen it. Sometimes... sometimes he just disappears off the Map.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: That’s... not possible. No one can leave the castle these days. The Map is wrong.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: The Map is never wrong.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s beautiful, isn’t it? The moon.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Divine. Had ourselves a little late-night snack, did we?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It was on your bed. The box. Thought I’d try one...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Or twenty.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I can’t stop thinking about her, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Really? Honestly, I reckoned she was starting to annoy you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well... Brilliant.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Do you think she knows I exist?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Bloody well hope so. She’s been snogging you for three months.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Snogging? Who’re you talking about?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Who’re you talking about? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Romilda, of course. Romilda Vane.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Okay. Very funny.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What the hell was that for?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s no joke! I’m in love with her!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Okay! Fine! You’re in love with her! Have you ever actually met her!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No. Can you introduce me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ron, these chocolates, they’re -- C’mon. I’m going to introduce you to Romilda Vane.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: How do I look?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Devastatingly handsome.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Damn it all! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What’s the matter with Wenby?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ah. Very well. Bring him in.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’d have thought you could whip up a remedy for this in no time,

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I figured this called for a more practiced hand, sir. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hello, darling. Fancy a drink? Slughorn and Harry turn, watch Ron WINK into the mirror.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hm. Perhaps you’re right. As Slughorn goes back to mixing, Harry eyes him furtively.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’m sorry, sir. About the other day. Our... misunderstanding. Slughorn eyes Harry briefly, looks away.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes, well, water under the bridge as they say, correct?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I mean, I’m sure you’re tired of it, after all these years. The questions. About... Voldemort. Slughorn’s mixing hand falters instantly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’ll ask you not to use that name.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes, sir. It’s just, well,

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: With all due respect, Dumbledore sometimes forgets that most of us do not possess powers so great that we can risk offending the most dangerous Dark Lord who ever lived.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Alright, m’boy! Bottoms up! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What’s this? (CONTINUED)

Dialogue: A tonic for the nerves.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What happened to me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Love potion.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: And a bloody strong one at that.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I feel really... bad.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Pick-me-up’s what you need, m’boy. (eying Harry again) Do us all good, I think. I’ve got butterbeer, wine -- ah -- and a dazzling oak-matured mead. I had other intentions for this but given the circumstances...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: There we are, Potter. To life! CRASH! -- Ron’s glass hits the floor and he crumples to his knees, then tumbles full out on the rug, SPASMING horribly, FOAM oozing over his lips. Harry rushes to him.

Dialogue: Ron! Ron!!! Professor, help him!

Dialogue: I d-don’t understand --

Dialogue: Breathe! C’mon, Ron, don’t be a prat. Breathe! BREATHE!

Dialogue: These girls are gonna kill me, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Quick thinking on your part, Harry. Using a Bezoar. You must be very proud of your student, eh, Horace?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hm? Oh. Yes... very proud. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL I think we all agree that Mr. Potter’s actions were heroic. The question is: Why were they necessary.

Dialogue: Why indeed.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: This appears to be a gift, Horace. You don’t by chance remember who gave you this bottle, do you -- which by the way possesses remarkably subtle hints of licorice and cherry when not polluted with poison.

Dialogue: Actually I had intended to give it as a gift myself.

Dialogue: To whom might I ask?

Dialogue: Where is he? Where’s my Won-Won! Has he been asking for me? (stopping; glaring daggers) What’s she doing here?

Dialogue: I might ask you the same.

Dialogue: I happen to be his girlfriend.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I happen to be his... friend.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Don’t make me laugh. You haven’t spoken in weeks. I suppose you want to make up with him now that he’s suddenly all interesting.

Dialogue: He’s been poisoned, you daft dimbo! And for the record, I’ve always found him interesting.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ha! See? He senses my presence. I’m here, Won-Won. I’m here -- (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Er... My... Nee... Er! My! Nee!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ah, to be young and feel love’s keen sting. Come, everyone, I think Mr. Weasley is well tended. As Dumbledore leads the others past Harry, Harry studies him. Ginny passes, face very close, WHISPERING as she indicates Ron and Hermione.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: ‘Bout time, don’t you think?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’ve always cherished my students. They’re my life... Then he is gone too. Harry turns back, studies Hermione, hand enfolded over Ron’s. She looks up, sees his faint smile.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oh shut up.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ron. Stop. You’re making it snow.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Huh?
