Dialogue: Tell me again how I broke up with Lavender?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Um, well, she came to visit you in the hospital, you see, and you talked -- I don’t believe it was a long conversation --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Don’t get me wrong. I’m bloody thrilled to be shot of her. It’s just she seems... a bit put out. As one, the three glance over at Lavender and are rewarded with a lethal squint.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Does, doesn’t she? And you say you don’t remember a thing from that night? Not one thing?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well... there is... something. (as Hermione hangs) But no. It can’t be. Besides, I was completely boggled, wasn’t I?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Right. Boggled...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: That’s Katie. That’s Katie Bell. Katie Bell, pale but smiling, greets the other girls. After a moment, she looks up. Finds Harry standing before her.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: How are you, Katie?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Give me a moment, girls. The girls drift off. Harry watches them go, curious, then: (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I know you’re going to ask, Harry. But I don’t know who cursed me. I’ve tried to remember. Honestly. But I just... can’t... Katie’s eyes shift. She goes ashen. Harry turns, follows her gaze and finds... Malfoy, staring at her. Katie backs away, retreating to the other girls. Harry watches her go, then looks back. Catches Malfoy fleeing the Hall.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Cruci--

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: SECTUMSEMPRA! BLOOD SPURTS from Malfoy’s face and SCARLET SLASHES OOZE through the white of his shirt. He staggers, HOWLS again and COLLAPSES. Harry glares at his wand in horror, then slushes across the floor, the water running red with Malfoy’s blood. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Don’t touch me! Don’t you dare touch me!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You have to get rid of it. Today.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Take my hand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: The Room of Requirement...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Over the years, if someone had a secret, if they wanted to conceal something, this is where they came. Some of these things are almost as old as the castle itself.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Who showed you this? First.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: See, you never know what you’ll find up here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: All right. Close your eyes. That way you can’t be tempted.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: There’s something else. Another secret of sorts. One of mine... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: That can stay hidden up here too, if you like.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: So. Did you and Ginny do it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You know. Hide the book.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oh. Yeah. Just then, Slughorn rounds the far end of the corridor and -- spying Harry -- does a little Oliver Hardy “Oops” and retreats.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Still no luck with Slughorn, I take it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Say that again.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well? How do you feel? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Excellent. Really excellent.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Now remember. Slughorn usually eats early, takes a short walk and then returns to his office.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Right. I’m going down to Hagrid’s.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What? No, Harry -- you’ve got to go see Slughorn. We have a plan --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No. I’ve got a good feeling about going to Hagrid’s. I feel like it’s the place to be tonight, know what I mean? HERMIONE/RON No.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Trust me. I know what I’m doing. Or at least Felix does.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Merlin’s beard, Harry!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sorry, sir. I should’ve announced myself. Cleared my throat. Coughed. You probably feared I was Madam Sprout.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well, yes, actually -- (paranoid) Why would you think that?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Just the general behavior, sir. The sneaking around. The jumping when you saw me. By the way, those Tentacula leaves -- they’re quite valuable, aren’t they?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ten galleons a leaf to the right buyer -- not that I’m familiar with such back alley transactions. One hears rumors is all. My own interests are purely academic, of course.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Personally, these plants have always kind of freaked me out.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Exactly how did you get out of the castle, Harry?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Through the front doors, sir. I’m off to Hagrid’s, you see. He’s a very dear friend and I felt like paying him a visit. So if you don’t mind, I’ll be going. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Harry!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s nearly nightfall. Surely you realize I can’t allow you to roam the grounds all by yourself.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well, then by all means come along, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Harry, I must insist you accompany me back to the castle immediately!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: That would be counterproductive, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: And what makes you say that?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No idea. Slughorn frowns impatiently -- then stops, blinks.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Merlin’s beard... Up ahead, Hagrid sits disconsolately upon a stump. Nearby, Aragog’s massive body lies legs up.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Is that an actual Acromantula?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: A dead one, I think, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: ‘Arry. ‘Orace.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: My god, dear man. How did you ever manage to kill it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Kill ‘im! Me oldest friend, ‘e was!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’m sorry, I... (didn’t realize.) *

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ah, don’ worry yerself. Yer not alone. Seriously misunderstood creatures -- spiders. It’s the eyes, I reckon. Unnerve people.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Not to mention the pincers.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I reckon that too... How’d yeh get outta the castle anyways?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Through the front doors.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hagrid. I wouldn’t want to be indelicate, but Acromantula venom is uncommonly rare and, well, if you wouldn’t mind my extracting a vial or two -- purely for academic pursuits...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Don’ suppose it’s doin’ ‘im any good, izzit?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: My thoughts exactly! Always carry a few spare ampoules for just such occasions. Old Potion Master’s habit, you know... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Wish yeh coulda seen ‘im in ‘is prime. Magnificent ‘e was. Jus’ magnificent...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Why don’t I say a few words? I trust he had family?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oh yeah.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (clearing his throat) Farewell...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Aragog.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (a nod) Farewell, Aragog, king of arachnids. Though your body will decay, your spirit lingers on in the quiet, web-spun places of your Forest home. May your many-eyed descendents ever flourish and your human friends find solace for the loss they have sustained.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Tha’ was... tha’ was... beautiful.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I had ‘im from an egg, yeh know. Tiny little thing he was when he hatched. No bigger’n a Pekinese.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sweet. I once had a fish. Francis. Lovely little thing. One day I came downstairs and he’d vanished. Poof.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Tha’s odd.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Isn’t it? That’s life, I suppose. One goes along and then... poof.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Poof.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Poof.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: That’s never unicorn hair, Hagrid?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: But my dear chap, do you know how much that’s worth? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No idea... no idea at all... Thunk! Hagrid’s great shaggy head hits the table. Instantly, he is SNORING, so DEEPLY his MUG shimmies across the table. Slughorn smiles, regards Harry, who merely stares back. Slughorn averts his eyes. Suddenly nervous. A WIND rises outside. Windowpanes rattle.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It was a student who gave me Francis. One spring afternoon I discovered a bowl upon my desk with a few inches of clear water. There was a flower petal floating upon the surface. As I watched, the petal sank, but just before it touched bottom... it transformed. Into a wee fish. It was beautiful magic, wondrous to behold. The petal had come from a lily. Hearing “lily,” Harry looks up. Slughorn nods.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Your mother. The day I came downstairs, the day I found the bowl empty... was the day she...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I know what you want. But I can’t give it to you. It will ruin me...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Do you know why I survived? The night I got this. Slughorn looks up, sees Harry pointing to his scar.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Because of her. Because she sacrificed herself. Because she refused to step aside. Because her love was more powerful than Voldemort.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Please don’t say his -- (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’m not afraid of the name, Professor. And I’m not afraid of him. And you shouldn’t be either.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Professor. I’m going to tell you something, something others have only guessed at. It’s true. I am the Chosen One. Slughorn looks up. Harry nods.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Only I can kill him. But in order to do so, I need to know what Tom Riddle asked you that night in your office all those years ago. And I need to know what you told him. Slughorn’s eyes well with tears, his hands tremble.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Be brave, Professor. Be brave like my mother. Otherwise you disgrace her. Otherwise she died for nothing. Otherwise, the bowl remains empty forever. Slughorn shakes his head, staring into the candle. Finally, slowly, he removes his wand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Don’t think too badly of me once you’ve seen it. You don’t know what he was like... even then.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: How is he? Horace?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sir, is it true that Professor Merrythought is retiring? Slughorn chuckles, wags a sugar-encrusted finger at Riddle.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Now, Tom, I couldn’t tell you if I knew, could I? I must say, m’boy, I’d like to know where you get your information. More knowledgable than half the staff, you are. (as the other boys laugh) By the way, thank you for the pineapple -- you’re quite right, it is my favorite -- how is it you knew?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Intuition.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (an uneasy chuckle) Good gracious, is it that time already? Off you go, boys, or Professor Dippett will have us all in detention. Lestrange, Avery, don’t forget your essays... The others exit, when -- PING! -- Slughorn turns, eyes the hourglass, finds Tom Riddle still there. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Look sharp, Tom. You don’t want to be caught out of bed after hours...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I know a secret shortcut or two.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes, I imagine you do. Something on your mind, Tom?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes, sir. I couldn’t think of anyone else to go to. The other Professors, well, they’re not like you. They might... misunderstand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Go on.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I was in the library the other night, in the Restricted section, and I read something rather odd, about a bit of rare magic and I thought perhaps you could illuminate me. It’s called, as I understand it... a Horcrux. Slughorn’s weak smile evaporates altogether.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Horcrux. I came across the term while reading and I didn’t fully understand it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’m not sure what you were reading, Tom, but that’s very Dark stuff, very Dark indeed.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes, sir. Which is why I came to you. I mean no disrespect to the rest of the staff, but I thought if anyone could tell me... it would be you. Slughorn frowns, clearly disturbed, then speaks quietly. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: A Horcrux is an object in which a person has concealed part of their soul.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes, I thought it might be something like that. But I don’t understand how that works, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: One splits one’s soul and hides part of it in an object. By doing so, you are protected should you be attacked and your body destroyed.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Protected?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: That part of your soul that was hidden, lives on. In other words, you cannot die. Riddle nods and TURNS AWAY, staring at himself in the MIRROR on the wall opposite. A hint of RED glints in his eyes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: How does one split his soul, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I think you can guess the answer to that, Tom.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Murder.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes. Killing rips the soul apart. It is a violation against nature. After, one is never the same.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Out of curiosity, sir -- can you only split your soul once? For instance, isn’t seven the most powerfully magical number --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Seven! Merlin’s beard, Tom! Isn’t it bad enough to think of killing one person? To rip the soul into seven pieces... (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (stopping; worried) This is all hypothetical, isn’t it, Tom? All academic...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Of course, sir. And I promise I’ll not speak of our conversation. It’ll be our little secret... Riddle reaches out then and pinches the FLAME of a candle, killing it. As SMOKE RISES, we -- DISSOLVE INTO:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sir --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (haunted) This is beyond anything I imagined. In my life I have seen things that are unimaginably horrific. I know now... you will see worse.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Do you mean to say he succeeded, sir? In making a Horcrux?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oh he succeeded. And not just once. Think, Harry. He’s just told us.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Seven. He made seven -- the most powerfully magical number. But... what are they exactly? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Tom Riddle’s diary --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s a Horcrux, yes. Four years ago, when you saved Ginny Weasley’s life in the Chamber of Secrets, when you brought me this -- (holding up the diary) I knew. This was a different kind of magic. Very dark. Very powerful. But until tonight, I had no idea just how powerful...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: And the ring...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Belonged to Voldemort’s mother. It was difficult to find and... (raising his damaged hand) ... even more difficult to destroy.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: But if you could find them all. * If you did destroy each Horcrux... *

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: One destroys Voldemort.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: But how would you find them? They * could be hidden anywhere, couldn’t they...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: True. But magic, especially Dark magic... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: ... leaves traces. Harry’s clenched hand SPASMS, RELEASES. The ring skitters across Dumbledore’s desk and Harry brings a hand to his chest, a look of bewilderment on his face.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s where you’ve been going, isn’t it, sir? When you leave the school.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes. And I think... perhaps... I may have found another. But this time I cannot hope to destroy it alone.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Once again, I shall ask too much of you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Harry. It’s time.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hermione, is the Room of Requirement unplottable?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: If one wants it to be. Why?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It would explain why I thought Malfoy was leaving the castle when he disappeared off the Map.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Of course, and that explains the Vanishing Cabinet as well!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No. I got an owl from Dad this * morning. The one at Borgin & Burke’s? It’s still there.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: But I’m telling you. I saw it -- Just then, the twins appear, pass. Harry watches them, a thought forming.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What if there are two? Vanishing cabinets.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What if there are?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I don’t know...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Good luck, mate.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I don’t need luck. I’ll be with Dumbledore.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Have you ever considered that you ask too much? That you take too much for granted? Has it ever crossed your brilliant mind that I don’t want to do this anymore?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Whether it has or hasn’t is irrelevant. I will not negotiate this with you, Severus. You agreed. There’s nothing more to discuss.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Harry. You need a shave, my friend.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: At times I forget how much you’ve grown. At times I still see the small boy from the cupboard. (smiling) Forgive my mawkishness, Harry. I am an old man.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You look the same to me, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Like your mother, you are unfailingly kind. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: A trait people never fail to undervalue. I’m afraid.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: The place to which we journey tonight is exceedingly dangerous, Harry. I promised that you could accompany me and I stand by that promise. But there is a condition: You must obey any command I give you -- without question.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Understand what I’m saying. Should I tell you to hide, you must hide.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Should I tell you to run, you will * run.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: And should I tell you to abandon * me and save yourself... Harry’s eyes rise, meet Dumbledore’s. * DUMBLEDORE * You will do so. *

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Your word, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: My word.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Take my arm. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sir, I thought one couldn’t Apparate within Hogwarts.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Being me has its privileges. The WIND GUSTS and Harry reaches out. Dumbledore’s CLOAK BILLOWS and we are TOSSED INTO...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s there, isn’t it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: This is the place. Oh yes, this place has known magic. (closing his eyes) Where you stand, Harry, Tom Riddle once stood many, many years ago, when he was but a poor orphan boy with a penchant for cruelty...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: One wintry afternoon, he lured two younger classmates to this cave. What happened is unclear. But this much is known: the children were damaged.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sir! The rock face SIZZLES like acid and begins to crumble, forming a narrow opening.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: In order to gain passage, payment must be made, payment intended to weaken any intruder.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You should’ve let me, sir.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oh, no, Harry. Your blood is much more precious than mine.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Careful. The water.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It’s there. The only question is how do we get to it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: We couldn’t, perhaps, just try a Summoning Charm, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Accio Horcrux! There is an EXPLOSION and something PALE erupts out of the water. Harry nearly sheds his skin. Dumbledore calmly watches it VANISH beneath the surface.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Perhaps not.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: If you would, Harry... Quickly Harry grasps the end of the chain and together he and Dumbledore pull, end over end, until the PROW of a SMALL BOAT pierces the surface, green with algae. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: In eerie silence, the boat cleaves the water, ferrying

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sir... have you ever taken Felix Felicis?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Only recreationally. You see, I believe one creates one’s own luck.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Professor... there are bodies in this lake.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Yes. NEW ANGLE (SMALL ISLAND) - MOMENTS LATER Here the GREENISH GLOW is ferocious. As the boat arrives, Dumbledore steps out.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Remember... the water.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Do you think the Horcrux is in there, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Oh yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It has to be drunk. (as Harry reacts) You remember the condition on which I brought you with me? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: This potion might paralyze me. It might cause me to forget why I’m here. It might create so much pain I beg for relief. You are not to indulge these requests, Harry. It is your job to make sure I keep drinking this potion even if you have to force it down my throat. Understood?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Why can’t I drink it, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Because I am much older, much cleverer... and much less valuable. (taking the goblet) Your good health, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Professor?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Professor? Can you hear me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Don’t... don’t make me...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You... you can’t stop, Professor. You’ve got to keep drinking. Like you said. Remember.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Nooooooo!!! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Make it stop... Please... make it stop...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: It will, sir. It’ll stop. But only if you drink...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: My fault. It’s all my fault...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Too much... I can’t... take it... I want... to die... kill... kill me... KILL ME, HARRY!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: What?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Your word, Harry! Your word!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: KILL ME! IT’S THE ONLY WAY!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: One more. Just one more. And then -- I promise... I’ll do what you say. Dumbledore, jaw clinched shut, eyes Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I promise. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Water. A shudder of relief goes through Harry. Grinning, he leaps to the basin. A GOLDEN LOCKET now lies at the bottom. Harry snatches it up.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Water...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Aguamenti. Instantly COLD CLEAR WATER rises in the basin.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You did it, sir. Look --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Water!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’m trying, sir. I’m --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Utterly silent. Harry twists madly as HANDS reach for him, turning him this way and that. HAUNTED FACES float by.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: ... pulled underwater once again, into the eerie SILENCE of flailing arms. He shakes free again and again, but there are too many hands, too many haunted faces. We STAY UNDER a very long time, feel his lungs burning. His eyes lose their focus, turning blank. Bubbles trail out of his mouth as his face goes slack. He sinks deeper, in free fall, takes one last look at the SHIMMERING SURFACE ABOVE, the last thing he will see... when a SHADOW SHIVERS briefly and... ... the SURFACE SIZZLES with RED LIGHT, like blood, then becomes TRANSPARENT, revealing DUMBLEDORE, wand pointed directly at the water.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Go...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: We have to... go.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Don’t worry, sir. We’re nearly there.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I am not worried, Harry. I am with you. A CHOIR IN FULL VOICE RISES ON THE AIR and we --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: We need to get you up to the hospital, sir, to Madam Pomfrey --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No. Severus... Severus is who I need... Go and wake him... Tell him what has happened... (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Speak to no one else... I... I shall wait here...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: All right. Okay.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Sir, are you... praying?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: (smiling faintly) No, Harry. I do not pray. I was merely closing a window -- the one that had allowed us to Apparate.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Hide yourself below. And do not speak or show yourself without my permission. No matter what.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Do as I say, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Trust me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Good evening, Draco. What brings you out on such a fine Spring evening? Or is it Summer?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Who else is here? I heard you talking.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I often talk aloud to myself. I find it extraordinarily useful. That which sounds sane at a whisper can seem utterly mad when said for all the world to hear. Haven’t been whispering to yourself, have you, Draco?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You are not an assassin, Draco.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: How do you know what I am? I’ve done things that would shock you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Like cursing Katie Bell and hoping she would, in turn, bear a cursed necklace to me? Like replacing a bottle of mead with one laced with poison. Forgive me, Draco, but these are attempts so feeble I cannot help but question if your heart has been really in them. I’m curious. When Voldemort gave you this task, when he asked you to kill me, was it in a whisper?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Then I shall make it easy for you. Slowly and without intent, Dumbledore draws his wand. * Instantly Malfoy raises his own. * MALFOY * Expelliarumus! *

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well done, Draco. But I warn you. * Killing is not nearly as easy. * (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You’re not alone. Are you. There are others. How? A sneering smile plays over Malfoy’s lips.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: The Vanishing Cabinet in the Room of Requirement.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: That cabinet has been broken for years.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I’ve been mending it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Ingenious. Let me guess. It has a sister. A twin.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: In Borgin & Burkes. They form --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: A passage, yes. Very good. (eyes shifting) I once knew a boy years ago who made all the wrong choices. Let me help you, Draco.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I don’t want your help! Don’t you see! I have to do it! I have to! (in a whisper) I’ve got to kill you or he’ll kill me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Say that again, Draco. But aloud this time.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Well now, look what we have here. Dumbledore. Wandless and alone. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Cornered in his own castle. Well done, Draco.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Good evening, Bellatrix. I think introductions are in order.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Love to, Albus. But I’m afraid we’re on a bit of a tight schedule. (to Malfoy) Do it. Malfoy’s wand rises once again. Harry raises his own, aiming through the grid, poised. Just then, a SHADOW splinters through the columns to his right. He looks, finds Snape, quiet as a ghost, peering upward. Carefully, Snape draws his wand, then turns to Harry, a finger to his lips: Shhh. Then he is drifting upward. Silent. A ghost again.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: No! The Dark Lord was clear. The boy’s to do it. Go on, Draco. Now! Once again Draco raises his wand, his hand trembling. Harry’s own arm is stiff, sure. The vein in his hand pulsates...

Dialogue: No.

Dialogue: Severus...

Dialogue: Severus... please. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: I gave my word. I made a vow... Harry’s eyes dart back and forth frantically, trying to make sense of the scene playing out above. Snape’s arm rises.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Avada Kedavra! A JET of GREEN LIGHT hits Dumbledore squarely in the chest. For a second he hangs, suspended upon the ramparts, and then... the night swallows him. HARRY SCREAMS in RAGE. Bellatrix raises her wand to the sky and a DEAFENING BLAST shakes the castle, masking Harry’s cry. The CLOUDS EXPLODE with GRIM LIGHT, mutating into a SKULL. As the Death Eaters flee, Snape’s arm drops limply to his side.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You can no longer stay here. Draco, stunned, stares at the empty place where

Dialogue: Go on! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Go on!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Running. Harry bolts forth, wand in hand, vengeance in his eyes. Up ahead, Snape stands stolidly, tall and black against the raging fire. Harry points his wand, fires a JET of RED LIGHT. Snape doesn’t move, merely lets it streak by his head. Harry stops, chest heaving, and takes aim again.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Cruciatus!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Incacerata! Once again, Snape deflects the spell.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Impedimenta! Another lazy flick of the arm, another curse defeated.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Fight! Fight back, you coward! With staggering quickness, Snape’s wand whips forth and

Dialogue: No! He belongs to the Dark Lord!

Dialogue: You dare use my own spells against me, Potter?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: You may have gotten your mother’s eyes, but you’re as dim as your father. Yes. It’s me. I’m the Half-Blood Prince.

Dialogue: Hagrid... HAGRID!

Dialogue: Hagrid! You alright?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Dialogue: Take more’n tha’ ter finish me off. Not sure about me ‘ouse, tho’. But if anybody can put it righ’, Dumbledore can.

Dialogue: Hagrid, Dumbledore --

Dialogue: Only thing I can’t reckon is wha’

Dialogue: Dunno. But whoever they are, they have the real Horcrux. Which means, it was a waste. All of it.

Dialogue: I’m not coming back, Hermione. *

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Lumos Maxima... The tent BLOOMS SOFTLY with light -- briefly illuminating a bedside PHOTOGRAPH (of James & Lily Potter) -- then goes dark.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Lumos Maxima... The blankets bloom once again when, down the hall, a TOILET FLUSHES. Instantly, the SHADOW stiffens, the blankets DIM, and the tent flattens. Just as... ... the bedroom door OPENS, revealing... UNCLE VERNON.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Lumos Maxima... As the blankets blaze, we CUT INSIDE, find a SKINNY BOY with a crow's nest of black hair, thick glasses sitting crookedly atop his nose: HARRY POTTER. Open before him is Violeta Stitch's Extreme Incantations. Once again, he speaks:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Lumos... MAXIMA!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry! Harry!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Well, go on. Open it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Marge! Welcome! How was the train?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Wretched. Ripper got sick.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ah. How... unfortunate.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I would've left him with the others, but he pines so when I'm away. Don't you, darling?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Uncle Vernon. I need you to sign this form.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What is it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Nothing. Something for school... Uncle Vernon eyes the PARCHMENT in Harry's hand suspiciously.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Later perhaps. If you behave.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I will if she does.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (turning, eyeing Harry) So. Still here, are you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Don’t say 'yes' in that ungrateful tone. Damn good of my brother to keep you, if you ask me. (to Vernon, Petunia) It'd have been straight to an orphanage if he'd been dumped on my doorstep. Just then Dudley -- sitting comatose before the TV -- emits a HOLLOW, BRAIN-DEAD CHUCKLE.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Is that my Dudders! Hm? Is that my neffy poo? Come and say hello to your Auntie Marge. Marge flashes a thick FAN of POUND NOTES. Dudley blinks, waddles forward, and extends his plump palm obediently.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Can I tempt you, Marge?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Just a small one. A bit more... a bit more... That's the boy. (taking a sloppy sip) Aah. Excellent nosh, Petunia. It's normally just a fry-up for me, what with twelve dogs.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What are you smirking at! Where is it that you send him, Vernon?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: St. Brutus's. It's a first-rate institution for hopeless cases. Hearing this, Harry frowns, glances at Uncle Vernon, who glares darkly at him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I see. And do they use the cane at St. Brutus's, boy?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (sarcastically) Oh, yes. I've been beaten loads of times.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Excellent. I won't have this namby-pamby wishy-washy nonsense about not hitting people who deserve it. (another sip) Still. Mustn't blame yourself for how this one's turned out, Vernon. It all comes down to blood. Bad blood will out. What is it the boy's father did, Petunia?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (agitated) Nothing. That is... he didn't work. He was -- unemployed. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Of course. And a drunk, I expect --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That's a lie. Aunt Marge pauses on her wine, eyes narrowing on Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What did you say?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: My dad wasn't a drunk. POP! The GLASS in Aunt Marge's hand EXPLODES.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Oh my goodness! Marge!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Not to worry, Petunia. I have a very firm grip.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You go to bed. Now.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Quiet, Vernon. It doesn't matter about the father. In the end it comes down to the mother. You see it all the time with dogs. If there's something wrong with the bitch, there'll be something wrong with the pup...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Shut up! Shut up! Aunt Marge starts to reply, when -- ZING! -- a BUTTON on her dress sails into the air. SEAMS GROAN. THREAD SNAPS. Aunt Marge's eyes WIDEN. Her cheeks BILLOW. Her whole body BILLOWS. And she begins to INFLATE like a

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: MARGE! As she rises, Uncle Vernon leaps for her. RIPPER GROWLS, fixes his teeth to his trousers. Harry frightened by what he's done, watches Aunt Marge BOUNCE GENTLY across the ceiling and into the CONSERVATORY.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Don't worry! I've got you... Slowly... to his horror... Uncle Vernon himself begins to RISE. Aunt Marge looks fearfully into his eyes...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Vernon. Don't you dare -- But he does. He lets go. Falls to his knees. And watches Aunt Marge float away.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: YOU BRING HER BACK! YOU BRING HER BACK AND PUT HER RIGHT!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No! She deserved what she got! And you... you keep away from me. Uncle Vernon eyes Harry's wand nervously, then grins with knowing cruelty.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You're not allowed to do magic out of school. They won't have you now. You've got nowhere to go.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Anywhere's better than here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Aaaah! GIANT WHEELS bear down. Harry rolls clear -- just as a PREPOSTEROUSLY PURPLE, TRIPLE-DECKER BUS SCREECHES to a halt. GOLD LETTERS glimmer above the windscreen: The Knight Bus. DOORS HISS. Snap back. REVEAL STAN SHUNPIKE, an 18- year-old boy in a WRINKLED CONDUCTOR'S UNIFORM. Pasty face. Raccoon eyes. Stan looks like he hasn't seen the sun in years.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (wearily, drearily) Welcome to the Knight Bus. Emergency transport for the stranded witch or wizard. My name is Stan Shunpike, and I will be your conductor this evening. (peering at Harry) Wha' choo doin' down there?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Fell over.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Wha' choo fall over for? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I didn't do it on purpose. Stan eyes Harry suspiciously, nods slowly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Well, come on then. Let's not wait for the grass to grow. As Stan grabs Harry's trunk, Harry peers into the shadows across the street -- now simply shadows -- and climbs aboard.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Not now... I'm pickling slugs... Behind the wheel, ERNIE, an UNSHAVEN WIZARD in THICK GLASSES, stares straight ahead, armpits stained with sweat. A SHRUNKEN HEAD dangles from the rearview mirror, MUTTERING incessantly through the STITCHES that lace its mouth.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Take 'er away, Ern.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yeah, take it away! BANG! Ernie rockets away and the beds -- as one -- slide six inches to the rear. Harry drops onto the bed nearest, peers up at the CHANDELIER SWAYING directly above his head. Beyond the windscreen ONCOMING TRAFFIC WHIPS past in a blur.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Wot you say your name was again?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I didn't. Stan, huddled in an armchair, peeks over The Daily Prophet, eyes Harry coolly, before disappearing once more. Harry brushes the fringe of his hair over his scar, watches an AMBULANCE -- SIREN WAILING -- careen past. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Whereabouts you headin'?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The Leaky Cauldron. That's in London --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Is it now? Get that, Ern? The Leaky Cauldron. That's in London. Stan grins with sinister delight, showing BAD TEETH.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Leaky Cauldron! Stay away from the pea soup! As the Shrunken Head CACKLES with delight, Harry peers out the windscreen, watches London careering by.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Isn't this a bit... dangerous?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Naah. Haven't had an accident in -- what? -- a week is it, Ern?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Heads up! Little old lady at twelve o'clock! Sure enough, directly ahead, a LITTLE OLD LADY is crossing the street. Ernie HITS the BRAKES HARD and

Dialogue: Who is that? That man.

Dialogue: How'd he escape?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Tha's the question, isn't it? He's the firs' that's done it. Gives me the collywobbles thinking he's out there, though, I'll tell you that. Big supporter of You- Know-'Oo, Black was. Reckon you heard o' him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yeah. Him I've heard of. Just then, a pair of DOUBLE-DECKER BUSES sweep directly toward the Knight Bus. Before can scream, the entire Knight Bus SQUEEZES DOWN and shoots the gap between the two onrushing buses. The Shrunken Head winces.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hate that.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: This bus. Don't the Muggles ever...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Them! Don' listen properly, do they? Don' look properly either. Never notice nuffink, they don'. Just then, a COUPLE walking a DOG are engulfed by a RUSH of WIND as the (invisible) Knight Bus WHOOSHES past. The couple glances about in bewilderment. The DOG YAPS madly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Turn! Turn! Ernie fans the wheel, sending the Knight Bus into a dizzying 360-degree turn. HEADLIGHTS pinwheel past the windows as the bus rides up on two wheels and Harry is sent flying once more. Grabbing fast to the center POLE, he pirouettes through the air when Ernie... SLAMS on the

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Mr. Potter... at last.

Dialogue: Hedwig!

Dialogue: Right smart bird you've got there, Mr. Potter. Arrived only minutes before yourself. A MAN CLEARS his throat. Harry turns, finds a PINSTRIPED SILHOUETTE (CORNELIUS FUDGE) at the window, staring at the ghostly shadows beyond. Harry's reflection shivers in the glass, but the man doesn't turn. Tom takes a position against the wall, fishes a pair of WALNUTS from his pocket and -- CRACK -- crushes the shells between his palms. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I should tell you, Mr. Potter, earlier this evening your uncle's sister was located just south of Sheffield, circling a chimney stack. The Accidental Magic Reversal Department was dispatched and she's been properly punctured and her memory modified. She has no recollection of the incident whatsoever.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: So that's that, and no harm done. (smiling) Pea soup?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No thank you. Minister... I don't understand. I broke the law. Underage wizards aren't allowed to use magic at home --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (dishing up a bowl) Oh, come now, Harry. The Ministry doesn't send people to Azkaban for blowing up their aunts! On the other hand... running away like that... given the state of things... very, very irresponsible.

Dialogue: 'The state of things' sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: We have a killer on the loose.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hm? Oh, nothing. You're safe, that's what matters. Tomorrow you'll be on your way to Hogwarts. These are your new schoolbooks. I took the liberty of having them brought here for you.

Dialogue: By the way, Harry. Whilst you're here it would be best if you didn't... wander. 15 OMITTED 15

Dialogue: Housekeeping. As she opens the door, she's greeted by a THUNDEROUS ROAR and a RUSH of WIND.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (unperturbed) I'll come back later. (CONTINUED)

Dialogue: I'm warning you, Hermione! Keep that bloody beast of yours away from Scabbers or I'll turn it into a tea cozy.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: He's a cat, Ronald! What do you expect? It's in his nature. As Harry reaches bottom, he finds RON WEASLEY protectively cradling Scabbers, while HERMIONE GRANDER does her best to restrain a HISSING Crookshanks.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: A cat! Is that what they told you? Looks more like a pig with hair if you ask me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That's rich coming from the owner of that smelly old shoe brush. (cooing to the cat) It's all right, Crookshanks. You just ignore the mean little boy... Then, sensing another presence in the room, both turn. HERMIONE/RON Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: from The Daily Prophet. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Egypt! What's it like?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Brilliant. It's got loads of old stuff. Mummies. Death masks. Tombs --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You know, the ancient Egyptians of the Nile River delta worshipped the cat goddess Bast.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I also got a new wand. Just then, a COMMOTION is HEARD. The Weasleys -- PERCY, FRED, GEORGE, GINNY, ARTHUR, and MOLLY -- arrive en masse, laden with purchases from Diagon Alley.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Not flashing that clipping about again, are you, Ron?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I haven't shown anyone!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No, not a soul. Unless you count Tom. The day maid. The night maid. The cook. The bloke that came to fix the toilet. That wizard from Belgium... Mrs. Weasley takes Harry's face in her hands, smiles. As if relieved to see him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It's good to see you, Harry. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Good to see you too, Mrs. Weasley.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry. I wonder if I might have a word.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Of course, Mr. Weasley. As Mr. Weasley pulls Harry away, the others continue to hover over the clipping in the b.g.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: George's nose looks positively massive in that photograph.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That's your nose, Fred.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Bloody hell. 'Tis, isn't it? Take after your side of the family, don't I, Mum?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry. There are some within the Ministry who would strongly discourage me from divulging what I'm about to tell you. But I think you need to know the facts. Because you're in danger. Grave danger. Harry's eyes drift to the fugitive poster.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Has this anything to do with him, sir?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What do you know of Sirius Black, Harry?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That he escaped from Azkaban. That he killed someone... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry, thirteen years ago, when you stopped... Mr. Weasley hesitates, unable to continue.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Voldemort...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (nodding nervously) Black lost everything. But he remains a loyal servant to this day. In his mind, only you stand in the way of... Once again, Mr. Weasley hesitates.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Voldemort...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry, I hate it when you say --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I know, sorry. Ron hates it too.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: In Black's mind, only you stand in the way of... You-Know-Who returning to power. That's why he's broken. That's why he's broken out of Azkaban. To find you. And... Mr. Weasley hesitates yet again.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Kill me? Mr. Weasley nods. Nervously.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry. I want you to swear that -- whatever you might hear -- you won't go looking for Black.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Mr. Weasley, why would I go looking for someone who wants to kill me? Mr. Weasley nods, then claps Harry on the shoulder. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Just watch yourself, will you, Harry? 24 OMITTED 24 & & 25 25

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ron!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I didn't mean to blow her up. I just... (troubled by the memory) ... lost control.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Brilliant!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Honestly, Ron, it's not funny. Harry's lucky he wasn't expelled.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I still think it was brilliant. SNAP! SNAP! SNAP! A copy of the The Monster Book of Monsters SCUTTLES CRAB-LIKE down the aisle, pursued by

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hi, Harry. Ron. Hermione. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: C'mon. We're in here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Who d'you reckon he is?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Professor R.J. Lupin.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You know everything. How is it she knows everything?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It's on his case.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Is he really asleep?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Seems to be. Why? What is it, Harry?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Close the door.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Let me get this straight. Sirius Black escaped from Azkaban to come after you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But they'll catch Black, won't they? I mean... eventually?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Sure -- Of course, no one's ever broken out of Azkaban before and he's a raving, murderous lunatic... Just then, the COMPARTMENT RATTLES. Lanterns flicker. The train LURCHES, begins to SLOW. Hermione slides down the seat, pinning Ron against the window. They exchange an awkward glance, then Hermione carefully slides to the other end of the seat and glances at her WATCH. Frowns.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Why're we stopping? We can't be there yet...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What's going on? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Dunno... Maybe we've broken down?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ouch! Ron, that was my foot! SQUEAK-SQUEAK-SQUEAK. Ron, a dark silhouette against the window, wipes a patch of condensation from the window.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: There's something moving out there. I think... people are coming aboard. Suddenly the CAR SWAYS violently... rights itself. The METAL WINDOW TRIM at Ron's fingertips begins to VIBRATE.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Bloody hell. What's happening? SSSSST! A soft CRACKLING fills the car and FLAMES bloom... in the hands of R.J. Lupin. In the SHIVERING LIGHT, his face looks tired and gray, but his eyes are alert. Wary.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Don't. Move. A HAND -- slimy and scabbed -- a hand of death -- GRIPS the half-open compartment door, pushes it aside. REVEALS: a TOWERING, CLOAKED FIGURE, its face hidden beneath its black hood. CROOKSHANKS' hair rises and as she HISSES... WHOOSHHHHH. The folds of the hood TREMBLE. A CHILL, RATTLING INTAKE OF AIR is heard. The FLAMES in Lupin's hands SPUTTER. A SOUND SWELLS in Harry's ears. Eerie. Painful. The sound of a WOMAN SCREAMING. Harry's eyes roll up, eyelids fluttering. And then... a SILVERY WHITE LIGHT drifts from his mouth. The world spins off its axis and Harry falls... glasses tumbling hard to the ground... then Harry... the muscles of his jaw twitching. THUNDER CRACKS. LIGHTNING paints the ICY windows...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: With a DESPERATE GASP, Harry opens his eyes. Blinks. DUSK IS GONE. The windows BLACK. The floor at his spine is SHAKING GENTLY. The train moving again. His eyes shift, see a DROP OF WATER, newly unfrozen, running slowly down the window.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry? Harry, are you all right?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Thanks.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Chocolate. Eat. It'll help.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What was that -- that thing?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: A Dementor. One of the guards of Azkaban. It's gone now.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It was searching the train, Harry. For Sirius Black.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I need to have a word with the driver. Excuse me. (the chocolate) Eat. It'll help. As he leaves, Harry turns to Ron and Hermione.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What happened to me? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Well, you sort of went... rigid. We thought maybe you were having a fit or something.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: And did either of you? You know... pass out?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No. I felt... weird. Like I'd never be cheerful again. But... no.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I was trembling. Cold. But then... Professor Lupin made it go away...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But someone was screaming. A woman.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No one was screaming, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Welcome! Welcome to another year at Hogwarts! I have a few things to say, before we become befuddled by our excellent feast. I myself am particularly looking forward to the flaming kiwi cups, which, while somewhat treacherous for those of us with facial hair... McGONAGALL clears her throat.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Mm. Yes. First, I'm pleased to welcome Professor R.J. Lupin, who has kindly consented to fill the post of Defense Against the Dark Arts. Good luck to you, Professor. Amid SCATTERED APPLAUSE, Harry, Ron, Hermione CLAP

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Of course! That's why he knew to give you the chocolate, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: As some of you may know, Professor Kettleburn, our Care of Magical Creatures teacher for many years, has decided to retire in order to spend more time with his remaining limbs. Fortunately, I'm delighted to announce that his place will be filled by none other than our own Rubeus Hagrid! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (turning grave) Finally, on a more disquieting note, Hogwarts -- at the request of the Ministry of Magic -- will, until further notice, play host to the Dementors of Azkaban. A MURMUR of apprehension fills the hall. At the Slytherin table, DRACO MALFOY, flanked by the ever- present CRABBE and GOYLE, catches Harry's eye, feigns a dead faint.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The Dementors will be stationed at the entrances to the grounds. While they are under strict orders not to enter the castle itself, you will on occasion see them as you go about your daily activities. Under no circumstances are you to approach them. It is not in the nature of a Dementor to be forgiving.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Fortuna Major.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Good to be home, eh, Harry?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yeah... As his breath CLOUDS THE GLASS, we gradually...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Welcome, my children. In this room, you shall explore the mysterious art of Divination. In this room, you shall discover if you possess... A crimson scrim FLUTTERS and SYBIL TRELAWNEY, Divination Professor, glides dramatically INTO VIEW, eyes huge and bug-like behind enormous glasses.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: ... the Sight. Hello. I am

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (under her breath) What rubbish.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Where'd you come from?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Me? I've been here all along.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (spinning on Neville) You, boy! Is your grandmother well?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I... I think so.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I wouldn't be so sure of that. (continuing) The first term will be devoted to the reading of tea leaves. If all goes well, we will proceed to palmistry, fire omens, and finally... the crystal ball. (eyeing Parvati) By the way, dear, beware a red- haired man. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Unfortunately, classes will be disrupted in February by a nasty bout of flu. I myself will lose my voice. And in late spring, one of our number will... leave us forever. As the class exchanges uneasy glances, Trelawney smiles brightly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Well then. Shall we?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Inside, a CLOUD of TEA LEAVES mutates oddly. Harry, sitting opposite Ron now, frowns at the leaves, consults the SYMBOLS in the textbook (Unfogging the Future) at his elbow. Trelawney walks amongst them, robes flowing.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Broaden your minds, my dears. And allow your eyes to see... beyond. Trelawney takes Lavender Brown's cup, peers inside.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: A five-leaf clover... You can expect to wake with a horrible rash tomorrow morning, dear. (then, casually) Mr. Longbottom, after you've broken your first cup... CA-CHINK! Neville fumbles the cup in his hands and the brittle CRASH of CHINA is heard.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: ... would you be so kind as to select one of the blue ones? I'm rather partial to the pink. (pausing by Ron) What do you see in Mr. Potter's cup, Mr. Weasley? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Well. He's got a wonky sort of cross -- that's trials and suffering. But this lot here could be the sun -- that's great happiness. So... he's going to suffer but be very happy about it. Professor Trelawney takes the cup, peers inside, and

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ahhh!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What is it, Professor? Trelawney regards Harry with a mixture of pity and fear.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: My dear boy... You have the Grim.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The Grin? What's the Grin?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Not the grin, you idiot. The Grim.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But what does it mean, Professor?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: 'The Grim...' All turn, see Lavender bent over her textbook.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: 'Taking the form of a giant spectral dog, it is among the darkest omens in our world. It is an omen... of death.'

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Death omens. Honestly. If you ask me, Divination's a very wooly discipline. Now Ancient Runes. That's a fascinating subject.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ancient Runes? Exactly how many classes are you taking this term?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: A fair few.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hang on. Ancient Runes is the same time as Divination. You'd have to be in two classes at once.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Don't be silly. How could anyone be in two classes at once? (mimicking Trelawney) Broaden your minds...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: C'mon now, get a move on! Got a real treat for yeh. Great lesson comin' up. Follow me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Gather 'round. Find yerself a spot. That's it. Now, firs' thing yeh'll want ter do is open yer books --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: And exactly how do we do that? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Crikey. Didn' yeh know? All yeh've got ter do is stroke 'em. Look --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Righ' then. So... so... yeh've got yer books, an' now yeh need the Magical Creatures. Right. So... I'll... I'll go an' get 'em.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: God, this place is going to the dogs. Wait until my father hears Dumbledore's got this oaf teaching classes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Listen, you stupid prat -- Eyes WIDENING in fear, Malfoy steps back, points.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Potter, there's a Dementor behind you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Gee up, there! (grinning) Beau'iful, isn' he? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hagrid. Exactly what is that?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: A Hippogriff, o' course. Now, firs' thing yeh gotta know is they're proud. Easily offended, Hippogriffs are. Don't never insult one, 'cause it migh' be the las' thing yeh do. Right then -- who wants ter come an' say hello? The entire class STEPS BACK, leaving Harry in front.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Good man, Harry!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Tha's it. Easy now... stop! This here's Buckbeak, Harry. Yeh want ter let 'im make the firs' move. It's polite, see? Jus' take step forward, give 'im a bow, and if Buckbeak bows back, yeh're allowed ter touch him. Ready? Unsure, Harry nods anyway. Steps forward. And... bows. Buckbeak's head cocks, eagle eyes studying Harry cannily.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Back off, Harry! Back off!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Well done, Harry! Go on. Give 'im a pat. Tentatively, Harry reaches out, lays his hand on Buckbeak's fierce beak. The class CLAPS. Harry smiles. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Look at that! I reckon he migh' let yeh ride 'im!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (smile drooping) Excuse me?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: We'll jus' set yeh behind the wing joint. Mind yeh don' pull any feathers out. He won' like that.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Off yeh go! As Buckbeak GALLOPS FORWARD, Harry slides scarily back, giant WINGS unfold, huge and powerful, and -- WHOOSH! -- they SOAR into the air. Rising higher. And higher. And higher. Gradually, Harry loosens his hold on Buckbeak's neck. Losing himself in the joy of flying. Smiling at the sight of his and Buckbeak's SHADOW racing across the grass below. Circling over the Whomping Willow, past Hogwarts castle, and then SWOOPING, with heart-stopping speed, over the Black Lake, Buckbeak's talons tickling the smooth glass of the water, summoning the GIANT SQUID to the surface briefly. Hagrid WHISTLES then, and Buckbeak wheels, beating his way back to the paddock, galloping to a halt. As Harry slides off, the class CHEERS -- all except Draco, who narrows his eyes maliciously.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Good work, Harry! (under his breath) How'm I doin' me firs' day?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Brilliant... Professor.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Give me a go at that thing. If Potter can do it, it must be easy. You're not dangerous at all, are you, you great ugly brute --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Malfoy! No! In a flash, Buckbeak's steely talons SLASH DOWN. Malfoy freezes. Looks down at the BLOOD BLOSSOMING on his robes. SHRIEKS. Instantly, Harry dashes forward. Buckbeak WHIPS AROUND, raises its talons and -- seeing

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It's killed me! It's killed me!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Calm yerself! Yer fine... jus' a scratch...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hagrid. He's got to be taken to a hospital. I'll go with you, if you like --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No. I'm the teacher. You all... you all just... Class dismissed! And with that, Hagrid -- looking shaken -- swoops up Malfoy, flops him over his shoulder, and lumbers toward the castle.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Does it hurt terribly, Draco? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (a tad theatrical) It comes and goes. Still... I consider myself lucky. According to Madam Pomfrey, another minute or two... and I could've lost the arm. Harry, Ron and Hermione watch from the Gryffindor table.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The little git. He's really laying it on thick, isn't he?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: At least Hagrid didn't get sacked.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yes. But I hear Draco's father's furious. I don't think we've heard the end of this...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: He's been sighted!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Who? But the PHOTOGRAPH on the Prophet's front page provides a chilling answer: Sirius Black. Hermione reads over the shoulders of others. WHISPERS half to herself:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Achintee? That's not far from here...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You don't think he'd come to Hogwarts, do you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: With the Dementors at every entrance?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Dementors? He's already slipped by them once, hasn't he? Who's to say he can't do it again? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That's right. Black could be anywhere. It's like trying to catch smoke. Like trying to catch smoke with your bare hands.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Intriguing, yes? Would anyone like to venture a guess as to what's inside?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (in a hushed voice) That's a Boggart, that is.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Very good, Mr. Finnigan. Can anyone tell us what a Boggart looks like?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No one knows.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: When'd she get here? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Boggarts are shape-shifters.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Terrifying, yes. Luckily, a very simple charm exists to repel a Boggart. Let's practice it now, shall we? Without wands, please... Riddikulus!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Riddikulus!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (muttering softly) It's this class that's ridiculous.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Good. So much for the easy part. You see, the incantation alone is not enough. What really finishes a Boggart off is... laughter. You need to force it to assume a shape you find truly amusing. Neville, come up here, will you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What would you say is the thing that frightens you most?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Profter... Snafpt...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Didn't catch that, Neville, sorry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Professor Snape. Everyone LAUGHS good-naturedly. Lupin nods thoughtfully.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hmmm... yes. Neville, I believe you live with your grandmother? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yes, but I don't want the Boggart to turn into her either.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It won't. But I want you to picture her clothes, only her clothes, very clearly in your mind. Can you do that?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (closing his eyes)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That's fine. We don't need to hear it. If you see it, we will. Now, when I open this wardrobe, Neville, here's what I want you to do...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You can do this, Neville.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Right then. Wand at the ready. One. Two. Three! SPARKS jet from Lupin's wand, strike the doorknob, and the wardrobe BURSTS OPEN. Instantly, Snape appears, eyes flashing hideously as he stalks forward. Neville backs away in fright.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Think, Neville. Think!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: R-r-riddikulus! CRACK! Snape stumbles in a FLASH OF LIGHT and reappears... in a LONG, LACE-TRIMMED DRESS, TOWERING MOTH-EATEN HAT, and CRIMSON HANDBAG. Instantly, the class ROARS (except for Draco and his fellow Slytherins).

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ron! Forward!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Riddikulus! CRACK! ROLLER SKATES materialize on the spider's hairy feet and it begins to shuffle crazily in place. Instantly, Ron relaxes as the class' LAUGHTER rings out.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Parvati! As Parvati steps up, the spider SPINS faster and faster, a DIZZYING BLUR, then reappears as a VAMPIRE.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Riddikulus! As the vampire WHIPS its cloak across its eyes, we CUT BEHIND... so our POV is of the students. SWISH! The cloak reopens, the class LAUGHS, and we REVERSE again... see that the vampire is now dressed like CARMEN MIRANDA. As it begins to SHIMMY about -- against its will -- the class starts to CLAP.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Mr. Thomas! As Dean steps up, the vampire's undulating body attenuates, its skin darkening with diamond-thatched SCALES becoming... a GIANT COBRA.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Riddikulus! The cobra's hooded head BOBS back and forth, transforms into a JACK-IN-THE-BOX. Lupin grins and...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Next! ... turns, sees Harry step forward expectantly. Concern flickers through Lupin's face. The Jack-In-The-Box pivots on its spring, its face tumbling toward Harry, becoming more sinister, transforming into a... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Here! CRACK! -- the Dementor vanishes and a ROILING MIST appears, which becomes CLOUDS. Something glows within the clouds, white, silvery and round...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Riddikulus! POP! The orb deflates like a punctured balloon, WHIZZES crazily about the room, then darts back into the wardrobe. The door SLAMS SHUT and the CLASS CHEERS.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Well done, everyone. I think that's enough excitement for today. As the students exit, chattering loudly, only Harry, subdued, remains behind. At the doorway, Lupin glances back, exchanges a private glance with him. As he exits, the WARDROBE gives one last RATTLE.
