Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yes, Professor, but I thought if you said I could go -- PROFESSOR McGONAGALL But I don't say so. A parent or guardian must sign, and since I am neither, it would be inappropriate. (a flicker of pity) I'm sorry, Potter. But that's my final word.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: So. No Hogsmeade, eh ? 51 OMITTED 51 thru thru 54 54

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Well, don't feel too bad. I was roundly disappointed the first time I went.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Really?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No. I was just trying to make you feel better. Honeydukes' sweets are the best in the world. Their Pepper Imps are so strong you smoke at the ears. And Zonko's Joke Shop may be dangerous, but you can't beat their Stink Pellets. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (nodding glumly) Not to mention The Shrieking Shack, which, according to Hermione, is the most severely haunted building in Britain.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yes, that too...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Professor, can I ask you something?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You'd like to know why I stopped you from facing the Boggart. (off Harry's surprise) I should think it'd be obvious. I assumed the Boggart would take the shape of Lord Voldemort.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But clearly... I was wrong.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I did think of Voldemort first. But then, I remembered that night on the train... and the Dementors... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Well, well. I'm impressed. That suggests that what you fear most of all is... fear. Very wise.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Before I fainted... I heard something. A woman. Screaming.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Dementors force us to relive the worst memories of our lives. Our pain becomes their power.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I think it was my mother. The night she was murdered.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The first time I saw you, Harry, I recognized you immediately. Not by your scar. By your eyes. They're your mother Lily's. (nodding) Yes. I knew her. She was there for me at a time when no one else was. We used to talk for hours.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Which perhaps explains her affection for your father. James had, shall we say, a certain talent for trouble. A gift, rumor has it, he passed on to you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I could tell you stories -- and there are many about your parents,

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: And the post office! It's about 200 owls, all sitting on color- coded shelves, depending on how fast you want your letter to go!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: And Honeyduke's is brilliant! Sugar Quills, Flaming Whizbees -- and blood-flavored lollipops for Halloween!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But, I mean, after awhile, it got a bit boring. Don't you think, Ron?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Huh? Oh. Yeah. Dead depressing. Hang on. I almost forgot. I got you something wicked at Dervish and Banges. It's a Pocket Sneakoscope.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: If there's someone untrustworthy around, it's meant to light up and spin. Mind you, Fred and

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I'm glad you had a good time. Really. And thanks for this. (eyeing the Sneakoscope) Rubbish or not, you're right. It can't hurt. With that, Harry pops a PEPPER IMP into his mouth. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Oh, careful of those, they'll make your... On cue, SMOKE CURLS from Harry's ears and nose.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Never mind.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What's the hold-up? Only Neville ever forgets the password.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (pushing past) Let me through, please. Excuse me, thank you, I'm Head Boy... (stopping dead) Back! All of you! No one is to enter this dormitory until it has been fully searched! Harry, Ron, and Hermione exchange dark glances, when...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The Fat Lady... she's gone.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Probably stuffing her face with the apples in that still life on the second floor again.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No. You don't understand --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Mr. Filch. Round up the ghosts. Tell them to search every painting in the castle for the Fat Lady. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: There'll be no need for ghosts, Professor...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Dear lady. Who did this to you?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (in a trance) Eyes like the devil he's got. And a soul as dark as his name. It was him, Headmaster. The one they talk about. He's here. Somewhere in the castle. Sirius Black. As the students REACT, Dumbledore's VOICE cuts through.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Secure the castle, Mr. Filch. The rest of you... to the Great Hall. 58 MONTAGE - SECURING THE CASTLE - NIGHT 58 CLOCK TOWER DOOR: Great GROANING TUMBLERS fall. SPINDLES rotate. CYLINDERS -- one after another -- fire into place. WINDOWS: Iron SPIKES, sharp as razors, rise instantly. 59 OMITTED 59

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I've done the dungeons, Headmaster. No sign of Black. Nor anywhere else in the castle.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (nodding) I didn't really expect him to linger.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Remarkable feat, don't you think? To enter Hogwarts castle on one's own, completely undetected...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You may recall, prior to the start of term, I did express my concerns when you appointed Professor --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I do not believe a single professor inside this castle would have helped Sirius Black enter it, Severus. As Snape's eyes glitter darkly, Dumbledore gazes out over the slumbering students.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No... I feel quite confident the castle is safe. And I'm more than willing to let the students return to their Houses. But tomorrow. For now, let them sleep... As Dumbledore's gaze finds Harry, he shuts his eyes, feigns sleep.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It's astonishing what the body can endure when the mind allows itself to rest.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What villains are these that trespass upon my private lands!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Who dares challenge Sir Cadogan! Back, you scurvy braggarts! You rogues!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: He's barking mad!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What d'you expect? After what happened to the Fat Lady, none of the other pictures would take the job.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But he keeps changing the password. Twice just this morning! I've taken to keeping a list. As Neville holds up a wrinkled piece of parchment, Harry,

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Farewell, comrades! If ever you have need of noble heart and steely sinew, call upon Sir Cadogan!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yeah, we'll call you... if we ever need someone mental. 64 OMITTED 64

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Turn to page 394. As the students eye Snape with guarded curiosity, Malfoy finishes SCRAWLING something on a bit of PARCHMENT and balls it up in his hands. As he opens them, a MOTH flutters from his palms.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Excuse me, sir, but... where's Professor Lupin?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That's not really your concern, is it, Potter? Suffice it to say, your Professor finds himself incapable of teaching at the present time. Page 394.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Werewolves?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But, sir, we've only just begun learning about Red Caps and Hinkypunks. We're not meant to start nocturnal beasts for weeks --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Quiet!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (to Harry) When did she come in? Did you see her come in...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Now. Which of you can tell me the difference between an Animagus and a werewolf? As the class stares mutely at a SLIDE of an ATTACKING WEREWOLF, Hermione waiting desperately for someone to respond to Snape's question, the moth flutters by Harry. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No one? How... disappointing.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Please, sir, an Animagus is a wizard who elects to turn into an animal. A werewolf has no choice in the matter. Furthermore, the werewolf actively hunts humans and responds only to the call of its own kind -- Malfoy lets out a LOW HOWL.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Quiet, Malfoy! Though one must admit to feeling your pain. That is the second time you have spoken out of turn, Miss Granger. Tell me. Are you incapable of restraining yourself? Or do you take pride in being an insufferable know-it-all?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (to Harry) He's got a point, you know.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Five points from Gryffindor! (to the class) As a antidote to your ignorance, I prescribe two rolls of parchment on the werewolf by Monday morning, with particular emphasis placed on recognizing it. (suddenly) Passing notes, Potter?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Not exactly Picasso, are you? I hope you demonstrate more talent on the Quidditch pitch this weekend then you do as an artist. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: If not, I fear you'll perish, given the weather forecast. Until that time, however, you'll forgive me if I don't let you off homework. Should you die, I assure you... you need not hand it in. As Snape turns away, Malfoy sniggers with Crabbe, Coyle and PIKE. Harry glances down at the drawing once more and we hear a true RUMBLE of THUNDER and --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: -- as he flies, RAIN falling like NEEDLES before him, every dark cloud concealing potential danger. Beaters crisscross his path. A BLUDGER WHIZZES past, then a second ROCKETS DIRECTLY AT HIM. SWOOP! -- Harry ducks, watches the BLUDGER SHATTER the BROOM of a HUFFLEPUFF BEATER. The Beater goes into a wild spiral, vanishes in the mist. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Come on! Faster! The trace of a smile forms on Harry's lips as he closes on the Snitch... only yards away... reaching out... when... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: A DISTANT WHISTLE weaves into the WIND, rises in pitch, not a whistle at all, but a... SCREAM. A WOMAN'S SCREAM. Harry's eyes flutter, and wisps of SILVERY WHITE LIGHT float from his mouth. His glasses glaze over completely. His fingers, rigid, can no longer grip the broom and...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No!!!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Not a sound. For the longest time. Then... VOICES:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Looks a bit peaky, doesn't he? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Peaky? What d'you expect him to look like? He fell fifty feet.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yeah, c'mon, Ron. We'll walk you off the Astronomy Tower and see how you come out looking.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Probably a right sight better than he normally does.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry! How're you feeling?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Brilliant.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Gave us a right good scare, mate.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What happened?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You fell off your broom.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Really? I meant the match. Who won? Silence. Uncomfortable glances.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No one blames you, Harry. The Dementors aren't meant to come on the grounds. Dumbledore was furious. After he saved you, he sent them straight off. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: There's something else you should know, Harry. Your Nimbus -- when it blew away? -- it sort of landed in the Whomping Willow. And well...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I'm sorry about your broom, Harry. There's no chance of fixing it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Why do they affect me so, Professor? I mean, more than everyone else...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Dementors are among the foulest creatures that walk this earth.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I'm scared, Professor.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I'd consider you a fool if you weren't. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I need to learn how to fight them. You could teach me, Professor. You made that Dementor on the train go away...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: There was only one that night...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But you made it go away.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (a beat) I don't pretend to be an expert, Harry. But yes, I can teach you. Perhaps after the holiday. For now, though, I need to rest. I'm feeling... tired.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Beautiful...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: A ragged line of students follows McGonagall toward the bridge. Harry's POV becomes OBJECTIVE and...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Clever, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But not clever enough.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Besides, we've got a better way.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What's this rubbish?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Rubbish he says. That there's the secret to our success.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It's a wrench giving it to you, believe me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But we've decided your need's greater than ours. George, if you will...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I solemnly swear that I am up to no good.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: 'Messrs Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot and Prongs are proud to present The Marauder's Map'...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ah... Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot and Prongs. We owe them so much. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hang on. This is Hogwarts! And that... No. Is that really...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Dumbledore.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: In his study.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Pacing.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Does that a lot.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You mean, this map shows...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Everyone.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Everyone?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Everyone.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Where they are.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What they're doing.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Every minute.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Of every day.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Brilliant! Where'd you get it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Nicked it from Filch's office, of course, first year. Now listen. There's seven secret passageways out of the castle. But we'd recommend... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The One-Eyed Witch on the third floor.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The One-Eyed...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Witch, right. But you best hurry. Filch is heading this way. (as they go) Oh. And, Harry? When you're done, make sure to give it a tap and say, 'Mischief managed.' Otherwise, anyone can read it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: INSERT MAP -- Harry traces his finger along the tattered surface to an INK FIGURE labeled "Harry Potter." A tiny SPEECH BUBBLE appears: "Dissendium."

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Dissendium? CLICK! The witch's EYE OPENS and the statue pivots, revealing a DARK OPENING in the floor. As Harry crouches, squinting, a cool DRAFT OF AIR ruffles his hair and the CAMERA DRIFTS INTO the DARKNESS...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Mischief managed.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: A box of Jelly Slugs as well, Horace. We're nearly cleared out. HORACE grunts, begins moving boxes. Harry looks up to the cellar door, takes out the invisibility cloak...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: ... into the MISTY, FOG-SHROUDED chaos of Main Street. As the lollipop drifts on, FOOTPRINTS appear in the snow below...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It's meant to be the most haunted building in Britain. Did I mention that?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Twice.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Should we move a bit closer?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Huh? Oh... All right... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Actually, it's fine from here.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Perfect. Just then, VOICES ECHO and THREE FIGURES appear over the rise, phantoms in the mist. Malfoy. Crabbe. Goyle. Pike.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Well, well. Look who's here. You two shopping for your dream home? Seems a bit grand for you, Weasel- Bee. Don't your family all sleep in one room?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Shut your mouth, Malfoy.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (clucking his tongue) Now that's not very friendly. Boys, I think we're going to have to teach Weasel-Bee to respect his superiors.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (a harsh chuckle) Hope you don't mean yourself. Malfoy's eyes shift, regard Hermione with disgust.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: How dare you speak to me, you filthy, little mud -- SPLAT! Malfoy takes a SNOWBALL to the grill. Splutters:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Who did that! Malfoy glances about in confusion, when -- SPLAT! SPLAT! -- he takes two more. Hermione and Ron glance about uneasily.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Well, don't just stand there! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Wait a minute, there's something out here -- Aaaaaaahhhh!!! Malfoy's SKI MASK is pulled over his eyes, he's spun about, given a ROUGH KICK to the ass and sent stumbling over the rise and out of sight. Instantly, Crabbe and Goyle join him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry...? Harry? The Invisibility Cloak drops. Sure enough. Harry. Grinning.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Bloody hell, Harry! That was not funny! But he's smiling. They all are. As he and Hermione pelt

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Those weasels! Never told me about any Marauder's Map!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But Harry isn't going to keep it. He's going to turn it over to Professor McGonagall, aren't you? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Oh sure. Along with his invisibility cloak, his pack of exploding snap cards, his --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Oh, shut up.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Rosmerta, m'dear! Up ahead Cornelius Fudge emerges from a MINISTRY SLEIGH as Hagrid swings the door clear and -- with unfortunate ease -- rips it clean off the fittings. Fudge joins McGonagall and a CURVY BARMAID (ROSMERTA) outside the

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That's Madam Rosmerta. Ron fancies her.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It's not true!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Shhh.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I trust business is good?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It'd be a right sight better if the Ministry wasn't sending Dementors into my pub every other night.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: We have a killer on the loose.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry? He's gone. FOOTPRINTS track through the snow, into the pub.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: ... as he THREADS THROUGH the teeming pub, PAST a SIGN ("No Underage Wizards") and nearly collides with some very STRANGE-LOOKING PATRONS. Ron and Hermione ripple briefly past a frosted window, then... THREE SHRUNKEN HEADS swing INTO VIEW. SHRUNKEN HEAD #1 So I says to him, 'Careful, Ned. Don't want to go losing your head!' As the three heads CACKLE HYSTERICALLY, bobbing up and down on their strings, Harry turns... just as an UNSHAVEN WIZARD'S arm whips down and a DART goes WHISTLING right toward Harry's eyes. Harry DUCKS, pivots, and -- THWOCK! -- sees the dart pierce the cork of the disfigured DARTBOARD behind him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Come on then. Let's hear it. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You-Know-Who. I've heard this rot. It was all over The Daily Prophet back in the day. And I'll say now what I said then: Of all the boys I ran out of here, Black's the last who would've gone over to the dark side. Hearsay. That's all the Ministry had. Hearsay.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ha! Tell that to Peter Pettigrew!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Peter Pettigrew? PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Little lump of a boy? Always tagging after Black and...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I remember him. What's he got to do with it? PROFESSOR McGONAGALL After the Potters were killed, Pettigrew went looking for Black. And, unfortunately... found him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Black was vicious. He didn't kill Pettigrew. He destroyed him. A finger. That's all that was left. A finger -- there's your hearsay. Rosmerta looks to McGonagall. She nods grimly. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But that's not the worst of it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What could be worse? PROFESSOR McGONAGALL This: Sirius Black was and remains today... Harry Potter's godfather. BLAM! The pub doors fly open, REVEAL Main Street, where

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: ... and FOOTPRINTS appear in the snow. HARRY'S POV ENDS.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You're sure about this, Harry? This is very advanced magic. Well beyond Ordinary Wizarding Level.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: If Black can fight the Dementors, I need to know how too.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Very well. The spell I'm going to teach you is called the Patronus Charm. Ever hear of it?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: A Patronus is a kind of positive force. For the wizard who can conjure one, the Patronus works something like a shield. The Dementor feeds on it instead of him. Just then, the trunk RATTLES VIOLENTLY. As Harry's eyes wander, Lupin SNAPS his fingers, brings his attention back.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But in order for it to work, you must think of a memory. And not just any. This memory needs to be a very happy one. And powerful.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Got something? Good. Let it fill you up. Lose yourself in it. Then speak the incantation: Expecto Patronum. Without your wand...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Expecto Patronum... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Right then. Shall we?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Concentrate, Harry. Concentrate... As Lupin FLINGS open the case, Harry OPENS HIS EYES. In the sun's BLOOD-LIGHT, the Dementor looks particularly horrific.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Expecto... Patronum... The torches on the wall FLICKER as a CHILL BREEZE fills the chamber. A SCREAM ECHOES distantly. Harry's hand trembles. His eyes begin to roll up...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Expecto... Expecto...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Here! CRACK! -- the Dementor mutates into a SILVERY WHITE ORB.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Riddikulus!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Quickly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That's one nasty Dementor.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Boggart, Harry. The real thing would be much, much worse. Just out of interest, what were you thinking of? What memory did you choose? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The first time I rode a broom.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That's not good enough, Harry. Not nearly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: There's another. It's not happy exactly. I mean, it is. It's the happiest I've ever felt. But it's... complicated.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Is it strong?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Then let's try it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Think, Harry, think --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Just do it!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Expecto Patronum!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Riddikulus! CRACK! The Dementor vanishes. Harry's arm drops. Slack. Lupin eyes Harry with a kind of awe. His voice barely a WHISPER. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Well done.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I think I've had enough. For today.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: So you know, Harry: You'd have given your father a run for his money. And, believe me, that's saying something.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I was thinking of him. And Mum. Seeing their faces. They're just talking to me. Just... talking. That was the memory I chose. I don't even know if it's real...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But it's the best I have.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Aaaahhhh!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Everybody out! The others flee. Harry faces the HULKING SHADOW, wand poised.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Show yourself. Crash! The water GLASS SHATTERS on the floor and Scabbers darts past Harry's bare feet, chased by Crookshanks. Seizing the moment, the SILHOUETTE grasps the curtains and swings through the open window, plunging into the night. Harry rushes to the window, looks down.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ron! Ron!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Is he gone?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I don't know how he got in! I was a bit busy dodging his knife! Just then, a curiously content Crookshanks wends his way through Ron's legs.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: And this bloody cat ate my rat!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That's a lie!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It is not and you bloody well know it! PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Silence! McGonagall turns then and everyone follows her eye to Sir Cadogan who, sensing the attention, perks up instantly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Sir Cadogan. Is it possible that you let a mysterious man enter Gryffindor Tower tonight?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Certainly, good lady! He had the password. Had the whole week's, in fact. On a little piece of paper. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Which abysmally foolish person wrote down the passwords and then proceeded to lose them! Every eye shifts once more: Neville. McGonagall sighs. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Is it always going to be you, Longbottom? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I'm afraid so, ma'am. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL (to the group at large) While we know Sirius Black is gone tonight, I think you can safely assume he will, at some future time, attempt to return. Let me be clear. You are not to move about the castle alone. And you are not to write down the password! Understood! A collective nod of the head. McGonagall gives the ties of her robe a sharp tug, collects herself, and exits. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Very well then. Go to bed. As the students drift off, Ron casts a last angry glance toward Hermione, who now holds Crookshanks in her arms.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I could've killed him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I find it astonishing that someone who prides herself on being so logical can be in such denial.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry. Will you explain to your friend Ronald that he has absolutely no proof whatsoever that my sweet, unassuming cat ate his shabby, decidedly decrepit rat. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No, I won't. Know why? Because I don't care about your stupid rat! I don't care about your stupid cat! I've got few other things on my mind right now!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Really? Wasn't you had to roll under the bed last night to avoid getting cut to ribbons! A person could die being your friend, Harry!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: How'd it go, Hagrid?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Buckbeak liked London.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I meant the hearing.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Oh. That. Well, I got up an' said my bit -- You know, how Buckbeak was a good Hippogriff an' as long as yeh treated 'im with respect, he'd treat you the same. Then Lucius Malfoy got up an' said his bit -- you know, how Buckbeak was a deadly dangerous beast that no teacher in their righ' mind would expose their students to... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (dreading it) And...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You mustn't blame yourself, Hagrid.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Draco. It's him the Committee should punish. It's him they should send off to the forest, not Buckbeak.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Buckbeak's not going back to the forest...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (dreading the answer) Where's he going, Hagrid?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I solemnly swear that I am up to no good. The crooked corridors and serpentine passageways of Hogwarts radiate across the parchment, then... a TINY DOT catches Harry's eye. He frowns. It reads: "Peter Pettigrew."

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: "Harry Potter" and "Peter Pettigrew" draw closer and closer.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: ... reflected in a MIRROR. He BLINKS, startled, then glances back down at the map. Pettigrew has moved past him. Confused, Harry wheels, casts his wand along the walls.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Watch it there, boy!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Mischief managed!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Potter. What're you doing wandering the corridors at night?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I was... I was... sleepwalking... A sneer curdles the corners of Snape's lips. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: How extraordinarily like your father you are, Potter. He, too, was exceedingly arrogant. Strutting about the castle --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: My dad didn’t strut. Nor do I. Now, if you don't mind, I'd appreciate you lowering your wand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Turn out your pockets.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Turn out your pockets! Finally, Harry obliges. Seeing the map, Snape's eyes glitter.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: And this. What might it be?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Spare bit of parchment...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Really... (poising his wand) Reveal your secret! To Harry's horror, words begin to appear. Snape studies him, a sadistic half-smile on his lips. Turns the map his way.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Read it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: 'Messrs. Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot and Prongs offer their compliments to Professor Snape and...'

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Go on. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: '... and request that he keep his abnormally large nose out of other people's business.'

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (smile drooping) Why you insolent little --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Professor...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Well, well. Lupin. Out for a little walk in the moonlight, are we?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry? You all right?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That remains to be seen. I've just now confiscated a rather curious artifact from Mr. Potter. Take a look, Lupin. This is supposed to be your area of expertise.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Clearly, it's full of Dark Magic.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I seriously doubt that, Severus. It looks to me as if it merely insults anyone who tries to read it. I suspect it's a Zonko product. Nevertheless, I shall pursue any hidden qualities it may possess. As you say, it's my area of expertise. Come, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I don't know how this map came to be in your possession, Harry, but I'm astounded that you didn't turn it in. Did you ever stop to think that this -- in the hands of

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Your father didn't set much store by rules either. But he and your mother did give their lives to save yours. Gambling their sacrifice by walking about the castle unprotected, with a killer on the loose, strikes me as a poor way to repay them. I won't cover up for you again, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Professor. Just so you know, I don't think the map always works. Earlier, it showed someone in the castle. Someone I know to be dead.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (only half-listening) And who was that, Harry?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Peter Pettigrew.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Very well. I'd like you to return to your dormitory now. Oh, and Harry? Don't take any detours. As Harry looks back, Lupin taps the map.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: If you do. I'll know.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: murky with smoke.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Relax... Let your mind... go...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Crystal-gazing requires that you clear the Inner Eye. Only then, will you... See. Oh my, what do we have here...? As Trelawney eyes Harry's crystal, Hermione rolls her eyes.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Here we go again. It's the Grim! It's the Grim!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (eyes narrowing) My dear, from the moment you first arrived in my class, I sensed that you did not possess the proper spirit for the noble art of Divination. You may be young in years, but the heart that beats beneath your bosom is as shriveled as an old maid's, your soul as dry as the pages of the books to which you so desperately cleave. Stung, Hermione starts to reply, but -- remarkably -- seems incapable of a single word. Rising gracelessly, she exits, knocking her crystal ball to the floor. Harry watches curiously as the ball rolls slowly OUT the doorway...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: 'In late spring, one of our number will leave us forever!' You knew, Professor! You saw.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: On these occasions, I take no joy in my gift, Miss Brown.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: She's gone mental, Hermione has. I mean, not that she wasn't always mental, but now it's out in the open for everyone to see...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Professor Trelawney --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: S-sorry?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Tonight, when the clock strikes twelve, the servant shall break free. He and his Master shall be reunited. It cannot be prevented. Trelawney smiles savagely... then her head falls forward. When it rises, she blinks, eyes the hand that lies upon Harry's shoulder. Her hand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: So sorry, dear boy. Did you say something? Her voice is normal once more. Harry shakes his head.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No. Nothing.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I can't believe they're going to kill Buckbeak! It's too horrible.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It just got worse.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Malfoy, along with Crabbe and Goyle, lurks within a grouping of monolithic menhirs, BINOCULARS in hand, spying on Hagrid, who stands in the pumpkin patch, tossing dead ferrets to Buckbeak. Hagrid wipes his eyes, lopes into the hut.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Did you see the big, fat blubbering oaf?! Oh, this is going to be rich. Did I tell you, Father said I can keep the head -- (looking up) Ah. Come to see the show? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You... foul... loathsome... evil... little cockroach... Malfoy stumbles back against a tree, cross-eyed with fear as Hermione jabs the tip of her wand under his nose, when...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hermione! No!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: He's not worth it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That felt good.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Look at 'em. Loves the smell o' the trees when the wind blows...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I say we set him free.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (shaking his head) They'd know I did it. And tha' would only get Dumbledore in trouble. Gonna come down, yeh know. Says he wants ter be with me when it... when it happens. Great man, Dumbledore. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: We'll stay with you too, Hagrid.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yeh will not! Think I wan' yeh seein' a thing like this! No. Yeh'll drink yer tea an' be off. But before yeh do -- I wan' ter see you an' Ron shake hands, Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Thin' I haven' seen 'ow it's bin betw'n you two? Go on now... Reluctantly, Harry and Ron extend their hands. Shake.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Good. Now then. Ron, I wan' ter see you give Hermione a hug. HERMIONE/RON What!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Go on! You two've been at it all year. An' I'm sick o' it. Acutely uncomfortable, Hermione and Ron step forward and perform perhaps the most awkward hug Hogwarts has ever seen.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Crikey, tha's jus' abou' the most pathetic hug I e'er seen. But yeh did it, an' tha's wha' matters. There's jus' one other thing...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I'm not kissing Fang if that's what you're thinking... Hearing his name, FANG -- Hagrid's giant boarhound -- THUMPS his tail happily on the floor. Hagrid turns, takes the lid from a FLOUR TIN, A TINY HEAD, ears flecked with powder, emerges.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Scabbers! You're alive! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yeh should keep a closer eye on yer pets, Ron.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I think you owe someone an apology.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Right. Next time I see Crookshanks, I'll let him know.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I meant me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Crikey. Here we go agin... SMASH! A GLASS JAR on the SHELF SHATTERS. As Hermione scoops up a JAGGED STAR-SHAPED STONE, a second STONE bounces off the back of Harry's head.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ow!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hagrid... Everyone turns. Looks. Dumbledore and Fudge approach. Behind them, in a fluttering shroud of CROWS, the Executioner follows, axe at his side. Hagrid begins to panic.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yeh got to go! It's almost dark. Anyone sees yeh outside the castle it'll be trouble! Big trouble! 'Specially you, Harry -- BANG! BANG! BANG! The door SHAKES. Hagrid stiffens in fear. Harry reaches up, puts his finger to Hagrid's trembling lips, speaks softly to the others.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: C'mon.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Nothing, I just thought I saw... Never mind.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: DING! The ax hangs seemingly forever, etched against the sky, then drops from sight. A SICKENING CHOP! fouls the breeze and Ron and Harry stare toward the trees in numb disbelief. Hermione, face turned away, trembles... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ron! No! As Ron pelts after Scabbers, Harry and Hermione give chase.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry. You do realize what tree this is...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Now behave yourself.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That's not good. (yelling) Ron! Run!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry! Run! Harry's eyes shift. Bounding toward him in the gathering gloom is an ENORMOUS, PALE-EYED, JET-BLACK... DOG. Harry shields himself when... the dog LEAPS CLEAR OVER HIM.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Aaaahhh! The dog's TEETH flash and -- SNAP! -- close on Ron's foot, dragging him TOWARDS THE TRUNK like a rag doll. Instantly, Harry dashes forward, leaps out, and grabs

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I've got you --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hold on, Ron! But it's no use. The dog is too powerful. Harry glances around desperately, then finds himself looking directly in Ron's eyes. He can read his mind.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No, Ron... One by one, Ron releases his fingers from Harry's forearm. Sacrificing himself.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Nooooo!!! But Ron closes his eyes, releases his hands fully, and... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: As one, they rise. Run back toward the gap in the tree. A branch swoops down.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Haaaaaaarrrrrr!!!!!!!!!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: ... turns CRYSTAL CLEAR just in time to see Hermione

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Thanks.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Don't mention it. Lumos. As the tip of Harry's WAND GLOWS, reveals a long, snaking tunnel.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Where do you suppose this goes?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I have a hunch. I just hope I'm wrong...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: We're in the Shrieking Shack, aren't we?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Nox. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ron! You're okay --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The dog -- where's the --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It's a trap, Harry. He's the dog. He's an Animagus...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: If you want to kill Harry, you'll -- you'll... have to kill us, too!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No. Only one will die tonight.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Then it'll be you!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry! No! Just then, FOOTSTEPS sound. Black wheels toward the door, edgy. Harry eyes Black, wand hand shaking violently. As Black turns back, he stops, regards Harry cautiously.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Going to kill me, Harry?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yes. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Looking a bit ragged, aren't we, Sirius? Finally the skin reflects the madness within.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You'd know all about the madness within, wouldn't you, Remus? The two regard each other, the moment taut with tension, then Lupin steps forward and... EMBRACES Black like a brother.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No! I trusted you! I covered up for you. And all this time you've been his friend! (pointing) He's a werewolf! That's why he's been missing classes!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: How long have you known?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Since Professor Snape set the essay.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You're the brightest witch of your age I've ever met, Hermione.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yes, you glow like the sun. And you howl at the moon. Enough talk! He dies. Now. If you won't do it with me, Remus, I'll do it alone.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Wait, Sirius -- (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I did my waiting! Twelve years of it! In Azkaban! Trust me, you wouldn't have lasted a week!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: All right then. As you wish...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You betrayed my parents! You sold them to Voldemort!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It's a lie! I never would've betrayed James and Lily!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry! You've got to listen --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Did he listen! When my mother was dying! Did he hear her screaming!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No! I wasn't there! And I'll regret it the rest of my life! Harry's eyes flash to Black's, glittering with pain.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Someone else betrayed your parents, Harry. Someone in this room right now. Someone who, until quite recently, I believed to be dead.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: He's as good as dead.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What're you talking about? There's nobody here. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Oh yes there is... Black turns then, to Ron, and CROONS in a cruel sing song:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Come out, come out, Peter Come out, come out and play...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You're mad... Harry's eyes shift from Ron's FACE to his HANDS, where Scabbers TWISTS violently. As a curious expression befalls Harry, Lupin and Black, as one, raise their wands... when.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Expelliarmus! The wands fly from their hands. The others turn, find

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (eying Black) Ah, vengeance is sweet. How I hoped I'd be the one to catch you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Severus --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I told Dumbledore you were helping your old friend into the castle. And here's the proof.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Brilliant! And -- as usual -- dead wrong. Now give us our wands back. Remus and I have a bit of unfinished business to tend to. As Black approaches, Snape puts his wand to Black's neck.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Give me a reason. I beg you.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Don't be a fool, Severus! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Quiet, Sirius!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (clucking his tongue) Listen to you two. Quarreling like an old married couple. The creature and the criminal.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Piss off.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Witty as ever I see. Tell me, will you be so irreverent when I turn you over to the Dementors? (as Black reacts) Do I detect a flicker of fear? One can only imagine what it must be like to endure the Dementor's Kiss. It's said to be unbearable to witness. But I'll do my best.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: After you. As the others start to go, Harry glances at the table where Lupin has left Harry's wand. In a flash, it's in his hand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Expelliarmus!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry. You attacked a teacher.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You said Peter before. Peter who?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Pettigrew. He was at school with us. We thought he was a friend. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No. Pettigrew's dead. He killed him. As Harry points at Black, Black laughs mirthlessly.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I thought so, too. Until you mentioned seeing Pettigrew on the Map.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The Map was lying then --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The Map never lies. Pettigrew's alive. And he's right there. Black points at... Ron. Ron goes white with fear.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: M-me? It's lunatic...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Not you, you idiot. Your rat.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Scabbers? Scabbers has been in my family for --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (bitterly) Twelve years. A curiously long life for a common garden rat. He's missing a toe, isn't he? Black unfolds a dog-eared clipping from The Daily Prophet: it shows Ron in Egypt with his family, Scabbers on his shoulder.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: So what?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: All they could find of Pettigrew was his --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Finger. Dirty coward cut it off so everyone would think he was dead. Then he transformed into a rat. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Show me.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What are you going to do to him?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Together. With that, Lupin takes out his wand and, as one, he and Black cast a stream of BLUE-WHITE LIGHT. Scabbers twists madly in midair, then -- FLASH! -- transforms into... a very short man with thinning hair and grubby hands.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: S-Sirius... R-Remus. My old friends. Neither speaks. Pettigrew's small, watery eyes dart toward the windows and door. Suddenly, he makes a break for it, but Sirius merely shoves him back.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry! Look at you! Y-you look just like your father. Like James. We were the best of friends, he and I --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Shut up!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I didn't mean to! The Dark Lord, you have no idea the weapons he possesses! Ask yourself what you would have done, Sirius. What would you have done! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Died! Died rather than betray my friends! And you should have realized, Peter, if Voldemort didn't kill you...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: We would.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No... please... you can't... (eyes darting, finding) Ron! Haven't I been a good friend? A good pet? You won't let them kill me, will you? I was your rat...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Sweet girl. Clever girl. Surely you won't let them... As one, Lupin and Black raise their wands, point them directly into Pettigrew's face. He shrinks back trembling, closing his eyes in fear, when...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No. Pettigrew's lids lift. Lupin and Black turn. Staggered.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry, this man...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I know what he is. But we'll take him to the castle.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Bless you, boy! Bless you --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Get off! I said we'd take you to the castle. After that, the Dementors can have you. 115 OMITTED 115 & & 116 116

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Turn me into a maggot. A dung beetle. A Flobberworm! Anything but the Dementors... (as Ron emerges) Ron! Haven't I been a good friend? A good pet? You won't let them kill me, will you? I was your rat... As Ron draws back in disgust, a sleepwalking Snape BUMPS his head against a low limb. Hermione turns to Harry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Don't worry. He's under the Somnambulist Charm. It's primarily used to transport the seriously deranged. As Harry nods, Pettigrew's pleading eyes find Hermione.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Sweet girl. Clever girl. Surely you won't let them...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Beautiful, isn't it? I'll never forget the first time I walked through those doors. It'll be nice to do it again. Freely. (turning to Harry) That was a noble thing you did back there. He doesn't deserve it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I don't reckon my father'd want his best friends to become killers for a worthless piece of vermin like Pettigrew. Besides: Dead, the truth dies with him. Alive... you're free. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I don't know if you know, Harry, but when you were born, James and Lily made me your guardian...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I know.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: And, well, I'll understand if you choose to stay with your aunt and uncle, but, so you know, you could --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Come live with you? When!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Soon as my name's cleared...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Remus, old friend... did you take your potion tonight? Lupin, twitching, SHAKES HIS HEAD. Pettigrew's eyes dart, taking in the situation, then slowly shift, note the WAND trembling in LUPIN'S LENGTHENING FIST.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Run. All of you. Now. But none of them do, transfixed, watching as BRISTLES POKE THROUGH LUPIN'S SKIN. Black steps forward, wraps his arms around his friend, presses his mouth to his ear.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You know the man you truly are, Remus. This flesh is only flesh. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No! (flashing his wand) Expelliarmus! Lupin's wand flies from Pettigrew's hand and he FREEZES. Then slowly turns. Face blank, eyes closed, he... GRINS HIDEOUSLY. Transforms. Stunned, Harry watches a RAT dart into the night. A HOWL PIERCES THE AIR and Harry wheels. With a shrug,

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Professor...? The WEREWOLF'S eyes blaze. Long teeth glitter. Then... a horrifying GROWL ERUPTS from its throat. Harry and

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Out of the way! ... and finds the werewolf preparing to pounce. Leaping to his feet, Snape draws his wand and steps forward, shielding Hermione, Harry and Ron. The WEREWOLF HOWLS, SPRINTS forward, when -- SWOOSH! -- a GIANT DOG (Black) intercepts it in MIDAIR. They hit the ground in a FIERCE TANGLE of FLASHING TEETH, a single horrible flailing beast. Again and again, the dog pushes the werewolf back, but the werewolf is too strong...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Sirius! The DOG YELPS, ROARS in pain, and the werewolf flings it into the tall grass. As it charges after, Harry pushes past Snape, dashes into the night. Hermione makes to follow, but Snape holds her back. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Harry!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: NO!!! Desperately, Harry plucks a THICK BRANCH from the ground and hurls it with all his might. Bull's-eye. The werewolf freezes. Turns. Begins to move toward...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Please, Professor. Stop... It's me. Suddenly... a HOWL pierces the night. The werewolf falters, cocking its head toward the forest.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Sirius!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Sirius! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No... No! (drawing his wand) Expecto... Patronum! A thin silvery wisp weeps from Harry's wand, hovering like a VEIL, but the Dementors continue to come. Harry places his hand on Black's HEAVING HEART, poises his wand once more:

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Expecto... Patronum...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I saw my dad.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Listen, Harry. They've captured Sirius. Any minute the Dementors are going to perform the Kiss.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The Kiss...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It's what Dementors do to those they want to destroy. They clamp their jaws over the victim's mouth and... suck out his soul.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You mean, they're going to kill Sirius?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No. It's worse. Much worse. You go on living. But you have no memory. No sense of self. You're just a shall. An empty shell... As Harry reacts, the door opens and Dumbledore enters.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Headmaster! You've got to stop them! They've got the wrong man!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It's true, sir. Sirius is innocent --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It's Scabbers who did it! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Scabbers...?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: My rat, sir. Only he's not really a rat. Well, he was a rat. You see, he used to be my brother Percy's --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: The point is... we know the truth. Please, sir, you must believe us.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I do, Miss Granger. But I'm sorry to say the word of three thirteen- year-old wizards will convince few others. A child's voice, however honest and true, is meaningless to those who have forgotten how to listen. As Dumbledore turns to the window, a SHOOTING STAR plummets silently through the sky.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Ah... a shooting star. If ever one was to make a wish, now would be the time. But time, I'm afraid, is precisely our problem... On cue, the MIDNIGHT BELL begins to CHIME... DING!... DING!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Mysterious thing, time. Powerful. And, when meddled with... dangerous. Sirius Black is in the topmost cell of the Dark Tower. (to Hermione) You know the laws, Miss Granger. You must not be seen. And you would, I feel, do well to return before this last chime. If not... well, the consequences are really too ghastly to discuss. Three turns should do it, I think. If you succeed, more than one innocent life may be spared tonight. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: By the way, when in doubt, I find retracing my steps to be a wise place to begin... Good luck.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What in bloody hell was all that about? But Hermione doesn’t reply, instead looping the pendant's long chain around Harry's neck as well as her own.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Sorry, Ron. But seeing as you can't walk... As Ron and Harry exchange a curious glance, the BELL continues to CHIME -- DING! DING! -- and...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: TIME REVERSES in a dizzying backward blur, as if a tape were being rewound, every moment that occurred in the hospital room flickering by at a dizzying speed while, outside the window, darkness gives way to dusk and the sun "un-sets," returning to its place low on the horizon. At this point, the TIME REVERSAL ends and the room is... Empty. Except for Harry and Hermione. As Hermione unloops the necklace, Harry glances around in confusion.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What just happened? Where's Ron?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Seven-thirty. Where were we at seven-thirty?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Huh? Dunno... going to Hagrid's? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Come on! We can't be seen!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hermione! Will you please tell me what it is we're doing?!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But that... that's... us. This is not... normal. INTERCUT BETWEEN BRIDGE AND SUNDIAL GARDEN. Dumbfounded, Harry turns. Hermione holds up the HOURGLASS.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: This is a Time-Turner, Harry. McGonagall gave it to me first term. This is how I've been getting to my lessons all year.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You mean, we've gone back in time?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yes. Dumbledore wanted us to return to this moment. Clearly something happened he wants us to change. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (in admiration) Good punch.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hurry! Malfoy's coming!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Not a word of this to anyone, understood! I'll get that jumped- up Mudblood one of these days. Mark my words... Eyes narrowed in anger, Hermione leans out, reaches up, and sends Malfoy SPRAWLING. As Harry pulls her back, Malfoy looks around in confusion, then dashes off with the others. Seconds later, Harry emerges, marvels at the sight of himself and Hermione, and Ron heading down the slope to Hagrid's hut. His eyes shift to the pumpkin patch.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Look. Buckbeak's still alive.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Of course! Remember what

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Buckbeak? But... how will saving Buckbeak help Sirius?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: We'll see.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Nothing.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Here they come. I better hurry.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No! Fudge has to see Buckbeak before we steal him. Otherwise, he'll think Hagrid set him free!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That's Pettigrew -- As he starts to rise, Hermione grabs him, speaks fiercely.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No, Harry! You can't!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hermione, that's the man who betrayed my parents! You don't expect me to just sit here...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yes! You Must! (pointing inside) Harry, you're in Hagrid's hut right now. If you go bursting inside, you'll think you've gone mad. Awful things can happen when wizards meddle with time. We can't be seen.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Fudge is coming and... we're not leaving... why aren't we leaving? Just then... on the ground beside her... Hermione notices a JAGGED STAR-SHAPED STONE. Instantly, she grabs it, rises, and hurls it through the OPEN WINDOW. SMASH! The sound of a GLASS JAR SHATTERING is heard within the hut.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Are you mad?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: That hurt.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Sorry. Crows begin to drop atop the roof. Fudge's party arrives, RAPS on the door.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: C'mon. Any minute now we're going to be coming out the back door. Quickly, Hermione and Harry dash into the trees directly behind... just in time to see themselves -- along with

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Is that really what my hair looks like from the back?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Shhh!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Nothing, I just thought I saw... Never mind. (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Now, Harry! As Harry vaults into the patch, the CROWS STIR, CAWING at his ankles, pecking at his feet.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: 'It is the decision of the Committee for the Disposal of Dangerous Creatures that the Hippogriff Buckbeak, hereafter called the condemned, shall be executed this day at sundown...' As Harry approaches, Buckbeak studies him curiously, a ferret leg dangling from his beak. Harry bows. SLURP! The ferret leg disappears and Buckbeak returns Harry's nod. As Harry takes Buckbeak's chain... a flint-eyed crow PECKS his hand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Get away!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: 'The Committee's appointed executioner shall dispatch the condemned by means of beheading...'

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: C'mon, Buckbeak. Come on... Buckbeak refuses to move.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: 'As witnessed below.' You sign here, Hagrid. Very well, gentlemen. Let's step outside, shall we... DING! The Hogwarts BELL begins to TOLL. Harry and

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Excuse me, Minister. I believe I must sign as well... (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Here, Beaky... Come and get the nice dead ferret... yum yum...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Professor Dippet had those blackberries planted when he was Headmaster...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Let's get this over with, shall we?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But... where is it? I just saw the beast not moments ago -- Hagrid?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Beaky... Hearing Hagrid's husky voice, BUCKBEAK strains at his tether, WHIMPERS eerily. Hermione tosses him another ferret.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: (a hint of amusement) How extraordinary! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Come now, Dumbledore. Someone's obviously released him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Professor, I swear! I didn't!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: I'm quite sure the Minister isn't suggesting that you had anything to do with it, Hagrid. How could you? You've been with us all along.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: We should search the grounds --

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Search the skies if you must, Minister. In the meantime, I wouldn't say no to a cup of tea, Hagrid. Or... a large brandy. (to the Executioner) It seems your services will no longer be required. The Executioner lifts his blade and -- with a brutal fury -- plunges it into the flesh of a PUMPKIN with a SICKENING CHOP! The CROWS SCATTER to the skies.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Now what?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: We save Sirius.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: And we do that... how?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No idea.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Look. It's Lupin. As the Whomping Willow begins to thrash, its violence oddly muted at this distance, Lupin takes a stick, pokes a knot on the trunk. Instantly, the Willow calms.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Wait until Fred and George hear about that one.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Here comes Snape. As Lupin disappears into the gap at the base of the tree,

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: And now we wait.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Now we wait.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: 'Least someone's enjoying himself.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Hermione...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Yes? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Before. Down by the lake. When I was with Sirius... I did see someone... that someone made the Dementors go away...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: With a Patronus. I heard Snape telling Dumbledore when we were taken to the hospital. According to him, only a really powerful wizard could have conjured it.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It was my Dad.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It was my Dad who conjured the Patronus.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: But, Harry, your Dad's...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Dead. I know. I'm just telling you what I saw.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Here we come.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You see Sirius talking to me? He's asking me to come live with him.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Really? (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: When we free him, I'll never have to go back to the Dursley's. I'm going to tell him I'd like to live someplace in the country. I think he'd like that, after all those years in Azkaban. We don't need a big place and I can help him... A HOWL pierces the night. Hermione glances toward the Willow.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: It's happened. Lupin's transformed.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Which means Pettigrew is slipping safely into the night. While we just stand here... A FIERCE GROWLING is heard as twin silhouettes -- the DOG and the WEREWOLF -- bound into the tall grass. Harry watches himself appear, hurl the stick as before. The werewolf turns, begins to stalk... OWWWWWWWWW! Harry wheels, sees Hermione, hands cupped to her mouth, making a loud HOWL. He covers her mouth.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Saving your life.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Thanks. But we have to move.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Why?

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Because that werewolf you just called is running right this way.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Buckbeak. We've got to find him. ... and REVEALS the werewolf, fifteen feet past, waiting. As Harry and Hermione step out, they freeze. The werewolf poises itself, preparing to pounce, when... SKREEEK! The TREES shake with the fury of a HURRICANE and Buckbeak charges into the clearing, screening Harry and Hermione. The WEREWOLF SNARLS ANGRILY, makes to charge. With lightning-fast reflexes, Buckbeak's claws slash the air... only inches from the werewolf's face. The werewolf stops, eyes glittering with rage, then... HOWLS. Turning, it vanishes into the forest.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Poor Professor Lupin is having a really tough night... Just then, a CHILL WIND rises... The LEAVES of the trees TREMBLE... EERIE SHADOWS flutter over the moon, greasy as smoke... Dementors.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Let's go.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Looking UPWARD... THROUGH the trees as the sky wheels by, Dementors streaking IN AND OUT OF VIEW.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: This is horrible...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: Don't worry. My Dad will come... Right there... you'll see... he'll come... any minute... he'll conjure the Patronus

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No one's coming, Harry...

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: HE WILL! He will come!

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: No one's coming! You're dying, both of you... and no one's coming! Harry's face changes. A riddle unravels. He draws his wand.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: HARRY, NO! (CONTINUED)

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: EXPECTO PATRONUM! A WISP of SILVER escapes his wand, hovering like a MIST, then BLOOMS MAGNIFICENTLY. The trees EXPLODE WITH LIGHT. The Lake BLAZES with reflected FIRE. Harry stands utterly still, wand extended to the heavens. Across the lake, the Dementors retreat. Harry waits, still as a statue, until each and every one is gone. Then he simply lets his arm drop.

Movie: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Dialogue: You were right, Hermione. It wasn't my dad I saw earlier. It was... me. I saw myself conjuring the Patronus before. I knew I could do it this time, because... because I'd already done it. Does that make sense?
